column1: [SAK-1958] users not properly updated when provider in use
column6:
1) after deleting a roster in site info, the users from that roster still show in site info
2) after adding a roster in site info, the users don't show in gradebook
3) when users change in University data, gradebook and mail aren't updated

See the attachment for the patch
column10: users not properly updated when provider in use
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column55:
From Charles Hedrick:

I've since found other issues. I'm attaching two new diffs. Here are notes on what they do:

diff.1 siteaction

don't produce externalrealmid with [] syntax, since sample provider doesn't understand it. Just list all sections separated by +

force realmupdate in updatecourse. Some of the update is done in realmedit and the rest in commit. The problelm is that commit uses data set up in realmedit, some of which is out of date after changing the extrnalrealmid. So you need to do it a second time.

cache results of getCourseMembers, to avoid banging on LDAP

in getparticipant, don't add users who have are provided and have disappeared from LDAP. They would come in looking like they are manually added, and if the user does an "Update" they will go in permanently. So skip these users, and remember that you've done it. Force a realm update if any have occured. Otherwise the list we're going to present to the user is misleading.

diff.2, dbrealmservice

for getusers and getroles, do a realm update every hour. don't want to go to LDAP for every request, or we'll kill it. But if we don't do it occasionally, students miss emails because they haven't been added to the realm yet.

column1: [SAK-1955] Imported Assessments not grading
column6:
Imported assessments are not grading.
Create an assessment, excport it, import it, then release it. When a site maintainer goes to view scores, every test has a 0

=========================================================================================================================================

Lance,
I think we might have found the problem.
Megan is right that there are scores in the core Assessments, 'cuz it's getting the scores from sam_item_t table. (It was mind boggling to me too, and took me a while to figure it out). However, the sam_answer_t table doesn't have scores, and that's what Grading uses in autoscoring.
Again this bug only happens in imported assessments. Do you know for sure if this particular assessment is imported ?

Btw, Ed is looking at the import at the moment, 'cuz he's the expert in this area.

thanks,
Lydia

column1: [SAK-1946] Gradebook rendering issues: table cell alignment, scrollbars
column6:
Scrollbars in Gradebook are due to unique nesting in the JSP. The nesting used by all other tools (legacy and otherwise, excluding Sam), is the following:

<f:view>
<div class="portletBody">
<form />
</div>
</f:view>

<div class="portletBody"> should be the only child of <f:view> - this will eliminate the scrollbars.

  • - - - - - - -

Cell alignment problems due to JSF limitations in styling specific cells and headers are ameliorated in the overview view if the following line is included in the gradebook.css:

table.narrowTable td.rightpadded {
text-align:right;
vertical-align:bottom;
padding-right:6em !important;
}
column10: Gradebook rendering issues: table cell alignment, scrollbars
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
Just to capture all these trivial issues in same place.

The standard header list or sak tools starts with <h3>, not <h2>

column1: [SAK-1921] Lost Functionality: List Activities with Descriptions
column6:
In 1.5, the List Activities view of the schedule included the entire description of each schedule item. Now, in 2.0, the list view is truncated to a single line of text (see style-guide SCH-1e List View). There is no option to expand or expose the entire description, which renders the view useless in the following scenarios:

1-- Instructor uses the schedule as a dynamic syllabus. Students expect to browse the whole document on one page. They may also intend to print it out. In training, I have in the past drawn particular attention to this very useful view.

2-- Project group uses the schedule tool to record meeting notes and upcoming agenda items. A list view that allows members to scan the various past notes and future agenda items can be incredibly helpful for processing project development.

3-- Site owner uses schedule tool extensively but doesn't remember which date includes particular information. With a list view that displays entire descriptions, the owner can visually scan or Find Text to search the page for a particular string.

These scenarios are multiplied exponentially when schedule items include attachments.

Our users could really, really use a toggle to display all descriptions. The Announcements tool has this feature built in at least as an ower Option. It is at least as useful here in the Schedule list. We've only received two or three support requests about the lost functionality, but I suspect many more don't yet know what they're missing.
column10: Lost Functionality: List Activities with Descriptions
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: We should replace the lost list as a start, and then add the ability to open/close the descriptions as an option when we can.
column90:
Hello, Peter, wherever you are!

Is this getting pushed back because Joanne is leaving/left? It's lost functionality that instructors mention pretty regularly and it is a make-or-break feature for some to use the schedule tool... they are looking for a (printable) view-all details view. If they're going to put that much time into loading schedule items, they want it to do double-duty as a syllabus of sorts.

[dlp]
column95: Is this still an active issue?
column99: Currently the list view allows the user to select the description to the display the full event (inclluding the full description).

column107: The printable view now inclueds the entire description, and one can click on the event in the list view to get the description too. Checked on 012, qa1-za

column1: [SAK-1896] sakai.synoptic.email needed
column6:
Announcements, Discussion, and Chat currently have a mini version (sakai.synoptic.toolname) that pulls the most recent activity in these tools for display on a site's Home Page. Since some faculty use both the Announcements Tool and the Email Archive to distribute course information, we need a similar summary tool (page?) for the Email Archive that can be placed on the Home page. This could be a fourth entry on the Home page.

In short, the behavior should mimic the sakai.synoptic.announcement Tool but pull content from the Email Archive Tool.

If anyone would like to create one of these, I'm happy to serve as the contact for questions. bwheeler at iu.edu.

column1: [SAK-1892] Sites Search Returns Misleading Results
column6:
If you search for a class number only, say 441, you not only return sites associated with that number:

ECON 441
PSYCH 441

and any site that includes 441 in the description (e.g., ECON 441 is a pre-requsite), but also any site that has the random string 441 in the site ID. That makes the search results look inaccurate. In the case of a search this morning at CTools, over half of the results seemed to be based on site ID.

This is particulary troublesome to users since they tend to search by simply the number when they aren't sure of the official subject code designation.

Can we refrain from searching on this randomly generated string?! [dlp]

column1: [SAK-1886] Using end time to set the event duration in calendar has problems when end time is 12:xx
column6:
User reports:
----------
I've found a frustrating snag in the Schedule function. The final exam for my
course (FR 231 All site) is Dec. 19th from 10:30am-12:30pm (after noon, hence
PM), but when I enter that, it thinks the exam is 14 hours and displays it on
the 20th as well!!! The only thing I can do is not to give an end time. It's
okay, but just somewhat annoying that I can't show the ending time.
---------

The problem happens when the end time is chosen to set the event (rather than duration). Create an event by starting with a start time of 10:30. Then set the end time. If you pick 12, then 30, then switch the am to pm, the duration gets set to 14 hours instead of 2. It's easy to fix by just setting the duration to 2, but there's something buggy in the calculation when changing from am to pm.
column10: Using end time to set the event duration in calendar has problems when end time is 12:xx
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Will this be fixed for 2.1.0?
column90:
This problem is not yet fixed and it looks like it is happening in other modules. Setting Delivery dates in Samigo also has this (dangerous) bug.
Besides the described bug, there's also a bug when translating to/from the calendar widget.
The calendar widget used to select/edit dates, has the correct 00-23 hours format. The problem is the conversion from the widget to the samigo delivery dates text fields (11:00 => 11 AM (OK), 12:00 => 12 AM (should be 12 PM), 13:00 => 1PM (OK)).
column95: Nuno, the selection of data and time is handled differently be Schedule and Samigo, so I've created new issues for the problems you report in your comment above. SAK-3584 Closed will track the original problem describe in this issue, which is also occuring in Samigo; the inability to use 12:30pm as an end time. SAK-3586 Closed will track the other problem you found in Samigo with 12:XX times not being properly converted to 12:XX PM.
column99: Fix is in svn r6617.
column103: verified on I.E on MySQL (QA1-UK) and Firefox on Oracle (QA3-US)

column1: [SAK-1879] wierdness in DbRealmService:getusers

getusers realm /site/aa0308d4-d48f-49cf-0069-e7d43485885b
getusers realm !site.helper
getusers realm /gradebook/aa0308d4-d48f-49cf-0069-e7d43485885b/main

This is from
for (Iterator i = realms.iterator(); i.hasNext()

{ String roleRealm = (String) i.next(); fields[pos++] = roleRealm; System.out.println("getusers realm " + roleRealm); }

column1: [SAK-1876] after maintainer removes a provider course, its members still show

      • .svn/text-base/SiteAction.java.svn-base Sat Sep 3 14:12:20 2005

        ***************
      • 8112,8117 ****
      • 8112,8121 ----
        }

updateCourseClasses (state, new Vector(), new Vector());
+ // OK, I'm desperate. Without this second call, if you remove a course,

+ updateCourseClasses (state, new Vector(), new Vector());

break;

Obviously updateCourseClasses is doing something in the wrong order. I've already wasted 5 hours on this thing. I just don't have time to chase it further.

column1: [SAK-1875] Inconsistency between label in site creation confirmation and Site Info
column6:
When creating a site, just before finishing on the confirmation page, the label about whether the site shows on the public sites list says
Viewable by public.
In Site Info, the label for that setting is Included on public sites list.
Users are confused by what viewable to the public means - confusing it with public view settings on resources, thinking the entire site is open.

column1: [SAK-1874] Matching question feedback lost in import/export
column6:
Replacement for SAK-35763 Closed .

Copied text:

2.0.1, all local instances

When you export and then re-import an assessment with a matching question, either the last choice/match may be lost or the selection feedback for all the choices may be lost.

(answer choice lost in oracle, feedback lost in hsqldb, mysql test was fine)

Steps to reproduce:

1) Create an assessment with a matching question. Put at least 5 choice/match pairs in the question.

2) Export and then re-import the assessment.

3) View the matching question in the re-imported assessment.

All Comments Work Log Change History Subversion Commits Sort Order:
Comment by Ed Smiley [24-Aug-2005 15:05] [ Permlink ]
Working hypothesis...
There were issues in losing the last, but this sounds like a regression (unless this is only >4 bug). The differences (answer choice lost in oracle, feedback lost in hsqldb, mysql test was fine) may be due to different versions on the builds, as there is nothing that should be DB dependent that wouldn't affect authoring.

I'll be testing in Oracle on my instance with the latest Samigo code (1368).

Comment by Ed Smiley [24-Aug-2005 16:16] [ Permlink ]
Doesn't look like a regression.

OK, in an import of ten questions

1) question and all matches are preserved, as well as general feedback
2) selection feedback is lost for all matches

So the problem is currently just selection-level feedback.

We did have a problem at one time with the last selection getting lost, but that was fixed some time ago.

I will work on this, but suggest it has a lower relative priority.
Also, in the meantime, documented this in the readme.

column1: [SAK-1871] Announcements List: "All Columns Unchecked" layout
column6:
The current UI is compliant with the Refactor Style Guide (AN-1c), but it's inconsistent with every other view of the Announcements list. In AN-1c, Revise and Remove show up to the right of the announcement title. Elsewhere, they appear just below it (AN-1b).

Since instructors often use primarily Resources and Announcements, it would be a big win if Revise and Remove (although it's called delete in Resources) showed up always in the same place on the list.

Honestly, I don't understand myself when to expect a Remove checkbox instead of a Remove link. If someone could explain to me the rule, I could better teach users when to expect one or the other.

Besides consistency's sake, I should also add that long announcement titles currently wrap in a very short column when All Columns is unchecked (AN-1c). This makes for a pretty difficult visual scan of the titles. It would be grand if the style guide mock-ups represented both long and short titles for all tool items. The style guide almost universially uses very short titles. Instructors very often use much, much longer titles.

[dlp]

column1: [SAK-1953] badly formed FITB question causes infinite loop
column6:
It is possible for Samigo to go into an infinite loop if you feed it a badly formed fill-in-the-blank question.

from org.sakaiproject.tool.assessment.ui.listener.DeliveryActionListener, line 1285

in method populateFib(ItemDataIfc item, ItemContentsBean bean)

—
String alltext = new String(text.getText()); while (alltext.indexOf("{") > -1) {
String tmp = alltext.substring(0, alltext.indexOf("

{")); alltext = alltext.substring(alltext.indexOf("}

") + 1);
texts.add(tmp);
}
texts.add(alltext);
—

Sample FIB: roses are

{red} and violets are {blue}:
Loop terminates.

Sample FIB: roses are {red}

and violets are {blue:
Causes infinite loop allocating memory on each iteration
column10: badly formed FITB question causes infinite loop
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Huong, can you give this a try? add a validation to the field. You will have to do this in the java files. If it's gets too complicated (i.e regular expression matching) , assign it back to me. Thanks.
column90:
Update: This is a critical issue and needs to be fixed ASAP. If triggered it will cause the Samigo thread to run 100% CPU and quickly consume all available heap.

Here is a workaround we have implemented in the IU branch. It will break out of the loop if it looks like it has run too many times (more than 1000). I would recommend something like this be put into the Sakai generic branch along with proper input validation.

int escapeLoop = 0; // ajpoland@iupui.edu
// The following loop will repeat infinitely if a closing "}" is not found!
// escapeLoop is a temporary sanity check to prevent this thread from running away
while ( (alltext.indexOf("{") > -1) && (escapeLoop < 1000))
{
String tmp = alltext.substring(0, alltext.indexOf("

{")); alltext = alltext.substring(alltext.indexOf("}

") + 1);
texts.add(tmp);
escapeLoop++;
}
column95:
How about something like this? I just coded this off the top of my head, so you need to check it, but it could save a few hundred loops.

while ( (alltext.indexOf("{") > -1))
{
String tmp = alltext.substring(0, alltext.indexOf("

{")); int alltextRightIndex = alltext.indexOf("}

");
alltext = alltext.substring(alltextRightIndex + 1);
texts.add(tmp);
// there are no more "}" so we have added the last part, exit loop
if (alltextRightIndex = -1)

{ break; }

}
column99: fixed. Please check! Huong

{yellow} and avocados are {green:

Bananas are {yellow}

and avocados are

{green}

.

In each case, I got a warning when I saved the completed question:

"Please make sure your curly brackets match."

But the malformed question was created anyway. (Nothing showed up in the logs, and nothing bad appeared to happen, so that's good.)

Huong, could you change it so the question doesn't get created if the brackets aren't right? Thanks.
column107: Hi Ed, Can you put the back end fix in too? thanks.
column111:
I put in a back end fix. The front end UI is responsible for not sending a malformed question, the back end part is responsible for making sure that no infinite loop or huge set of records gets written, even if the UI fails.

I moved the code that creates the array into a separate method for clarity, called extractFIBTextArray().

Needless to say, this would take too long to keep crashing a server, so I unite tested it.

I added a unit test to the code. At some point it should probably be made into a JUnit test. It tests one correct and 4 incorrect strings. I left it in for now, in case any new issues arrive.

On the correctly formed string both Andrews' fix and mine give the correct answer. It also tests for excessive number of texts being made in the array (at 1000 limit, obviously Andrew's version doesn't pass (no diss for Andrew, his wasn't inttended to, just to keep the server up). The test returns true if it passes all elements of the suite.

column1: [SAK-1863] syllabus / urls to pdfs small window
column6:
When one posts a syllabus url in production that points to a pdf file. The window that loads with the pdf viewer is tiny. It shows about 4-6 lines and you just have a small scroll bar to view the syllabus. When I tested this in nightly, I just received a link to the pdf. Could not get it to open in the window like what happens in production.

Example for iu folks:
https://oncourse.iu.edu/access/content/group/f686be48-f868-4e30-0037-17ec70470bcb/Copy%20of_ius%20ic%208-2005.pdf
column10: syllabus / urls to pdfs small window
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
The problem:
This is an artifact of the frame-sizing mechanism of the Sakai portal.

When the portal outputs the IFRAME tag, it doesn't know how big the IFRAME will be. After the IFRAME has loaded its content, it is supposed to resize itself through JavaScript.

Take a look at the HEAD and BODY of a typical tool (the Announcement tool for example). You'll see that there is a headscripts.js and then some JavaScript in the BODY onload handler. This JavaScript causes the frame to resize after its loaded.

This is described in the "Sakai Tools" specification under "Tool-Portal Cooperation in HTML Generation":
http://collab.sakaiproject.org/access/content/group/1097928811887-22636/Architecture%20Docs/Sakai%202/sakai_tool.pdf
column90:
How to solve it:

Well, this is tricky. I don't know if the browser will even let an inline-PDF IFRAME be resized. There may be ways to make this work:

  • Have the PDF open in a new window instead of inline.
  • Change the IFRAME to not specify a size and see if it appears at the right size automatically.
  • See if JavaScript outside the IFRAME can resize it (instead of from inside the IFRAME as the other tools do).

Those are my ideas for the moment.
column95: This was reported as the same issue in Falcon IM263540. It's fixed in SyllabusShowAreaRender.java - open a new window for linked files.

column1: [SAK-1861] resources / title name change when file name is changed
column6:
I am uploading files via CL to the Resources. If I choose Browse... and pick a file the Title is completed automatically with the file name. But if I decide I don't want to upload that file (hence, I click the wrong file on my computer) so I click Browse... again and choose another file, the Title is not changed. So when I upload XYZ doc, the title displays as ABC doc. I can change it manually, but shouldn't it be changed automatically?

Tested on production and nightly2 with the same outcome in IE6.0 sp2.
column10: resources / title name change when file name is changed
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Reproducible on 2.0.1 stable servers as well.
column90:
That is the desired behavior. The filename is used as a default value for the title only if the title is not already set. Consider these scenarios:

1) User sets title to "My New File" and then selects a file named "sample.doc". (Title will be "My New File" unless user changes it.)

2) User leaves title blank and selects a file named "sample.doc", then realizes it's the wrong file and chooses a file named "sample.pdf" instead. (Title will be "sample.doc" unless user changes it.)

3) User sets title to "My New File", selects a file named "sample.doc", realizes it's the wrong file and chooses a file named "sample.pdf" instead. (Title will be "My New File" unless user changes it.)

4) User selects a file named "sample.doc", changes the title to "My New File", then realizes it's the wrong file and chooses a file named "sample.pdf" instead. (Title will be "My New File" unless user changes it.)

There are many other possibilities. We fill in the title field with the filename if the title is blank. Otherwise we leave it as whatever the user has filled in (or allowed to be filled in).

If someone believes that a different logic should be used in providing a seed value for the title, please provide a full description of the possible user actions and the way in which the tool should respond. Even then, we will need to establish some consensus about the desired behavior.
column95: This is by design. the title field is an alt display - not the file name
column99: See SAK-9970 Closed for further progress on this issue.

column1: [SAK-1855] Show Customize Tools only if new tools are added
column6:
Currently, Worksite Setup and Site Info offer the ability to customize the Email Archive, News, and Web Content tools.

However, users see the "Customize Tools" page in the wizard when Editing Tools even if they have not chosen to add any of these tools, or make changes to them.

We should only show the "Customize Tools" page under these conditions:
1. Email Archive is added to the site (so the user can add an email alias when adding the tool)
2. Web Content is added to the site (so the user can add a title and URL)
3. News is added to the site (so the user can add a title and change the default URL)

In "Options" for each tool, all the same changes can be made (email alias, URLs, tool titles). The page title that appears in the left meny currently can not be changed this way and a related bug will be submitted about that.

column1: [SAK-1851] mysterious user in Site Info
column6:
This is for a site with external provided participants:

RealmService cachs provided user information. Unless an attempt is made to edit the realm, the cached image won't be refreshed. It will then become out-dated when the provided realm info changes.

Worksite setup generates the participant list following two steps: First, it gets all participant info (list A) from CourseMangementService (which is the most up-to-date info from provider) and marks those participants "unremoveable". Secondly, it gets other users (list B) from RealmService and by removing those provided users, the remaining users are marked as not provided.

If a user just got dropped from the external provider, this user is not in list A but because of caching, he is still in list B. Hence this mysterious user will be marked as removeable.

So we got two problem here:

1) our realm information is a little old;

2) worksite setup uses newer information and trusts is over our internally held older information, then does the wrong thing when showing it.

First trial is to make WS use the internal information, augmented as to fields, not users, with CM info from provider.

Then we work on getting the realm grants list refreshed.

  • Zhen

column1: [SAK-1845] Need to escape the site id when used as a parameter in HTML
column6:
We are doing a custom 'push' to populate our course sites and changed the site_id of a course to be a 'friendlier' format instead of the auto-generated unique site id.

By doing so, we shot ourselves in the foot because some of our courses contain an ampersand '&' in the course title. When trying to join/unjoin one of these courses, for example, would not work because the URL wasn't escaped properly to look for ampersands (and why should they, there shouldn't be an ampersand in there, should there )

We found that when you tried to display the text of an Announcement the same type of behavior would occur. We had to edit several .vm files to fix this.

e.g. Only three .vm files contain an unescaped "=$site.Id" :

find . -name "*.vm" -exec grep -l '=$site.Id' {} \;
./webapp/vm/prefs/chef_membership.vm
./webapp/vm/prefs/chef_membership_joinable.vm
./webapp/vm/sitesetup/chef_site-sitemanage-list.vm

Eight other .vm files escape the $site.Id properly:

grep site.Id ./webapp/vm/admin/chef_sites_list.vm
#if ($service.allowUpdateSite($site.Id))
<a href="#toolLink("$action" "doEdit")&id=$validator.escapeUrl($site.Id)">

$validator.escapeHtml($site.Id)

$validator.escapeHtml($site.Id)

column1: [SAK-1842] unpackID in sampleRealm provider does not work with ID's generated by SiteAction
column6:
Users attempting to write a realmProvider will likely use the unpackID code that is included in SampleRealmProvider. The only problem is that SiteAction generates Ids for sections of the same course in format:

2005,Fall,547,330,[01,02,03]

I was expecting multiple sections to be of format:
2005,Fall,547,330,01+2005,Fall,547,330,02+2005,Fall,547,330,03

If you use the unpackId that comes with the sampleProvider your provider will FAIL on courses with multiple sections because there is no code to parse the bracketed list. Please revise to include the uMich format unpackID in the sampleProvider or change SiteAction.java so that it doesn't construct Ids in this format.

column1: [SAK-1841] Gradebook Case Inconsistency
column6:
There is an inconsistency in the way case is treated in gradebook view names of more than one word. For example, while the menu has "Add assignment" and "Grade options", their respective screens are labeled "Add assignment" and "Grade Options." Other Sakai tools seem to use typical newspaper headline conventions for initial capitalization. The Style Guide suggests that all "meaningful" words be capitalized.

The gradebook view names should be changed to all initial caps.

settings are listed that were not available under settings during
assessment construction. For instance, a new "Assessment
Organization" category appears, with three options, one being "Each
Part is on a separate Web page". However, these settings cannot be
changed once the assessment is published, and I cannot find a way to
select this behavior during the assessment construction phase.
(There is an obvious way to select between showing all questions at
once, or one at a time, but the "by parts" option is not evident.)
Other new categories which seem to be unmodifiable include
"Submission message", "Graphics" and "Metadata". The helpfile
indicates that these settings should be available during assessment
construction, but as far as I can tell, step 3 below (for example) is
simply wrong - there is no black triangle for metadata before
publishing the assessment:
> Once you publish an assessment, you cannot change the metadata.
> Before you publish an assessment, you can edit its metadata from
> the Settings page. To do so, follow these steps:
>
> 1. In the menubar of the relevant course or project site, click
> Tests & Surveys.
> 2. From the Assessments page, under "Published Assessments", click
> Settings beneath the title of your assessment.

column10: Cannot export assessment with firefox w/PC and a Mac
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
Not to say that this isn't a problem, but here are a few notes:

This is a situation where JSF is arbitrarily putting blank lines at the top of the page (XML file). This is a know JSF problem. XML requires that its xml header is in the first line.

You can save this file, and import it into Sakai (Sakai strips blank lines before importing). If you remove the blank line you can also import into other applications.

This is documented in READMEimportexport.txt.
column90: This was documented (see SAK-1203 Closed ) with workaround and user instructions for 2.0x, looking into this for 2.1.
column95:
Fix revision 1626.

Note that this is a workaround where I stripped XML declaration from XML and explicitly coded xml declaration on the first line to worak around JSF injection of illegal extra whitespace before XML declaration.

I can't test this in my instance, but JSF should not be rendering anything extra until after the XML declaration.
You need to verify on an instance where this is known to happen, as it is intermittent.

Margaret, can you coordinate with Indiana (where they are also seeing the problem)? In this sort of flakey problem I want to make sure that it is robust and not still intermittent.

Lance,
It's the consensus of the T2 team that this isn't a fix, but an acceptable work around until something more substantial can be done. Here's our reasoning:

Upon clicking export the message states that the user should click download to generate an IMS QTI-compliant xml file. However an htm file is what is generated/downloaded. At the top of the generated file, it states that "This XML file does not appear to have any style information associated with it. The document tree is shown below." When you import the direction state to "Choose an IMS QTI-compliant XML file from your computer." With the directions differing from what the user is experiencing, we can foresee many support issues arising from these discrepancies.

Thanks,
Megan

column1: [SAK-1839] reduce unneeded db rollbacks
column6: Since the switch to the apache commons pooling and dbcp code, we have been doing a database rollback after each use of a db connection from the pool. That's alot of rollbacks. While doing a rollback will protect us against buggy code, code that leaves uncomitted stuff on the connection when it is returned, there is a possible performance hit of all those unnecessary (we hope) rollbacks. Make it so we can run without the rollbacks.
column10: reduce unneeded db rollbacks
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

column1: [SAK-1838] performance: reduce user record reads on the db
column6: The user record reads from the db are fast, but in very great quantity when the system scales up. User records are already thread-local cached - add a 3 minute cache (like the security and site caches) so that we can reduce the load on the db.

column1: [SAK-1836] & in custom site_id breaks some URLs and Announcements
column6:
We are doing a custom 'push' to populate our course sites and changed the site_id of a course to be a 'friendlier' format instead of the auto-generated unique site id.

By doing so, we shot ourselves in the foot because some of our courses contain an ampersand '&' in the course title. When trying to join/unjoin one of these courses, for example, would not work because the URL wasn't escaped properly to look for ampersands (and why should they, there shouldn't be an ampersand in there, should there )

We found that when you tried to display the text of an Announcement the same type of behavior would occur. We had to edit several .vm files to fix this.

Is this something noteworthy enough to post as a bug fix for other institutions that may be so bold as to incorporate their own site_id convention?

column1: [SAK-1830] Inconsistent behavior in merged announcements
column6:
There is an inconsistency in the behavior of draft and regular announcements that have been merged from another worksite.

With a regular announcement that has been merged from another worksite, the user is able to VIEW and REMOVE the announcement only. The user does not have the ability to REVISE the announcement.

With a draft announcement that has been merged from another worksite, the user is able to VIEW, REMOVE, and REVISE the announcement. The Revise link is not visible. In any of the view Options that are avaiable, the Revise link will not show up, indicating that the draft announcement should NOT be revisable. However, because draft announcements are opened in revise mode, selecting the draft announcement's subject makes the announcement revisable.

ISSUE:
There should be consistency between the treatment of regular and draft announcements that are merged into a worksite.

QUESTION: Why are draft announcements being merged anyway?
column10: Inconsistent behavior in merged announcements
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Draft announcements should be merged so that a "maintain" type user does not have to go to the original worksite to revise or publish the announcement. They can work on it where they already are without having to think about where they need to go to work on it.
column90: Will this be fixed for 2.1.0?
column95:
Actually the original thought of the tool is, we don't allow the user to remove/revise the merged announcements. No revise link in the message's detail view. And no checkboxes, which allows deletion, in the list view. (It is a bug that removal checkbox shows up for the merged announcement, and just got fixed. See SAK-3520 Closed for details.)

But during the re-factoring, the way the tool shows the draft message was changed to the current way - you always go into the editing page when you click the draft message. That has caused this in-consistence, because we have no way to edit a posted merged message.

If we want to edit the posted merged message anyway, one solution is to add the revise button in the detail view. But at the service level, allowDelete and allowEdit permission are tightened. Allowing revising will also allow removing. We can't do this until the service seperates them. (Glenn, any thoughts on this?)

If we get rid of eiditing, then we need to come up a new interface for showing draft. Certainly, another inconsistence from the UI's perspective.

Input, please.
column99: glenn, your input is important. Please take a look.
column103:
The initial design of "merging" is to show announcements from other locations (other sites) as well as the local ones. When showing these other announcements, they are read-only. The inital design of this feature recognized the "context" that you have when you edit an announcement IN THE SITE. When you are seeing announcements from elsewhere, they are NOT announcements to the site you are in. It was decided to show then as read only to make it clear that they are not part of the site you have navigated to.

You would have to navigate to the site in which they live to edit them.

Drafts announcements probably should not even be shown in the merged display. They certainly should not seem to be editable.

That's how this was designed. This is not a bug.

If anyone wants to change the behavior, add a new feature that allows announcements to be edited from other sites, please recognize that it could weaken the concept of navigation context, and confuse our users. And please consider it a feature change, not a bug.

column1: [SAK-1828] Default Permissions for Dropbox
column6:
REQUEST: Change default permissions (once they actually are working, see SAK-1552 Closed ) to grant access role read, new, revise, and delete permissions by default.

As a site owner, I set permissions for "access" to be "read" but nothing else. (In fact, this is the default.) A user who is "access" is able to add items and remove them. This seems to be a bug. The user should only be able to do what permissions allow. Some faculty want to be able to give students read and new, but not delete. That way they can't put a document in the drop box and later delete or replace it. I believe it would make sense to default permissions to read, new, revise and delete, but if you clear one that should be implemented.

FIX: I wrote code to get rid of all the check boxes and the date/time if you select no feedback.

column1: [SAK-1823] add configuration to cluster event coordination to control frequency of checks
column6:
The cluster event tracking component checks the database every 2 seconds, from each application server, for new events (i.e. events from another app server) to coordinate the cluster. Event processing is a major component of total db usage on a loaded system. We'd like to be able to control this frequency, to reduce it some for larger scale operations.

Chat is probably the most sensitive to this - it will check for and deliver new messages to chat participants every 10 seconds. In order to keep this from slogging down, the event flow frequency should probably be 5 seconds max.
column10: add configuration to cluster event coordination to control frequency of checks
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

column1: [SAK-1822] improve cluster ghost busting performance
column6:
The query issued from the cluster service component that checks for open sessions from closed servers (so that it can close them) is showing up as a bad performer, especially as the total number of session records grows in a Sakai instance. New SQL and a new index can help.

Note: the new index must be added to existing installations for this to be fully effictive. It's added to the auto-ddl script for the cluster service for new installations.
column10: improve cluster ghost busting performance
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

column1: [SAK-1821] performance: improve SiteService database usage
column6:
The Site and Tool objects are accessed with great frequency, and on a loaded system tend to be responsible for the highest frequency and cost of database access.

These queries can be cached with a simple time-expired cache, which will greatly reduce the load on the database with very little loss of functionality.

If we don't do any cache invalidation when site information changes, we will see a lag between changing site definitions and these changes going into effect (much like we see now in with the SecurityService cache). This is the simplest way to achieve the caching; the lag may not be a problem.

If we don't like the lag, we can simply clear the cache anytime any site changes. This should be infrequent enough to keep our cache hit rate high.

The caching, and the # minutes to keep things in the cache, should be a configuration option, defaulting to on, with a 3 minute cache (to match the default of the SecurityService cache).
column10: performance: improve SiteService database usage
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

column1: [SAK-1820] An 'inactive' toggle for resource items
column6:
In our current CMS (Blackboard) resource items can have their visibility toggled. They can be made unavailable or not, and this has led to a number of faculty practices that depend upon this feature. They typically like to load all their content for the semester up front, and then gradually "release" items as time goes on. We'd like to see this functionality extended to Sakai. As of 2.0.1 the only mechanism for restricting access to resource items is the folder permissions. This isn't enough.

Of further value would be a timed release, not unlike the "Open" date for assignments. The release date and time of each resource item could then in principle be set at the beginning of the semester.

column187:
The root cause of this was not checking for zero total points when calculating a course grade. After scores have been entered and assignments have been removed, the CourseGrade calculateCourseGrade method would be called with an empty list of assignments. This case wasn't being tested.

The reason for the discrepency between DBs is that hsqldb was accepting "NaN" as a legitimate value for the cached calculated course grade, but Oracle and MySQL weren't.

Fixed in Revision 1605.

column90: Need to research problem and document fix.
column95:
Checked in fix as revision 1381. Many thanks to Chen Wen for finding and diagnosing this.

This will only happen when Sakai is running over a secure HTTPS connection and only on IE. You can see the bug yourself on "nightly2" (until the fix goes in!), since nightly2 uses the "https" protocol.

1) By default, Apache-with-SSL prefixes its content with a bunch of HTTP headers saying "this document should expire immediately and not be cached."

2) When IE sees it's talking to a secure server, it decides to treat all hints or instructions about caching as strictly as possible. Immediately upon finishing the download, it throws the data away.

3) Unfortunately, the way IE sends a downloaded file on to a helper application is to use the cached copy. Having just deleted the file, it naturally isn't able to find it in the cache. Whereupon it delivers a very misleading error message like:

"Internet Explorer cannot download roster from nightly2.sakaiproject.org. / Internet Explorer was not able to open this Internet site. The requested site is either unavailable or cannot be found. Please try again later."

There are several ways to turn caching off, and so to be safe we use several ways to turn it back on again. Here are the first headers I'll try adding.

Pragma: cache
Cache-Control: public, must-revalidate, max-age=0

It's possible that we might also need to set an "Expires" header to explicitly expire the download in the future. By default, Apache-with-SSL sets "Expires" to be the same as "Last-Modified", which some hypersensitive browser might take to mean "delete this file at any time after the instant it was made". But let's see if this is enough for now.

Since I don't have quick access to a test HTTPS server, I'll test the fix on nightly2 before officially closing the bug.
column99:
I found some improvement on the HTTPS-deployed nightly build, but not a full fix.

IE can now download the dynamically generated XLS and CSV files to disk.

However, if the IE user elects to open the files directly into Excel, it only seems to work the first time. After that, Excel gives a file-not-found error.

I've seen a similar report from a developer elsewhere, so it may be that we're stuck with this as a workaround. Just in case, though, I'm going to try adding a couple more bits of cache-control in the headers:

Pragma: cache
Pragma: public
Cache-Control: public, must-revalidate, post-check=0, pre-check=0, max-age=0

Checked in as rev 1427.
column103: The extra cache-control had no effect. As a final try at improving the situation, I've just checked in a version which resets the response headers to try to prevent the IE-killers from showing up. Rev 1471. I'll test again tomorrow.
column107:
I still had no luck getting IE 6 to open the download directly in Excel from a HTTPS server. (I tested, and the Resources tool has similar problems.) For now, the best I can suggest is to let support staff know that saving to disk is a workaround.

Oliver, should this go in release notes?
column111:
Hi Guys,

I had a very similar problem in a php app (an webamail client) in the end these were the headers I had to set:

header ("Content-Type: $type");
header("Expires: Mon, 26 Jul 1997 05:00:00 GMT");
header("Last-Modified: " . gmdate("D, d M Y H:i:s") . " GMT");
header("Pragma: public");
header("Cache-Control: must-revalidate, post-check=0, pre-check=0¿);
header ("Content-Disposition: filename=$filename");

Hope that helps

column1: [SAK-1811] extensions being appended to files without predefined extension when downloading
column6: I created a file called Makefile on the Desktop (the file doesn't have an extension nor do I want it to have one). I then uploaded the file to my resources space (I've replicated this on both Nightly2 and Stable(Oracle)). Everything works fine up to this point (the file is listed without an extension in resources), however when I click on the file to download it, it appends a .bin extension to the file. I've tried downloading from IE and Firefox on the PC and Mac and the same thing happens regardless of what OS/Browser I'm using.
column10: extensions being appended to files without predefined extension when downloading
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
Hi,

I can confirm this behavior. As per Carol Dippel's request, I tested this with a Word doc, a PowerPoint file, and a plain text file. Each was subsequently downloaded from Resources with the .bin extension added. The files cannot simply be double-clicked to open, but if the user removes the .bin extension from the file and knows what application created the file, the content is accessible.

This situation is due to the Mac's resource files being stripped off upon upload; AFAIK, there is no solution to this because the Mac's resource forks are unique to this platform. However, I suggest leaving the file name alone may be the best response. While this is not an ideal situation (because without either the resource fork or the extension the document appears as a generic icon on the end-user's desktop), adding a .bin extension to unknown files is a-typical and unexpected behavior for web applications. Adding the extension creates another layer of difficulty for the end user.

In the future, Sakai "best practices" notes may advise content authors to add extensions and / or add file type notes in the description field (e.g., "This MS Word document contains the suggested course reading list..."). This would give end-users some guidance in accessing the content.

Cheers,

Jim
column90: r1625 resolved this, "remove extra '.bin' extension from binary file without any extension e.g makeFile "

column1: [SAK-1808] FIB questions always marked as answered in delivery
column6:
observed on hsql and mysql local qa instances, and also on the hsql and mysql instances on stable (2.0.0rc3).

This was an issue before ( SAK-35856 Closed ), but was fixed. Now it's back in a more restricted form.

FIB questions are not marked with the "unanswered question" marker in the TOC in delivery, whether you've answered them or not. This problem does not happen on the oracle instances or with any question type other than FIB.

Steps to reproduce:

1) Publish an assessment with at least one FIB question in it.
2) Take the assessment as a student.
3) Navigate through all the assessment questions, but don't answer any of them.
4) When you reach the end of the assessment, view the TOC again. The FIB questions will be marked as answered, and any other questions will be marked as unanswered.

column1: [SAK-1796] SiteInfo Participants list - Active/Inactive improperly displayed in list
column6:
Noticed strange behavior when viewing site info for site created and populated by our custom CourseManagement and Realm providers.

In participant list - all students displayed before the instructor were displayed in <select> box as inactive. This behavior was related to display order, not anything about the user.

i.e. When displaying initially - all students appearing at the top of the screen and who were alphabetically less than crosbie were inactive, users at the bottom of the screen, greater than crosbie were active. When resorting on name field to descending, all users at top of screen, which were > crosbie became displayed as inactive, users < crosbie displayed as active.

It is only a display issue, but for the fact that there is a lone button at the bottom of the page labeled update. It is possible, even likely, that a user will click this button as a way to dismiss the page and inadvertantly lock out some significant portion of their students.

we traced the problem to chef_site-siteInfo-list.vm and chef_site-sitemanage-particiapnts.vm

As a workaround we modified the code at line 304 and following in chef_site-siteInfo-list.vm to account for an undefined state.

#set($grant="")
#set($grant = $realm.getUserGrant($uniqname))
#set($grantActive = $!grant.isActive())
<select name="activeGrant$uniqname">
#if ($grant=="" || $!grant.isActive())

It would be nicer if the realm code dealt cleanly with an undefined grant state.

Curiously - if we added a user manually to the site, in addition to those added by the provider, the entire list worked as expected. This may be a useful jumping off point for further exploration.

column1: [SAK-1781] Timed assessments begin and end times not enforced across sessions
column6:
A timed delivered assessment's begin and end times need to be enforced across sessions. For example:

1) Student begins a 60min. timed assessment at 8:00 am.
2) Student partially completes assessment and closes the browser to go study up for the assessment.
3) Student reopens the browser and resumes timed assessment at 8:30 am.
4) System now only gives student 30min to complete the timed assessment. The timer bar should reflect this accurately as well.

Thanks! L

PS - This is the same way Navigo was implemented.

column199: Is there additional work required on this issue or has it been resolved to everyone's satisfaction?
column203:
Laura tested timed assessments in delivery for me on all 3 nightly instances. She found that we still have problems.

– Time spent on the TOC screen does not count as far as the timer's concerned. The timer keeps going while you're on the TOC screen, but jumps back when you move to invididual question screens. This is specifically not supposed to happen.

  • When you save and exit a timed assessment from an individual question screen, the time left on the timer is preserved within about 30 seconds.
  • When you save and exit a timed assessment from the ToC screen, the time left on the timer reflects the last time you clicked a button or link (ToC, Next, Previous, etc) on the individual question screens. In other words, clicking save and exit from the ToC screen does not appear to save your current time; clicking it on an individual screen does.
  • If you exit a timed assessment by closing the browser (simulated crash), the time left on the timer will roughly reflect the last time you clicked a button or link (ToC, Next, Previous, etc).
column207:
Steps to reproduce:

1) Create and publish an assessment with at least 2 questions, the default organization with TOC, and a time limit of 20 minutes.

2) Take the assessment as a student.

3) If the first screen you see is the Table of Contents (it shouldn't be, that's another bug), wait here for a few minutes and then click on a question link. The timer will reset to the beginning.

4) Answer question 1, wait a minute, and then click on the ToC link. The timer continues counting down.

5) Wait a minute on the ToC page, then click on the question 1 link again. The timer jumps back to the time you left question 1.

6) Answer question 2, then note the time and return to the ToC screen. Wait at least another minute.

7) Save and exit from the ToC screen.

8) Take the assessment again as a student. The timer will be where it was when you left question 2 in step #6.

column1: [SAK-1778] sakai.home path not platform independent?
column6:
In the SpringCompMgr.java file, the sakai.home property is set as forward slashes. See the following lines:

// find a path to sakai files on the app server - if not set, set it
String path = System.getProperty("sakai.home");
if (path == null)
{
String catalina = getCatalina();
if (catalina != null)

{ path = catalina + "/sakai/"; }

}

What this causes to happen is for paths related to sakai.home on Windows, there is half backslashes and half forwardslashes in the URL. I am seeing this when trying to access TOMCAT_HOME\sakai[myfolder]\myfiles..

--Scott Amerson
UC Davis
column10: sakai.home path not platform independent?
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
I mean filepath, when I state URL in the problem above

Scott

column95: Will this issue be resolved for 2.1.0?

column103: Check out the File class and its constants. The JVM abstracts the actual path separators for each platform. L

column1: [SAK-1777] Bad logic in Course Grade calculation and display
column6:
Two bugs were introduced into the Course Grade screen logic when backing beans were changed to handle domain objects rather than vanilla Java types.

1) A student who hasn't received scores for any assignments will cause a null pointer exception for the calculated letter grade display. The backing bean is trying to do arithmetic with an uninitialized "pointsEarned" property.

2) An incorrect result will be displayed for the calculated percentage display. The backing bean is treating the "autoCalculatedGrade" property as if it's the points total, whereas it's actually already stored as a percentage.
column10: Bad logic in Course Grade calculation and display
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Fixed in rev 1331.
column90:
Verified on stable:oracle and stable:mysql for Sakai 2.1 006.

Unassigning & closing item.

column1: [SAK-1776] text copied and pasted into syllabus item in Firefox duplicating itself
column6: I was able to replicate this at will on Nightly2 and in the Oncourse CL production instance at IU in Firefox using the attached word document. I also tried saving it as a Rich Text File, but that didn't solve the problem either. I tried taking little snippets of text and pasting them in one at a time, and that seemed to work to a point (got to "points available" before text started duplicating itself-see screenshot). I have tried to find things in the document that would cause this behavior, but have been unable to find any. I can cut/paste and view all the text from the attached document in Internet Explorer 6.x without a problem.
column10: text copied and pasted into syllabus item in Firefox duplicating itself
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
(Same as Falcon incident - IM251005):
After testing on Firefox and IE, I believe this is a page loading issue for Firefox browser. The same thing happens for Announcements tool. If you paste the same word document to an announcements item then "Preview" it. When you scroll down to the bottom of the page, the browser freezes up.
I have two workaround solutions for this:
1. I suggest that users don't get one item too large. Don't paste a file larger than 64 KB.
2. Upload large files to "Resources" tool then create links for it in Syllabus tool.
column90: This is a browser related issue. closing.

column107:
From Brad Anderson:

After speaking with Megan about possible the resolution of the bug, I then became aware that the developers need to edit content. The solution is quite simple. Wrapping the url with "<" and ">" (e.g. "http://abc.com/" would become "<http://abc.com/>") should fix this issue with email clients that respect quoted printables. Monday you had mentioned to "drop everything" and work on the respective assigned bugs.

You can find the <> solution under Web Links on this page: http://www.webfoot.com/advice/email.format.html?Email

column191: Will this be resolved for 2.3.0?
column195: Also along these lines, when you send emails to the archive with indentation, the indentation ends up being ignored. Our users would appreciate it if the email archive respected their formatting.
column199:
An underlying issue here is the design decision to send out plain text versions of the email rather than the original email (which would possibly contain an HTML-formatted mime part in addition).

Sending out the plain text version does enable the easy replacement of attachments with links, but perhaps its time to revisit this and make the email archive behaviour configurable (plain text or preserve original format), and perhaps it's also possible to do some intelligent mime decoding and replace the attachments with links without too much damage to the original mime format.
column203:
http://www.hawkwings.net/2005/07/26/broken-hyperlinks-in-apple-mail/

Broken hyperlinks in Apple Mail
While I love Apple Mail, one thing in particular about it bugs me; it has a habit of breaking hyperlinks so that recipients of my emails can't just click on them the way they should be able to. When I add "http://forums.whirlpool.net.au/forum-threads.cfm?f=38" to an email, people using other mail clients often receive it as "http://forums.whirlpool. au/forum-threads.cfm?f=38¿ and that's frustrating for everyone. One PC-minded friend of mine has recently declared that he is "just going to give up" on anything I send!

It's easy to see how this happens with Apple Mail. At least David Duff posting on MacInTouch has an answer:
column207: I agree with Stephen Marquard's comments. It seems as though the only way to solve this problem is to send messages in HTML format instead of plain text. We have discussed making this a user option, but the default needs to be HTML.
column211:
I just added an attachment SiteEMailNotificationContent.java which may be a partial fix for this. Here are my comments:

This is a partial solution - but one I would rather not commit to trunk. It only fixs content notification by sending both an HTML and plain text mail message instead of just a plain text message.

The right solution is to do the work in the base class and have the base class accept plain text, HTML or both. In cases where one or the other is missing - it is derived from the text which is there.

One way or another this pattern must work for all versions of notifications, Calendar, Discussion, etc etc.

Then E-Mail archive must be fixed as well.

Folks could use this code as a temporary solution if they liked.

column1: [SAK-1774] Allow reordering of announcements in synoptic announcements tool
column6: Currently, the synoptic announcements tool lists the most recent announcements from most recent backward (in descending order). It would be good if it were possible to reorder the announcements in this tool. This is based on a support request that came into the University of Michigan's support team.
column10: Allow reordering of announcements in synoptic announcements tool
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Mike, can you please expand on the request? What sort of re-ordering are you looking for? Do you want to show them in ascending order? Do you want to choose the order manually? What's the rationale for the re-ordering? Is there a use-case you can cite here? Thanks.
column90: The specific request from the customer (not from me) was to be able to reorder the announcements in the synoptic tool into ascending rather than descending order. Regardless of what useful purpose that would serve, we did, indeed, have someone ask how to do it.
column95: That's fine, however, requests to fufill the needs of a signle individual don't stand a good chance of being implementing. Knowing the purpose it would serve might help others realize the need and place additional weight behind it. If you know who it was, please ask them to expand on their request. Thanks.

column1: [SAK-1937] UserDirectory errors when reviewing scores for Survey
column6:
During the scores action on a survey, the anonymous users are resolved in TotalScoresListener by a call to UserDirectoryService. Because these users will not exist in most if not all external directory providers, this call to UserDirectoryService throws an exception causing a blank screen.

In TotalScoresListener.totalScores , a new AgentFacade is created and calls to this facade delegate to UserDirectoryService. Would it be possible to test for the anonymous survey taker and if found, bypass the creation of the AgentFacade creation?

column1: [SAK-1771] Melete: problems when changing content directory locations in *nix
column6:
Under *nix there are problems with changing the location of content directories for Melete. Generally, content can be uploaded to various locations, but cannot be viewed unless the homeDir is located in the root directory of the filesystem. A brief look throgh the code seems to uncover some hardcoding of directory names (SectionPage.java, line 597), and some assumptions about the particulars of OS file names and separators. E.g., ViewSectionsPage.java, line 140 - does omitting the first two characters of this string strip off an assumed "c:"? - and the same file, block beginning at line 188, explicitly deals with literal file path separator characters. IMHO this should be handled through the abstract java interfaces. Line 202 in this same file seems to make explicit assumtion that the default location for uploeads is used, although the code will work if the "var" path component is replaced with another name. AddSectionPage.java, starting near line 164, assumes the "uploads" name for this purpose, and also fiddles with literal separator characters.

If arbitrary configuration is allowed in the web.xml for these locations, then the underlying code should support these values correctly. Thanks!
column7: Fedora Core 3 and OS X; tomcat 5.5.9
column10: Melete: problems when changing content directory locations in *nix
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

column1: [SAK-1768] Can't change question type during creation in question pools
column6:
all 3 nightly qa instances (rc4)

There's a "change question type" pulldown menu in the Add/Modify Question screen in both the authoring and question pools sections of Samigo. The menu works in authoring, but it doesn't in question pools.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Go to Question Pools.
2. Create a pool or go to an existing pool.
3. Click "Add" to add a new question.
4. Choose a question type and click "Save" to continue.
5. In the question creation screen, pull down the "change question type" menu and choose another question type.
6. Nothing happens.

It's not a big deal, since you can cancel the question creation and start over. But either the change-question-type menu should work or we should remove it.

column6:
http://coursework-s1.stanford.edu:29080 (nightly qa instance, rc4)

When reviewing a submitted assessment (either by clicking on the assessment title or the Feedback link), you can click the Remove link next to an uploaded file to get the remove-confirmation screen.

From there, if you click remove, the uploaded file is removed. If you click Cancel, you get a messed-up screen. (no exception in logs)

Steps to reproduce:

1) Take an assessment with a file upload question as a student; upload a file to answer that question.

3) Return to the list of available assessments
4) Click on the title of the assessment you just took in the review list
5) Find the file upload question and click on the Remove link next to the file.

Action: The "remove" link should be disabled in review.

column1: [SAK-1749] Need a high-stakes timed assessment type
column6:
It's been pointed out that you can choose "Save and Exit" when taking a timed assessment to pause it indefinitely and then resume. For a high-stakes test, a more absolute timer is needed:

----Original Message----
From: Thomas Amsler tpamsler@ucdavis.edu
Sent: Tuesday, August 16, 2005 6:08 AM
To: sepp-user
Subject: Samigo: Timed quizzes

Hello,

We want the quiz to be set at 10 minutes. No pausing. We don't want
the students to be able to 'stop the clock', go and look up the
answer, and return to the quiz.

The settings we am using at the moment seem to let you do just that -
you can click Save and Exit and come back seemingly whenever you like
to complete the quiz. Are there any settings that enforce the 10
minutes timed setting?

------------

Hm. If you have students take the timed assessment via the published url, instead of
choosing it from the list of available assessments, I think it should do what you want.
Here's an example of what that looks like:

http://sakai-stable.mit.edu:8030/samigo/servlet/Login?id=marith1124226913636
(login student/student, then paste in url again)

Every assessment you publish has an auto-generated url like this; you can see it on the
publish confirmation screen, and in the "Release To" settings of the published assessment.
When you take an assessment via the url, there is no Save and Exit button. You can only
submit for grading or quit.

A student could quit and then retake the assessment a second time, but you can prevent
this by limiting the number of allowed submissions in the "Submissions" settings to 1.
(Of course, that means that if their computer crashes while they're taking the quiz, they
may be hosed.)

The other problem with using the published url to distribute an assessment is that it's not mandatory
right now. A student could, if they knew how, just log into Sakai and take the assessment from the available list the regular way instead.

Maybe something to consider in this case would be a proctored online test like the Stanford SOPI language exams. Students take the test in a computer lab. The test itself provides the time limit, but there's a human around to forestall obvious cheating (you can tell by looking at someone's screen if they are using the correct mode) and provide help in case of legitimate computer failure.

Anyway. I'm going to put in a JIRA issue requesting a new type of timed assessment that you can't stop the clock on, because there's clearly a need for it. Thank you for pointing this out!

Margaret
Stanford QA

column1: [SAK-1746] Reflect new Manager/TA/Grader role
column6: The 2.0 Gradebook based its UI, queries, and authz on only two roles: Instructor and Student. In 2.1, there will be a third one, TA, which has assignment scoring and review rights for students in assigned groups, but not assignment editing rights or the right to change final grades. This will require changes in all three areas.
column10: Reflect new Manager/TA/Grader role
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Will Gradebook simply have a third permission ("gradebook.assistant" or whatever) or will there be separate permissions controlling whether a type of user can do different things such as set a final grade, create a new assignment, and so on? It would be useful to have finer-grained permissions on this tool so that schools can tailor what different roles do with the tool to suit their preferences/policies.
column90:
The long term goals include support for finer-grained permissions. That requires changes to the Sakai core to efficiently handle group-scoped permissions and also requires agreement with Tests & Quizzes, since such permissions will have to be shared between all applications which can create or score assignments.

In the very short term, therefore, we're only guaranteeing coarse-grained role support.

Whether we can do better than that for 2.1, or whether fine-grained control will be delivered post-2.1, is TBD. It's frustrating, but we see it as a choice between taking one step at a time or landing flat on our faces.
column95: I've noticed locally that the Owner role can create, edit, and grade assignments, as well as the Instructor role. Is that expected behavior? The spec indicates that only the Instructor role will be recognized (for 2.0).
column99:
Michelle, which users get the required permissions is up to the local implementation. All we do in 2.0 and 2.01 is check for them.

We would have preferred to check "real" roles, but the framework support turned out not to be in place for that.

http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/confluence/display/SECT/Development

Different due dates for different sections are definitely out of scope for the next Gradebook release. But I'm pretty sure it's on the "coming soon" list for both the Gradebook and for Tests & Quizzes (where a "Due Date" and "Release Date" would play much more active roles). You should contact the product managers or submit a feature request in JIRA to make sure your local priorities are known.

column1: [SAK-1739] Ability to have more than one tool on a page
column6:
Need the ability to have more than one tool on a page.

For example, ability to add the Chat tool or Announcement tool on a single page.

The behavior now is that if a second tool is added to a page, the Site Info/Edit Tools no longer realizes that the original tool was selected (if Chat was added to the Announcement page, Edit Tools no longer knows about the Announcement page, the option is unchecked).

The Admin tool itself allows you to edit pages and add tools and they will function, BUT the Edit Tools section of the program is unable to handle this situation.

Feels like a step backward from version 1.5
column10: Ability to have more than one tool on a page
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Will this be fixed for 2.1.0?
column90:
Not sure it will make 2.1 as no one is currently assigned. Anthony was going to do it but seems he is tied up with something else.

What has been suggested to address this:

When setting up a site with worksite setup, order of pages is ordered by toolOrder.xml (but toolOrder.xml doesn't figure in to displaying sites, just consulted for the initial order)

When editing tools with Admin Site tool, order is left to what Site tool leaves it.

WSetup/Site Info when editing sites leaves page order alone. If a page is added by checking the checkbox on the Edit Sites list, the order is determined by toolOrder.xml - the new page is placed using toolOrder to figure location. This will need to make a rule to say put it just under the tool it is under in the list or something, to take account of odd named pages that might be intervening.

If Admin Site tool adds new pages with odd names, their location isn't changed by an Edit tools. Edit tools would include in the list the oddly named pages. So that if Admin Site tool had added a page called Notebook, Notebook would show up on the list with a checkbox to be able to delete it. Once deleted, Notebook wouldn't be on the Edit Tools list the next time.

column1: [SAK-1737] MySQL UTF-8 encoding bug - breaks international characters
column6:
Report from Leif Johansson:

From: leifj@it.su.se
Subject: Possible problem with utf8 encoding in BasicSqlService
Date: August 11, 2005 5:49:14 AM EDT
To: sakai-user@collab.sakaiproject.org

While setting up our 2.0 we discovered what looks (to us at least) a problem with utf8 encoding in BasicSqlService. Our environment is
jdk (1.4.x) + mysql 4.1.* both running in utf8 locale on linux boxes.

The problem we have is as follows: When we create a resource (say an
announement) with non-us-ascii in the subject (the corresponding XML
attribute is not base64-encoded - this is an important point - for
storage) the resulting XML is truncated by as many bytes as there are 2-byte utf8 characters in the subject. We have verified that this
truncation happens in sakai, neither in the jdbc driver nor in the
database.

This led us to investigate BasicSqlService where we found that in
prepareStatement PreparedStatement#setCharacterStream is used to set
the value of string variables in the SQL statment. The problem is that
the number of chars to transfer to the statement is calculated from
the length of the String which is locale-dependent.

We suggest using setBytes instead. Using a stream is pointless in this
situation anyway since the full data is already in memory.

Patch against the 2.0 branch is enclosed.
column10: MySQL UTF-8 encoding bug - breaks international characters
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Zhen, can you check on this?
column90:
If this is indeed a reproducable bug, I'd recommend we make the fix specific to MYSQL ONLY so that it is impossible for it to affect HSQLDB and Oracle.

I'd recommend the following code:

if ("mysql".equals(m_vendor))
{
// see SAK-1737 Closed - MySQL doesn't handle setCharacterStream() encoding properly.
pstmt.setBytes(pos, value.getBytes());
}
else
{
pstmt.setCharacterStream(pos, new StringReader(value), value.length());
}
column95:
Zhen,

Any progress on this bug?
column99:
Verified on

To reproduce the bug:

1. Setup Sakai 2.0.0/2.0.1 with a MySQL backend.
2. Create a new announcement with some UTF-8 2-byte characters in the subject of the announcement. For example, use the subject "¿ ¿ ¿ ¿ ¿ ¿".
3. Post the announcement.

If the announcement title now shows question marks instead of the correct international characters, you have the bug. If the announcement title shows up correctly, then the bug has been fixed.
column103:
It looks like this bug has been present since Sakai 1.0!! At least, the incorrect code has been around that long.

The bug involves some international characters, not all, and as is noted, only in certain fields (such as the announcement subject), and not other fields. So it wasn't clearly tracked down until Leif Johansson figured it out.
column107: Look at the attached sakai-mysql-utf8-bug-fix.diff for the patch to 2.0.0 (and 2.0.1) that fixes this bug. This patch could also be back-ported (by hand) to Sakai 1.5.0, 1.5.1, or 1.0.0.

column1: [SAK-1736] GB: Release Note Needed for Permissions for 1.5.x --> 2.0.x Upgrade
column6:
RELEASE NOTE: Update permissions using Admin Realm Tool when adding Gradebook to sites created prior to 2.0.x. This item can be closed once this is included in 2.0.1 Release Notes.

--------------------

From: John Leasia jleasia@umich.edu
Sent: Tuesday, August 16, 2005 5:07 AM
To: Carol Dippel
Cc: David Haines; Seth Theriault; Clay D Fenlason
Subject: Re: FW: [Fwd: Instructors unable to access gradebook]

That's correct - if a new site is created, they should get the correct gradebook permissions for the access and maintain role for Sakai OOTB. That's because those permissions are checked on as needed in the !site.template realm for each of those roles.

Any pre-existing site wouldn't have had those permissions in the realm for the site as they didn't exist yet. With 2.0, the gradebook permissions show up in every site's realm. They aren't set to anything in pre-existing sites though, so those sites will need to have the gradebook permissions set appropriately for the various roles they may have in the site.

Since there isn't a Permissions page in the tool, that has to be done by support (admins) using the Admin Realm tool.

John

Carol Dippel wrote:

John, is this a 1.5 --> 2.0 only issue? In other words, folks have to update
realms for sites that pre-existed prior to upgrading to 2.0.x IF they want
to add Gradebook tool. However, if a new site is created in 2.0.0 or 2.0.1
this is not necessary, correct? I never ran into the reported condition in
any of my tests but maybe I did something wrong.

Clay, depending on John's response, this may be another Release Note. --C.

----Original Message----
From: John Leasia jleasia@umich.edu
Sent: Monday, August 15, 2005 4:48 PM
To: sepp-qa-wg
Cc: sepp-qa-wg
Subject: Re: [Fwd: Instructors unable to access gradebook]

Note that you will need to update realms for any existing sites too, if
those sites add gradebook. Updating the !site.template will take care of
any sites created after you make the change. You need to make the
changes to the realms using the Admin realms tool as there isn't a way
to do that in the Gradebook tool itself.
John

Sam Ottenhoff wrote:

!site.template realm. If upgrading from 1.5 to 2.0, administrators
should be sure to update their !site.template realm to add gradebook

--Sam

The best solution I can think of is to add a system wide option in user preferences to allow a user to select which wysiwyg editor they will use site wide, then have several options, one of which entirely focused on high accessibility and others for high load speed and high functionality.

Due to time constraints this will most likely be post 2.3 though, sorry.

column215: MAINT TEAM REVIEW: Accessibility issues with FCKeditor are now and best addressed by upgrading FCKeditor. See SAK-17880 Resolved for progress on this
column219:
In version 2.6.2, the FCKeditor change notice includes:
2197 The TAB key will now have the default browser behavior if TabSpaces=0. It will move the focus out of the editor (expect on Safari).

By setting TabSpaces=0 in the config.js files used for the FCKeditor, then the FCKeditor is no longer a keyboard trap. The user can tab in and tab out of it.

In IE, users can tab to the next element after the editor and shift+tab to the element just previous of the editor that can take focus. Firefox (on the Windows OS) appears to have a bug that only allows tabbing past of the editor as it is implemented in Sakai. Pressing Shift+Tab in firefox doesn't currently do anything. Initial testing shows that if FCKeditor isn't in a frame, Firefox allows shift+tab to exit the editor.

The config files in use for the FCKeditor appear to be:
reference/library/src/webapp/editor/FCKeditor/config.js
reference/library/src/webapp/editor/FCKeditor/config_rs.js

Setting TabSpaces=0 would make the tab key behavior in FCKeditor behave the same as the tab key behavior in CKEdit
column223:
Hi Noah,

The last comment I made would solve this issue by allowing keyboard users to tab and shift+tab out of the FCKeditor. But, it would obviously change the behavior of the editor by doing so.
column229:

This way institutions are notified of the issue, and also not surprised by the sudden behavior change.
