column1: [SAK-1734] WebDAV client on Windows XP requires multiple logins before connection made
column6: When making a WebDAV connection to Resources, we have to try logging in multiple times before the connection is finally made. It typically takes 3 or 4 tries before I can get in. This is not an isolated experience - it's been true for all the XP machines (including faculty) I've worked with so far.
column7: Windows XP Pro (SP2), native WebDAV client
column10: WebDAV client on Windows XP requires multiple logins before connection made
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column55: I can't reproduce this problem in 2.0.1, so closing.
column90: OK, I can't reproduce the problem, but my training staff can, so I'll reopen. It now only appears to happen when the network connection is first created.
column95:
The issue here is the user perception that they are logging in twice for the same thing, when technically Windows XP is requiring them to login once to create the space and once to access it. This should be explained in the WedDAV in-line instructions and in Help. (It maybe the case that checking the remember username and password checkbox in the login will cache the information so that some users only have to enter the info once; however, the checkbox is not checked by default and checking it did not work as expected for me.)

If you follow the in-line WebDAV instructions for Windows XP you have to enter your username and password twice; once when adding the network place and once when you are done and the last step of the wizard attempts to open the new place. This last step is akin to anytime you try and open the network place, it will prompt you for a username and password.

The instructions should include the second login dialog that a user encounters at the end of the set-up process. The instructions should probably also indicate that you will need to login on subsequent attempts to access the space anew, though that is probably a more intuitive process.
column99: Will this get resolved for 2.1.0?
column103:
I don't think that Peter is understanding what some of our XP Pro SP2 users are encountering. In addition to getting the login screens 3+ times in quick succession, these users are unable to establish a network connection and ultimately receive an error message "folder is invalid." We've tried the exact same login sequence, for the same folder, on other XP machines, and have no difficulty establishing a network connection, locating the folder, and transferring files.

It would seem that there is a setting, or software configuration, on some XP machines that blocks WebDAV connection to Sakai folders. Those same machines can connect to other campus network locations via other applications using WebDAV. Reinstalling WINDOWS\SYSTEM32\webfldrs.msi did not resolve the problem, and the XP web services setting is correct. At the moment we are stumped...
column107:
David, It sounds like you're on the right track, its just a very complex track, and solution is probably buried somewhere in the security, firewall, etc. settings of your XP machines and/or your Sakai server.

Can you describe in detail, perhaps with screen-shots if that's easiest, the step-by-step process you're going through? Can you also look at the logs on the server your trying to connect to, the system logs too, to see if your XP machines are even getting as far as setting up a network connection on the server?

We've tried several XP machines with different patch levels and they all work fine, however, they also are all at the University of Michigan. Have you tried connecting to WebDAV on Collab?
column111:

http://collab.sakaiproject.org/dav/group/1097928811887-22636/

Cheryl

column139: Have not recevied further information on this issue, so resolving as incomplete for now. Please feel free to re-open, if additional information becomes available.
column187:
Hi: I can confirm this strange Windows login issue. A professor was unabe to login with Windows and here are the instructions I send a professor; this worked for him:

1) Log onto your local Sakai account and go to the Resources.
2) In the center of the screen is a link to "Manage/Download Multiple Resources"
3) Within those instructions for Windows, just above the first screen shot, you will find:

In the "Location of the Network Place" field, type the following:
http://sakai.ucla.edu/dav/user/[your user name]

4) Copy that line and paste it into the Windows "Add Network Place" dialog box, and add a trailing slash.
That is, http://sakai.ucla.edu/dav/user/[your user name]/
5) Click "Next" and try adding your username and password.
6) If it fails, click "Cancel" (leaving you at the "Add Network Place" dialog box), and now then click "Next" again to bring up the user/password dialog box a second time.
7) Login again. This time it works.

BTW, adding the trailing slash does not negatively affect Mac OS X 10.4.x, which now natively has WebDAV support in the OS (no need to download Goliath.)
column191:
This may be a little tedious to watch, but this screen video .swf file demonstrates this bug:

In the process of setting up the Network Place, the first attempt at entering username/password is unsuccessful, and will continue to be unsuccessful unless user cancels out of dialog box, then clicks Next in the wizard causing the dialog to re-launch, then enters the username and password again. This is consistently reproducible.
column195: So it looks like there are now several possible workarounds for folks stuck in this situation. Its not clear what is differs between these configurations (both the Windows client and the Sakai server).
column199: We have the same symptoms at Texas State. When we have traced the WebDAV http traffic with ethereal, it appears that Windows makes a request for /dav in addition to requesting the full dav path (e.g. /dav/user/zt10). This would explain seeing multiple authentication dialogs. We haven't fixed this, but maybe returning a 401 Forbidden on /dav would do it? Just grist for the mill.
column203: Is this still an issue as of 2.2.0?
column207: added a few versions I can verify this occurs on
column211:
I am working to find out what is causing this issue and hopefully I am on the right track, during this process I found a workaround that works quite well:

instead of using something like: http://www.iis-communities.nl/dav/siteid

you can circumvent the basic authentication by providing the user name / password in the URL:

http://username:password@www.iis-communities.nl/dav/siteid

And all password dialogs are gone.
column215: Roland, does this workaround also work over https? Also, i see IIS in your URLs, is that an indication that perhaps this is working because your working with IIS, rather than apache/tomcat?
column219:
Windows Webdav support is a disaster. Last time I looked at it, here's what I found:

https://sakai.rutgers.edu/access/content/public/windows-webdav.html

There are lots of versions of the Webdav client in WIndows. Updates are distributed both with Windows and Office. That means you can't know what version you're running without actually looking at the DLLs. Some versions do appear to work, but most do not. The bugs are well known. Some are documented at

http://www.greenbytes.de/tech/webdav/webfolder-client-list.html
http://www.greenbytes.de/tech/webdav/webdav-redirector-list.html

However versions that they don't show any problems for clearly do still have the problem. We know that one of their WebDAV developers knows about the problems. It's pretty clear that MS doesn't place a high priority on a service that is useful primarily for cross-platform interoperability.

In my opinion the only reliable solution is to use a third party product such as Independent DAV. If you get into the business of fighting the never-ending stream of Windows DAV bugs, you're going down a rathole that you'll never get out of.
column223:
I completely agree with Charles Hedrick on the issue, Windows Webdav support is a disaster.

One of the many, the most annoying issue is that even on WinXP SP3, the login does not work properly in the "Add Network Place" dialog.

By doing some googling and grepping the httpd log I found that by default, the add network location uses al library that has as User-Agent "Microsoft-WebDAV-MiniRedir" , which, to my big surprise is incapable of using HTTP BASIC authentication, unless the registry is edited to do so. This is a restriction enforced by Microsoft, it has something to do with security.

So far, so good, but now comes the awkward part, if a URL has:

1) https as protocol
2) an @ sign, like I noticed before (user : password at www.iis-communities.nl/dav/siteid )
3) a port number, like www.iis-communities.nl:80/dav/siteid, even if the port number is 80.

or is someone presses cancel and tries again, winxp will use a different library to connect: "Microsoft Data Access Internet Publishing Provider Protocol Discovery" shows up as User-Agent in the acces log.

This library works like a charm and does a BASIC auth without any trouble. This is why we allready got some other setup with DAV working: we used https, and without knowing we made use of a workaround.

So, to get WebDAV working on winxp, we will need to use one of the workarounds described above. 1 is impossible since we use different hosts on one single ip, 2 is possible, we could put the username@ in front of the hostname, but 3 is the most simple one: just append the port on the hostname displayed in the "Upload-Download Multiple Resources". So instead of:

http://www.iis-communities.nl/dav/siteid

We use:

http://www.iis-communities.nl:80/dav/siteid

I created a patch for 2.4.x that works for us. I will try and patch 2.5.3 later.
column229: A patch that inserts the default port number in the URL, if no port number is present.

column1: [SAK-1731] Find or develop movable closable DHTML popup
column6:
Our UI calls for pseudo-pop-up windows in two places: the calendar method of entering dates, and the grading history log.

The 2.0 calendar pop-up is based on some very old Javascript that got copied into MyFaces source. There have been some advances made in cross-platform DHTML since then, and I know of at least one example of a cross-platform movable closable pop-up.

We need to see what's currently in Sakai JSF, and then either adapt to it or add the new functionality.

column1: [SAK-1730] calendar features for collaboration
column6:
This question was asked a few months ago, but I thought things might have changed by now.

We're pushing Sakai for use by research projects and other non-course uses. For that, we really need a collaboration system. The mail and discussion tools seem OK, but the schedule isn't really a full-function calendar system as you'd expect in a collaboration system. I see two kinds of things that need to be done:

  • Ability to get data in and out, particularly to PDA's. Supporting all the existing types of PDA is really hard, but a straightforward way to get ical in and out through a web interface would at least let people build feeds externally. That requires support for ical, which at the last meeting someone said was being done.
  • Better ability to do collaborative calendars and tasks. Look at a typical calendaring system to see what is needed here. At a minimum, a dropdown menu with all calendars you have access to, making it easy to look at other people's calendars. Also in "new event" the ability to list invitees, and see when they are free.

The schedule system as it is now is clearly intended just to create course schedules. But if you start doing anything innovative with the system, the line between a course schedule and a calendaring system starts to blur. Of course we have a separate University calendar system. But it doesn't handle non-University members very well. For research collaborations, this is key, and Sakai makes it easy to do that. Trying to do half your collaboratoin in Sakai and half in a separate calendar system is really cumbersome.
column10: calendar features for collaboration
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
This issue was originally a Feature Request from the Sakai 2.0-era. Sakai's calenadar features have evolvoed substantially since this issue was created and functionality that addresses some of the concerns raised here has been added, (e.g., SAK-191 Closed , SAK-7342 Closed ), and to reflect that, this issue is being Resolved for Sakai 2.5.

If there is additional functionality that is still desired, please detail it in a new Feature Request relative to the capabilities of Sakai 2.5.

column1: [SAK-1720] Mysql performance problems
column6:
Tuning MySQL for Sakai

This is a work in progress. Expect to find additional information added here as we continue with the tunning. Change 1 - 4 are currently on our production server.

DOCUMENTATION: Please add to install doc
1. Make sure you tune MySQL itself. As shipped, it is configured for a small desktop system. Various caches are disabled. In mysql/support-files you will find sample configuration files. I recommend copying my-large.cnf or my-huge.cnf to /etc/my.cnf. Use the one most appropriate for the amount of memory you have available. When you restart mysql it will read /etc/my.cnf.

BUG FIX
2. Add to sakai.properties the following line:

cacheMinutes@org.sakaiproject.service.legacy.security.SecurityService=3
This allows certain expensive transactions to be cached. The developer intended this to be the default, but it was inadvertently overridden in the default XML file.

BUG FIX
3. A few indices should be added:

create index SAKAI_EVENT_SESSION_ID_I on SAKAI_EVENT (SESSION_ID)
create index SAKAI_SITE_USER_USER_ID_I on SAKAI_SITE_USER (USER_ID)
The second is particularly important. It is used by a query that happens for every web page generation.

BUG FIX, I guess.
4. Some SQL needs to be rewritten. This is done in the java code. See the new version of DbRealmService.java.

WARNING: This code may be inappropriate for Oracle. It may not even work with Oracle.

The SQL changes are needed for two reasons: (1) MySQL often is not able to use indices when processing a query with sub-selects. I have had to rewrite them using joins. This is always possible, and generally leads to better code. (2) MySQL does not use an index when doing a query with "where x in (LIST)", whether the list is generated by a subselect or simply a list of constants. Above 3 or 4 elements in the list, it decides not to use an index. Where you need to use one, you have to add a "force index" phrase.

DOCUMENTATION: Install doc
5. Sakai uses prepared statements, but doesn't enable the JDBC feature that causes them actually to work. You'd think doing so would save CPU time on the server, maybe lots of CPU time under heavy load. To do this, you need to change the jdbc URL in sakai.properties. Here's the fixed version:

url@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=jdbc:mysql://127.0.0.1:3306/sakai?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF-8&cachePrepStmts=true&prepStmtCacheSize=4096&prepStmtCacheSqlLimit=4096

Note that we're not running with this change in our production server, though I have used it on a development server.

????
6. We have some concern about performance of the table SAKAI_EVENT. There's a lot of both writing and reading to it. myisam is not a wonderful format in that case. If it's a problem, may need to set delayed write, or even use a different table format.

DOCUMENTATION: Install doc
7. You may need to increase the following variables in /etc/my.cnf:

max_connections. Seems to default to 100. That seems to be OK for one Tomcat, but might not be enough for lots. Use netstat to see how many connections are open and give yourself some safety.
table_cache. Set to 256 in the sample we used. One source suggested that it should be max_connections * number of tables used in a join. So if you increase max_connections you may need to increase this.n

column1: [SAK-1717] Add ability to add institution specific actions in toolbars which point to URLs
column6:
Our enterprise system provides class roster information beyond what is available in Site Info. This includes information on waitlisted students, additional information about the class, additional student status information, etc. It is desirable to provide that information to instructors easily from Site Info. This is not necessarily information that should be added to site info as it may not be common among all institutions.

To provide this information in Site Info in a flexible way, we would like to add the capability to add an item to the toolbar which is similar to a web content functionality. This would be optional, controlled by properties in sakai.properties. Options there would specify what the action text is, and what URL clicking on the action presents, and whether the action appears or not. Then, institutions could add items to toolbars as they like, or not. This might be something that could be added to toolbars in general, as opposed to putting it in for Site Info only.
column10: Add ability to add institution specific actions in toolbars which point to URLs
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
This is very possible.

It would be simple to write, test, and integrate if the parameters passed to the external toolbar application was carefully spelled out. The interface to the external application needs to be simple and carefully designed.

For example:

https://myexternal.site.info.umich.edu/infoForSakai?providerId=XXX&username=XXX&.....

I'm not suggesting that we necessarily pass provider ID, its just the first parameter that I thought of.

Also, it may be more appropriate to make this a new feature in the Site Info tool (link to external site info provider), rather than in the toolbar. I'm not sure why the feature request asks to put the info in the toolbar anyway.

-Jon
column90: Yes - the Site Info toolbar, not the titlebar.
column95:
Not sure what you mean by 'make this a new feature in the Site Info tool (link to external site info provider), vs 'rather than in the toolbar'. I was suggesting that there be a button (an action) in the toolbar that when clicked displays the URL. Since in site info, actions are in the toolbar.

The info wouldn't be in the toolbar - it opens up a window to display whatever is at the URL. That the action is in the toolbar was suggested because that's where actions go.

Who sees the action? Could be tied to the site.upd permission, though that isn't probably flexible enough. Maybe need a separate permission - view.url.action or something. But that permissoin doesn't make much sense if the optional URL action isn't there.
column99:
Just a misunderstanding of terminology here:

"titlebar" - just has the reset button, the title of the tool, and the help button in it.

"toolbar" or "menubar" - nelow the toolbar. Has links to actions such as "Edit Site Information", "Edit Tools", etc.

We could add another link to the Site Info toolbar/menubar that links to this new info in a new window.

column1: [SAK-1716] Removing Components from Sakai Source can cause unstable behavior
column6:
In trying to produce a reduce environment to speed compile time on a slow box with little memory, I removed the following components from my Sakai source directory:

edu, gradebook, profile, sam, scheduler, sections, and syllabus

When I deployed this system, new site creation is broken. This is not a big deal because the fix is to simply not delete the directories and all is well.

I have figured out the problem and will soon commit a very simple fix - the problem comes down to a dependency between a tool being present in the template used to create new sites and having the tool present in the system.

This does not apply at all to the standard release code or any standard check out. Just a situation where you do a checkout and remove some elements from the source manually.

./legacy/component/src/java/org/sakaiproject/component/legacy/site/BaseSiteService.java

column115:
HTML produced by T&Q also still fails validation at validator.w3.org, e.g. this result from the Assessments page output:

  1. Error Line 178 column 7: end tag for "tbody" which is not finished.

</tbody>

Most likely, You nested tags and closed them in the wrong order. For example <p><em>...</p> is not acceptable, as <em> must be closed before <p>. Acceptable nesting is: <p><em>...</em></p>

Another possibility is that you used an element which requires a child element that you did not include. Hence the parent element is "not finished", not complete. For instance, <head> generally requires a <title>, lists (ul, ol, dl) require list items (li, or dt, dd), and so on.

¿

  1. Error Line 332 column 7: end tag for "tbody" which is not finished.

</tbody>

¿

  1. Error Line 480 column 7: end tag for "tbody" which is not finished.

</tbody>

column203:
Marc,

Reassigning to you - since I do not have comit status for samigo, and you can all decide who is going to do this best. It affects all the *.jsp files in /sakai/sam/tool/src/webapp/jsf (and any other *.jsp) that are used to render views of the tool

These files need to be also validaded as well and validation errors corrected (see Stephen Marquard's comments and attachment, as well as my comments and attachments to http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/jira/browse/SAK-1443) - validation is important because (among other things) nesting errors can also create rendering problems.

Whoever does this - here are some things that need to be done, over and above correcting validation errors, to get rid of the inconsistencies (scrollbar, cropping of viewport) with IE/Win and make the rendering more like the other tools as well as make it more skinnable.

1 - make all comments in the jsp that precede <f:view> into jsp comments (<%-- -%>), not html comments (<!- -->) - there should be nothing in the response above the doctype

why - IE/Win interprets comments before the top level node or before the doctype as "something" and bungs the rendering

2 - remove width="100%" from the attribute list of dataTable styleClassed as "listHier"
3 - add to the above the following valid JSF h:dataTable attributes cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border ="0"

Let me know if there is more info needed.

column1: [SAK-1708] Hang on Tomcat shutdown -- with fix
column6:
Sakai hangs on Tomcat shutdown. I believe to have fixed it. I ran a kill -3 on a hung Tomcat process and found the following thread spinning:

"NNTPSpool-0" prio=1 tid=0x099b8928 nid=0x6299 waiting on condition [68da6000..68da6238]
at java.lang.Thread.sleep(Native Method)
at org.apache.james.nntpserver.repository.NNTPSpooler$SpoolerRunnable.r$
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:534)

NNTPSpooler shouldn't be running. Looking at the James configuration, I found this:

<!-- The NNTP server is enabled by default -->
<!-- Disabling blocks will stop them from listening, -->
<!-- but does not free as many resources as removing them would -->
<!-- NNTP-specific: if you disable the NNTP Server, you should also set the nntp-repository's
threadCount to 0, otherwise there will be threads active and polling -->
<nntpserver enabled="false">
[...]

Further down, I found:

<nntp-repository>
[...]
<spool>
<configuration>
<spoolPath>file://var/nntp/spool</spoolPath>
<!-- The number of threads that process spooler related tasks. -->
<threadCount>1</threadCount>
<!-- The spool thread(s) should idle for some time, if it has nothing to do -->
<threadIdleTime>60000</threadIdleTime>
</configuration>
</spool>
</nntp-repository>

The threadCount needs to be changed to 0. Making this change on my instance stopped Tomcat from hanging on shutdown. Can someone commit this?

Thanks!

  • Drew
column10: Hang on Tomcat shutdown -- with fix

column1: [SAK-1705] Resources imported through Import from Site disappear after a while
column6:
Files imported from another site disappear after a while. To recreate:

1. make two sites (Site A and Site B) with Resources tools
2. Upload some files to one of the sites (Site A).
3. Go to the other site (Site B). Go to Site info and use the Import from Site feature. Import the Resources tool from the site you were working on (Site A).
4. Go to the Resources tool (of Site B).
5. The files will disappear after a while. It might happen right away. It might take a couple of minutes.

If this is like the problem at UM, then those files aren't getting committed properly during the transfer process, so they disappear during garbage collection.

column1: [SAK-1704] No error message if uploading a file that's too big
column6:
In Resources, if you try to upload a file that is too big (in Sakai, the cutoff is set to 1mb, I think. In CTools, we set it to 20 mb), Resources tries to upload the file, and only after if has gotten the entire thing does it check whether the file is too big. If it is too big, the page refreshes, the information you entered is gone, and there is no error message to tell you what is wrong!

First, if you try to upload a huge file such as a long video clip, it will upload the entire thing before it tells you that it is too big.

The problem that I'm reporting in this ticket is that it forgets the path that you specified to the file and the title that you entered, as does not tell you why the operation didn't succeed.

To recreate:
1. Add items in Resources
2. Leave it on the default of Files
3. Choose "10" from the pop-up menu
4. Specify 8 files on your hard drive
5. Click on Add

It should just accept that you only wanted to upload 8 files without making you go back to the pop-up menu.

column95: I'd like a fuller explanation of the logic here. If someone says they want to create 7 items and then submits the form, we iterate over the seven items, collecting their inputs. If there is at least one complete entry, we create that one item and discard the six partial entries they made, with no error messages and no chance for them to correct any mistakes? Is that the desired behavior?
column99:
I believe the point is to be able to leave one or more entries blank; if you choose to upload 7 files and then only decide to upload 6, then it shouldn't give you an error message because you decided to leave the fields for the 7th file entirely blank.

Although I have my own opinion on how this should work, I would have reported this because it started working differently than it had prior to 2.0. The actual behavior of the system when you choose to enter fewer files than there are fields should be left up to someone on the design team, I figure.
column103: I agree. If I choose to upload ten documents and then only browse and pick eight, the system should handle this gracefully. The question is, do we notify the user in an info/warn dialog or swallow it quietly. Thanks, L
column107: Daphne, could you or someone from the Tools Team or User Interaction DG provide some design guidance on this issue? Thanks.
column111:
John Leasia said:

Check with Zhen as she implemented it in earlier versions.
The idea is that if you say you want to upload 7 items, but only specify
6, the 6 get uploaded. We ignore the 'blank' entry and don't force them
to enter a 7th, or go back and change the setting from 7 to 6.

If they make partial entries then we should do the normal checks we make
for required fields, valid fields etc, for that entry. But if they
haven't entered anything in for a particular entry, we ignore it. They
should be able to remove the title/other info if, when they are sent
back to the input page because of some error, they decide they don't
want to add the nth file after all.

Rob Lowden said:

Jim I believe this and the responses to the Jira incident all are saying the
same thing. If I choose a specific # of uploads and for whatever reason
don't supply uploads for the N# I chose, that is no big deal, the system
gracefully takes the N# that I did choose and uploads them and ignores the
blank items. I think that is fine and we should go forward with that.

column1: [SAK-1688] Character encoding breaks on edit
column6:
When entering foreign, non-western or accented characters into Sakai, it initially accepts and displays them properly. However, if you then edit the text, the character encoding is altered when the content is loaded into the editor resulting in corrupted text. This happens with documents formatted as either UTF-8 or Windows-1252 – starting with different document encodings merely changes how the corruption manifests, but the text will still be corrupted.

This is currently happening in Resources but happens in Melete too, and has been already reported (and apparently fixed in 2.01) in announcements. It seems to be pervasive, and probably happens in other tools as well. Not every tool currently allows the text to be edited afterwards (e.g., discussions) so that might mask the problem.

Possibly related bugs:
SAK-969 Closed - International characters display in WYSIWYG but lose all formatting once you revise/post
SAK-842 Closed - Unicode names not displayed correctly in all deployments
SAK-422 Closed - Cannot save a value in a field that has foreign chars as new field name in schedule

This issue makes teaching language and literature courses difficult if not impossible, and if an edited document is saved results in data loss (corruption of the foreign text within the document/announcment/whatever).

Using accented characters in a Resources document title is even worse, I'm filling that as a separate bug ( SAK-2015 Closed ).

column1: [SAK-1684] Create "Export to Sakai"/"Export to File" feature
column6:
There is currently an "Import from File" feature in the Site Info tool. Sakai needs a feature to actually export a site into the correct format for the Import feature to work, so that users won't have to contact the admin and request that a site be exported.

This appears to be related to the admin Site Archive feature, so it's possible that we just need a way for users to be able to use the Site Archive's export feature to dump the xml of their site onto their hard drive.

Two ways occur to me to work this new feature in:

1. Create another item on the action bar in the Site Info tool. I think that this action bar is cluttered enough as it is, but this shouldn't cause any problems.

2. Change the action bar in Site Info so that instead of "Import from File" it has "Export/Import from File". I would not recommend simply copying the interface of the Site Archive tool and restricting it to only the current site, since the current interface is a little weird.

We could also push the Site Archive tool into instructors' My Workspaces, but that would require a huge redesign of the Site Archive tool so that it's easier to use and doesn't give users access to sites they don't own.

column1: [SAK-1682] student scores page can't be updated if no questions are answered
column6:
2.0.0 - Sakai 2.0.0[506121] (local hsql nightly qa build, rc2)

If at least one person has taken an assessment and submitted it, but nobody has answered any of the assessment questions, then the questions' scores/comments in the Student Scores page can't be updated.

Steps to reproduce:

1) Create and publish an assessment.

2) Take the assessment as a student. Do not answer any questions - just click begin assessment and then submit for grading.

3) Log back in as the site maintainer and view the scores for the published assessment.

4) On the student scores page, adjust the scores/comments for an individual question and click Update. Your changes will be lost.

column1: [SAK-1681] Assignments terminology is not accurate for all Items that will be tracked in the Gradebook
column6: We have received several complaints from our faculty with regard to the Assignments terminology used in the Gradebook to refer to items that are to be graded. Not all items to be graded are assignments, such as exams. We suggest changing the terminology to "Item" to make the gradebook more generic.
column10: Assignments terminology is not accurate for all Items that will be tracked in the Gradebook
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
Is a take-home exam an assignment? Is an exam entered through the assignments tool an assignment?

We went back and forth on this issue a bit during the UI development phase. I think we opted for assignments instead of item because there will eventually be other kinds of items you can add to the gradebook, like categories of . . . . items? Any other thoughts on this? Ben, do you remember the pros and cons?
column90:
In the original wireframes we called them "assessments" - which we rejected.

We opted for assignments, because we heard people calling them that during usability tests

I think "items" is too generic. It's not going to be clear what to users what an "item" is. It like calling them "things."
column95:
From Vivie Sinou's email to sakai-dev (Tuesday, October 03, 2006 5:05 PM):

One area of great concern - and a source of confusion for our users - has been the label of "add assignment" in the Assignments Tool and "add assignent" in the Gradebook tool. I don't have any brilliant solutions to suggest, but I wanted to bring it to the developers' and UI folks' attention.

In our legacy ETUDES system, gradebook items for which students do not submit something in the Assignments Tool (i.e. things like a speech, discussion participation, etc.) are labelled as 'non-submissible assignments'. Other schools may have other suggestions on how to handle this issue.
column99: I might suggest the terminology: grade book entry. L
column103:
"Assignment" was an uneasy, imperfect choice that no one involved in the original design decisions was particularly pleased with. Nevertheless, I do not want to replace it hastily to mitigate one problem only to have another set of confused, annoyed faculty possibly tell us, e.g., ""grade entry' suggests entering scores" or to have the new terminology come up short upon the introduction of gradebook categories. Furthermore, the term "assignments" appears in GB contexts (other than the nav menu) where a simple swap of one term for another won't work.

One question: does the primary source of confusion at IU and Foothill have to do with the fact that "assignments" created in the gradebook are not linked in any way to the assignments tool or is the issue still as described above in the original feature request? If so, I'll note that Vivie does seem to suggest that "Assignments" was the term used in the legacy ETUDES system's gradebook, with a distinction made between admissible and non-admissible assignments.

Ideally, the decision will be based on some additional community and user feedback. Was "grade book entry" suggested by a faculty member? Can we spend a little time testing various solutions on faculty?

I suggested "Add Column" at one point, but I don't remember why that was deemed problematic.

Finally, let me add that the "fix" version for this is not going to be 2.3.
column107: The non-submissible assignments in our legacy system were NOT part of the gradebook. They were an option in the Assignments tool. In other words, all types of 'assignments' (whether they included submissions and/or only held grades) were part of the Assignments tool. Thus the confusion for our users.
column111:
We're using Gradebook for recording attendance at tutorial (discussion section) sessions, using a mark of 0 or 1 (would be nice to have a grade-scale of Attended / Did not attend / Excused that can be set per item rather than per gradebook).

So something generic would be more appropriate. I think "entry" is good.
column115:
We've had the same issue at Rutgers, personally I favor the generic "entry" too, and I also think that there is nothing wrong with "item". "Column" is what WebCT uses, it's a good choice but only if the visual representation ends up as a column in a table, in the case of the Sakai gradebook it may turn out as a row depending on which page you are on.

The problem is that the term is describing two things - what is being added to the gradebook, and what it represents to the instructor and students. We have faculty who record things like clicker ID numbers for personal response systems, as well as the things like attendance and exams that were already mentioned, none of these are "assignments". Any non-generic term will fail the second meaning at some point, while a term like "column" works because it clearly does not apply to the second meaning (but then it fails the first meaning as it's too visually specific).

I'll try to solicit some faculty feedback.
column139: Gradebook entry is what we have been calling it. So there is an assignment (in the assignment tool) which has a gradebook entry in the GBook tool. But we can go with whatever works.
column187:
When we used to recommend a variety of electronic gradebook options (desktop applications as well as websites) and in my own experience with electronic gradbooks as a middle and high school teacher, it was always something generic like ITEM. Each item then was defined by title, category, and point-value. In Sakai, I suppose each item should also be defined by source/location/origin/type (ex.: submitted assignment, samigo assessment, discussion posting, oral presentation, interpretive dance, "other"). Maybe the challenge is in defining this term-- the term that describes where the Gradebook is supposed to get the values or whether the instructor is supposed to add them.

By the way, I'd like to add self-assessment as a type. Self-assessment is pretty standard pedagogy, isn't it? I haven't seen a feature request for it yet; maybe instructors are asking students to self-assess offline and then manually adding it to the Gradebook themselves.

Instructor feedback on terminology could be quite enlightening. This comment tread seems to be leaning toward a generic term. If instructors are leaning the same way, why? Might this reveal a desire to keep track of things other than grades in their gradebooks?... not just attendance and participation but things like consent forms or their mentor's name or anything that maps well into a spreadsheet. Paper gradebooks are often filled with this sort of info alongside grades. These sorts of things might accumulate in a zero-credit category and could allow for non-numeric entries. By genericizing the term for "assignments," Sakai will give instructors the perfect reason to think outside the gradebook box and remember all the other ways they use their little black books.

I don't want to suggest that Gradebook should swallow Post-It, but that instructors will recognize the power of gradebook "Items" instead of Assignments or Assessments. A generalized term should reflect generalized functionality.
column191: This has been resolved with the Indiana University's OPC item 20 (resolved in SAK-9491 Closed )
column195: See SAK-9491 Closed for further progress on this issue.

column6:

2) click on assessment name (note, answer displays on next screen)
3) click modify

column10: imported assessment answer not sticking when modifying
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
Fix version 1359.

I looked at the example XML. Oddly enough, our internal data model uses "true", "false" for the possible answers in a True - False question. Therefore in the edit screen it didn't recognize that "True" was "true". To make this consistent with items created through the UI, I added code to normalize any true-false strings to lowercase.

The lowercase version is used for indexing the radio buttons (which are labeled with "True" and "False"), but we may have also code hardcoded to accept only lowercase as well.

The change was in the import extraction routine, and was a very simple change:

$ svn commit -m "SAK-1678: normalize to lowercase all imported true/false questions so that they all have the correct and incorrect answers correctly identified and perserved on edits" src/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/business/entity/helper/ExtractionHelper.java
Sending src/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/business/entity/helper/ExtractionHelper.java
Transmitting file data .
Committed revision 1359.

column1: [SAK-1676] Accessibility--Integration of Title frame with Content frame
column6: There are two separate iFrames that contain content in Sakai: a title frame and a content frame. It will improve navigation, comprehension and accessibility for the two frames to be collapsed into one.
column10: Accessibility--Integration of Title frame with Content frame
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Gonzalo, don't know if this is doable w/o framework changes. If it's not something you can do, please reassign back to me and I'll make it a feature request.
column90:
there are 2 things involved here:

1 - this is a framework issue, so either Jon or Glenn.
2 - the reason we had 2 iframes to begin with had to do with one targetting the other (reset, float, and in the uPortal version minimize, maximize) - and change to the 2 iframes will involve a rethinking of how these things will be done in the future.
column95: I worry that this will disappear from view if we make it a Major feature request. Can we flag this as critical, since it is a significant hindrance to persons using adaptive technology?
column99: This is the most important accessibility issue that we face at present.
column103: So I changed it from "Major" to "Critical." Wouldn't it be nice to be able to edit comments so you don't have add another post when you forget something?
column107: I'm not supposed to be on the critical-path anymore, so I'm reassigning this critical issue to Glenn (-;
column111:
Some thoughts on technically how to combine the title frame and the tool frame:

  • The portal now completely generates the title frame. This is as it should be, the tool shouldn't have to do the portal's job (and get it wrong).
  • In order for the title frame and tool frame to be combined, the tool would have to cooperate in the HTML generation of the tool frame. Right now the tool cooperates with the portal to generate the necessary JavaScript in the tool frame. This mechanism could be extended so that the portal could hand off the entire rendered titlebar to the tool. The tool would just output it in the right place, (without understanding or parsing it at all). This is a fairly easy extension of the request variable mechanism we already use (remember "sakai.html.head" and "sakai.html.body.onload"?) The portal could pass "sakai.html.body.begin" and "sakai.html.body.end" and the tool would be responsible to output it like so:

<body>
<%= request.getAttribute("sakai.html.body.begin") %>
.
.
.
<%= request.getAttribute("sakai.html.body.end") %>
</body>

This would be easy to implement for the legacy/Velocity tools, and the well-factored JSF tools (gradebook, syllabus, etc). Samigo would be difficult because this change would need to be made on each individual JSF page.
column115:
Thanks, Jon! Glenn, something we can do for 2.1? Anything you need from me or Gonzalo?

Mike
column139: Moved to Post-2.1 at Release Management Meeting.
column187:
Peter and Glenn--

This is a major accessibility issue. Can I get commitment to a date when it can be resolved, if we can't include it in 2.1? It's important that I address it during the accessibility presentation in Austin.

Mike

column1: [SAK-1673] Slow response times navigating
column6:
I have been noticing slow response times . . nothing that is awful, but there are delays and when you are attempting to author a test, these small delays add up.

Some actions:
Accessing QP link
Adding questions from a question pool
Importing assessments
Modifying questions
column10: Slow response times navigating
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: noticed on stable although not as bad as what we notice in our prod environment here at IU
column90:
Interesting. Our local QA instances are very fast and have been since whe got new hardware, which makes me suspect that the slowness may be a hw or configuration issue.

I tried the suggested operations on all 3 stable instances (rc3) with varying results. Times were arrived at using the very scientific "one-Mississippi, two-Mississippi" counting method.

Mysql: importing an assessment took 3 seconds, all other operations took less than 2 seconds

Hsql: Importing an assessment took 9 seconds, other operations took between 2 and 3 seconds

Oracle: Importing an assessment took 11 seconds. Viewing question pools took 2 seconds. Modifying, importing and creating questions...didn't work at all. They just hang indefinitely when I click the save button.

So something's wrong with the oracle instance on stable and I'll file a separate bug on that. Other than that, are these response times reasonable? Do they line up with what you're seeing on stable? What kind of hardware setup/dbtype does IU use?
column95:
Funny thing, just this problem was happening with the oracle instance on stable earlier ( SAK-1584 Closed ). Reopened bug; hopefully restarting the server will fix it this time too.

(Might restarting the IU server(s) help?)
column99:
IU is a bit ahead of Sakai and has been pulling from head lately so testing against stable isn't a good comparison. I did attempt to replicate on stable/oracle today and samigo didn't ever complete a task (would just hang).

Today when I first accessed the test and quizzes tool on Nightly2 right after a rebuild, it took 5 seconds for the tool to load the initial screen-- this is with minimal data in the DB.

I have some info from one of the Sakai Developers here at IU (Andrew Poland)
I ran a yjp analysis of Questions Pools, see this document:

\\in-uits-cmsshare.ads.iu.edu\Public\ajpoland\question_pools_profiling.html

It looks like the feature spends a majority of its time waiting on hibernate queries.

Maybe there is a way to simplify and speed up this query? It looks like it might be trying to retrieve all the question pools in the system.

our hardware. We use ootb settings on samigo. (We restart the servers at least once a week, but have been doing more so lately)
================================================================================
Database
Oracle version 10.1.0.4. It is housed within a dedicated partition on an IBM Power 5 "p5" server, model 9117-570, called ESDB06. The overall server is a 16-way 1.65 GHZ processor, with 64 GB of memory, and has an overall relative performance " rperf" rating of 68.40. The current allocation to Oncourse will allow it to use up to 25.65 rperf if needed, and this can be adjusted with p5 and AIX 5.3 flexible technologies. Actual data storage for the production database is within an IBM SAN, model 2105-800. The current size of the data base is 33.5 GB allocated, and 8.0 GB used.

Web and Application servers:
12 virtual servers:

  • Red Hat Enterprise Linux AS release 3 (Taroon Update 5)
  • Tomcat 5.5.x and Apache 2.x
  • JVM is Sun's SDK at version 1.4.2 08
  • Each Linux server has a virtual memory allocation of 3.6GB

These 12 virtual servers run under VMWare ESX 2.5 across two HP DL740 physical servers (Intel Xeon 3.0GHz, 64GB each, with 8-processors per machine).

Please let me know any other information we can provide.

Bear with me here as this following point may be a bit obscure....

Everybody may have figured this out already, so I furnish this explanation for purposes of completeness...

The acid test would be to take the xml example and import it and then export it and compare the order on the current code base. That would establish whether the order is still getting shuffled in a) import, or, b) export.

It goes without saying that, even if the problem originally noted by Megan is that the exported XML was out of order, the version of code that generated the XML is earlier than the code here. So if the XML has an arbitrarily shuffled order, we can use that order as the "correct" one for a test against the current code base, as long as we test both import and export.

column1: [SAK-1664] Schedule tool confused about AM vs. PM
column6:
When creating a Schedule item:

Set the start time for 9am
Set the end time for 12pm

The event will be listed as lasting 15 hours; however, if you set the end time to 12am, the event will be listed as lasting 3 hours.

Alternatively:

Set the start time for 9am
Set the duration for 3 hours
The end time will be properly set for 12pm.

The second behavior is correct. The first behavior is incorrect.

column1: [SAK-1660] Need efficient method for expanding all content collections
column6:
When the user clicks on the resource tool's "expand-all" twiggle, the tool does a depth-first search for content collections within a base collection and adds each ContentCollection object to a Map keyed on the collection-id. With large collections, the number of separate database queries results in a slow response. It would be more efficient to aggregate results at the database level, rather than making repeated queries from the java code. We are looking for something similar to ContentHostingService.getAllResources, except it will get ContentCollection objects instead of ContentResource objects. Also, it would be helpful if the return value was a Map keyed on the collection-id, instead of a List.

Please assign this to someone adept at SQL programming.
column10: Need efficient method for expanding all content collections
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Actually, ContentHostingService.getAllResources is implemented in java as a depth-first search that makes repeated database query. If this method is actually used, it might be a good idea to implement it closer to the database with well-formed SQL statements.

column103: I would like to vote for this issue to be resolved prior to 2.1. We are using this in production and it is impossible for a user to edit settings that are not made available to them due to the current setup of the default template. If all settings were available via the default template, then by default a user could edit any setting they choose. One example of a setting that needs to be edited is the option which shows the student how many points they have received out of the number of possible points. I can't think of very many instances where the instructor wants the student to know how many points they received for each question while they are taking the assessment. In my opinion, this setting should not be enabled by default. At any rate, setting up the default template so that all settings are shown to the user is the best option as once a user chooses a template, apparently there's no going back.

column1: [SAK-1658] FIB questions don't handle multiple answers well
column6:
nightly rc2 builds

FIB questions allow you to specify multiple correct answers with pipes. For example, if the question text says:

{red | white | blue}

,

{white | red | blue}

and

{blue | white | red}

are the American flag colors.

The question will appear in delivery as:

____, ____ and ____ are the American flag colors

and should accept any combination of red, white and blue as correct.

However, it doesn't notice if the answers are distinct or not. An answer of "blue, blue and blue" will be scored as correct.
column10: FIB questions don't handle multiple answers well
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Marc, pls. review and assess whether this item can/should be postponed and not included as a late entrant to 2.0.1. Thanks! --C.
column90: Will look at this for 2.1
column95:
There will be two valid cases for scoring when there are multiple f-i-blanks in a question:

Case 1- There are different sets of answers (a set can contain one or more item) for each blank (e.g. The

{dog|coyote|wolf} howls and the {lion|cougar} roars.) In this case each blank is tested for correctness independently.

Case 2-There is the same set of answers for each blank {The flag of the US is {red|white|blue},{red|white|blue}, and {red|white|blue}.

If all the sets of answers are equal then testing for correctness is done by checking the responses against the common answer set and eliminating prior responses from the set as one proceeds to evaluate later blanks. for example.

The student responds "The flag of the US is blue, red and red." to the question listed above for case 2.

-The Blank 1 response "blue" is corrrect because blue is included in the set (red,white,blue).
-The Blank 2 response "red" is correct because red is included in the reduced set (red,white) - blue is eliminated because it was the reply for blank 1.
-The Blank 3 response "red" again is incorrect because red is not in the reduced set - now just including (white).

-----
These are the only two valid types of questions. When authoring, it is an ERROR to include:

(1) a mixture of independent answer and common answer blanks (e.g. The {dog|coyote|wolf}

howls at the

{red|white|blue}, {red|white|blue}

, and

{red|white|blue} flag.)

(2) more than one set of blanks with a common answer ((e.g. The US flag is {red|white|blue}

,

{red|white|blue}, and {red|white|blue}

and the Italian flag is

{red|white|greem}, {red|white|greem}

, and

{red|white|greem}

.)

These two invalid questions specifications should be authored as two separate questions.

—
Also note that the score is based on the number of responses that are correct minus the number responses that have an incorrect or no response. There cannot be a negative score so
the score is Max(0, right responses - wrong responses)

This is the same scoring method that is used in multiple choice multiple correct.
column99: Daisy, This is actually for both you and Ed, but I can only assign to one person in JIRA. Keep this bug in mind when you write your script and tell Ed to also take care of this one when he changes the autoscoring logic.

We should revisit the spec for FIB after 2.1.

Ok, I think I get you now. So if we have:
Roses are

{red}

violets are

{blue}

. (4 total points)
red (2) + blue (2) = 4 points
yellow (0) + green (0) = 0 points

Then we have two possible scenarios for one wrong:
1) red (2) + purple (0) = 2 points
2) red (2) + purple (-2) = 0 points

I've been under the assumption that #1 is the way things are supposed to work especially since the grading mock-up Charles did reflects #1, see
[snip]
column115:
Margaret,
Here are the examples and 12 diff combinations I came up with based on Charles' note(see above)

single answers : roses are

{red}

and vilets are

{blue}

multiple answers :

{dogs|cats} have 4 legs

multiple answers , mutually exclusive, all answers must be identical, can be in diff. orders : US flag has {red|blue|white} and {red |white|blue} and {blue|red|white} colors

multiple answers , mutually non-exclusive : {dogs|cats}

have 4 legs and

{dogs|cats}

can be pets.

wildcard uses * to mean one of more characters

12 combos:
-. wildcard single answer, case sensitive
-. wildcard single answer, case insensitive
-. single answer, no wildcard , case sensitive
-. single answer, no wildcard , case insensitive
-. multiple answer, mutually non-exclusive, no wildcard , case sensitive
-. multiple answer, mutually non-exclusive, no wildcard , case in sensitive
-. multiple answer, mutually non-exclusive, wildcard , case sensitive
-. multiple answer, mutually non-exclusive, wildcard , case insensitive
-. multiple answer, mutually exclusive, no wildcard , case sensitive
-. multiple answer, mutually exclusive, no wildcard , case in sensitive
-. multiple answer, mutually exclusive, wildcard , case sensitive
-. multiple answer, mutually exclusive, wildcard , case insensitive

column1: [SAK-1656] Security hole in Permissions feature in Site Info tool
column6:
1. Maintain user goes to Site Info, opens Permissions, and grants the access role the "upd" permission
2. Access users now get a lot of new options in Site Info. Goes to the Site Access feature in the action bar of Site Info and makes a site joinable with the default role set to "maintain."
3. The malicious access user gets his friend to log in to Sakai and join the site. This user now has the maintain role and can access all student data and edit the site.

column1: [SAK-1655] SecurityService cache turned off by default
column6:
The check for if a user has permission to use a tool is fired each time the tool is placed in an iframe for display.

The SecurityService has the ability to cache this query, but it is turned off by default.

https://source.sakaiproject.org/svn/trunk/sakai/legacy/legacy-components/src/webapp/WEB-INF/components.xml
https://source.sakaiproject.org/svn/branches/sakai-maint/legacy/legacy-components/src/webapp/WEB-INF/components.xml

<bean id="org.sakaiproject.service.legacy.security.SecurityService"
class="org.sakaiproject.component.legacy.security.SakaiSecurity"
init-method="init"
destroy-method="destroy"
singleton="true">
<property name="logger"><ref bean="org.sakaiproject.service.framework.log.Logger"/></property>
<property name="cacheMinutes"><value>0</value></property>
</bean>
column10: SecurityService cache turned off by default
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
FYI, the class is configured for a three minute cache by default if no "cacheMinutes" is supplied in the components.xml. We might consider either removing this element from the xml or changing it to also default to three minutes.

This value can easily be overridden via sakai.properties as well:

cacheMinutes@org.sakaiproject.service.legacy.security.SecurityService=3

column1: [SAK-34619] Security features
column6:
1) Include features that allow instructors to easily specify that a test is only available at a testing center or a group of testing centers without password protecting the test or entering a range of IPs. The instructor should be able to select from a select list of testing centers.

2) Securely and automatically disseminate test passwords to appropriate proctors through the Web rather than through email.

3) Disseminate test passwords that are only valid for a particular student's test attempt (as opposed to a general test password that, if shared, would allow all the students into a test).

4) Alerting utilities which can email instructors when a student takes over a certain amount of time to finish a test.

5) Allow course evaluation surveys to be taken anonymously so that a student's identity is protected from the instructor.

6) Allow a testing center admin to securely check a student into an online test without having to walk back to the testing terminal and enter the test password.

7) Include certification options which will allow a proctor to certify a test after it has been completed.

8) Enable a proctor admin to track and approve proctors and automatically disseminate appropriate passwords to these proctors.
column10: Security features
column19: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

column90: Lydia -This may be some kind of regression.
column95: Can I pass this to you? I think you've done some work on this. I saw a comments "<%-- PLAIN TEXTAREA QUESTION so we can allow brackets --%>" Is that yours?
column99:
To keep it simple, by design, we were keeping this a plain textarea, by design, since we had, by specification, an proprietary bracket based markup for answer text.

Gradually added JavaScript code to detect and correct simple HTML added to the code, so that it wouldn't break import/export XHTML. Since then we seem to have seen an issue when several line break tags are inserted.

It sounds like it might be worth it to bite the bullet and switch to using a wysiwyg component.
column103:
Well it seems to work fine. I also cleaned up the code layout, fixed a dangling DIV tag, and stacked the correct and incorrect feedback--which looks much better in a portal, despite the original Samigo mockups.

As I suspected, it doesn't seem to affect the import/export any.(see SAK-35827 Closed )
Doesn't seem to break anything though.

I'd recommend we stack correct and incorrect feedback.

column1: [SAK-1650] New permission for Email recipients selected
column6:
Need the ability to set permissions in a role that would be able to see all items on a site, but would NOT receive mailings sent out for that site via Announcements, email tool, etc.

I'm thinking that there would have to be some 'hook' in the Email tool that would check for this permission and not send to those site members who do not have this permission.

(basically to prevent those who need to see a site, but do not need to be 'spammed' by site email, like the Dean of a School who needs to be able to see a site, but not get all the email that is sent to the site itself)

column1: [SAK-1954] Random selection from question pools causes incorrect point totals
column6: I created two question pools, one with three questions, one with 4, worth 10 points each. I made an assessment with two parts, each part selecting 2 questions at random, one pool per part. The assessment reports seven questions for a total of 70 points, even though the actual assessment contains 4 questions worth a total of 40 points. This error affects the final score reported to the gradebook; a sample student getting 2 of 4 questions right received a score of 29%, or 20 out of 70 instead of 50% or 20 out 0f 40. This also uncovers what looks like a bad design decision IMHO. Making the point total a property of the question rather than of the assessment causes problems - what happens if questions within a pool have different point values in a randomized setting? Also, what if you want a question to have different value depending on whether it is used on a quiz versus a test? Point assignment should happen in the assessment, not in the question pool.
column10: Random selection from question pools causes incorrect point totals
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
Hi Jim,

Are you still seeing this behavior (incorrect scoring for random draw parts in assessments)? Is it happening in authoring, grading or both? (There's a known issue with the total scores of random draw parts in authoring ( SAK-1895 Closed ), but I didn't know of any problems with grading those sections.)

If the problem is still happening, can you give us more information about how to reproduce it and whether you see it on the stable instances at MIT or only on your local instance. Thanks!

Margaret
Stanford QA

column1: [SAK-1634] changes to student scores page not being saved
column6:
Seen on all 3 rc2 instances on sakai-stable.

This is a new bug in 2.0.1; it wasn't happening previously.

Changes made in the student scores screen of grading (adjusting question score, feedback, comments) don't get saved when you hit the Update button.

Changes made on the Total Scores page do get saved; this problem is specific to the student scores page.

Steps to reproduce:

1) Click on the scores link for a published assessment with submissions.
2) On the Total Scores page, click on a student name or ID.
3) On the student scores page, adjust the score for a question or put something in a comment box.
4) Click Update to return to the Total Scores page.
5) Your changes won't be saved.

At the time that link was added (and again a couple weeks later), Daphne and Rob said to show the link only to people with rights to upload to the site. The issue was that webDAV does not show copyright info, so they did not yet want to encourage wide use of WebDAV for getting files instead of the access servlet, which does show copyright alerts. Also, there were questions about our WebDAV implementation's ability to enforce access restrictions. I think those concerns are now satisfied.

column6: On many screens and higher resolution, half the screen is wasted space in regards to displaying tabs. It would be nice to do some magic behind the scenes and either set a display number based on different resolutions and let users choose one (in tab customization) or even better if Sakai could tell what resolution is being used for a visit and set the tab number based on that.

column55: This was also a highly requested item in Michigan's Winter 2006 user survey (1,357 instructors & 2,485 students). Students, in particular, want to have a way to have more tabs displayed across the top of the screen. Having a setting for this in tab management AND an intuitive agent specify the number of tabs based on screen size (default?) would be very useful for many users.

column1: [SAK-1624] Use "new" file picker for all attachments
column6:
All legacy tools that have attachments should use the "new" file picker in place of the attachment widget. Calendar and Announcements are using the new file picker as of August 2. Other tools should be converted to it, using Calendar and/or Announcements as examples.

The new file picker allows the the tool invoking it to specify that the file picker should display all content collections the user has access to instead of just showing the resources in the current site. It would make sense for the tool to have an init-param with a value of "true" or "false" indicating whether the attachment widget (the file picker) should show all content collections the user has access to. This would be useful, for example, to a student who wants to attach a document from a course site to a Calendar in MyWorkspace (using the "true" setting) while still avoiding the case where users make attachments to a project site from another site that other users have no rights in.

column1: [SAK-1623] DP: Conversion 1.5 --> 2.0
column6:
Email from Andrew Poland at IU re: 1.5 --> 2.0 conversion effort:

----Original Message----
From: Poland, Andrew J ajpoland@iupui.edu
Sent: Tuesday, June 07, 2005 2:04 PM
To: Poland, Andrew J; Glenn R. Golden; Charles S1912&?81
Cc: sakai-core-dev@umich.edu
Subject: RE: Conversion status

Whoops, meant to say:

More testing is still happening as we speak, but we are very optimistic
that it will come back with positive results.

Andrew

----Original Message----
From: Poland, Andrew J
Sent: Tuesday, June 07, 2005 4:02 PM
To: Glenn R. Golden; 'Charles S1912&?81'
Cc: sakai-core-dev@umich.edu
Subject: Conversion status

Conversion is looking really good. We now have a working copy of Sakai
2.0 running against data copied from a 1.5 instance. For the most part
everything appears to be functional! More testing is happening as we
speak, but we are

We executed our script against a snapshot of production. Found a few
extra things that weren't immediately obvious until the app started up
for the first time. We will share the complete script with all of you
shortly.

SYLLABUS_T needed to be renamed to SAKAI_SYLLABUS_ITEM
SYLLABUS_DATA_T needed to be renamed to SAKAY_SYLLABUS_DATA

Site skin names needed to be altered. Sakai 2.0 doesn't want to see
'.css' in the SKIN column. Fixed this by running:

update SAKAI_SITE set SKIN='oncourse' where SKIN='oncourse.css';

I'll work on a generic version we can distribute which will chop '.css'
off the end of any value in that column.

There is still one warning that I am seeing on a regular basis for which
I cannot yet pin down a cause:

WARN: Sql.dbRead: unable to read a result from sql: select NAME, VALUE
from SAKAI_SITE_TOOL_PROPERTY where ( TOOL_ID = ? ) 1113887213337-148867
row: 1 (2005-06-07 15:44:30,537
TP-Processor18_org.sakaiproject.component.framework.sql.BasicSqlService)

This shows up (several times in a row) pretty much any time I bring up
or switch to a worksite. If I run this query manually it does return
rows for the particular TOOL_ID its looking for.

We haven't made any changes to SAKAI_SITE_TOOL_PROPERTY, and the DDL for
this table looks identical between 1.5 and 2.0, so I'm not sure what's
up. Does anyone have an idea? Let me know if I need to supply
additional info.

Thanks,
Andrew
