column1: [SAK-1909] Client-Side Timer resets if user turns off JavaScript
column6:
When taking a timed assessment, users can turn off/on JavaScript and reset the assessment timer.

Due to later work on server side timer, this is mostly just a UI issue now.
column10: Client-Side Timer resets if user turns off JavaScript
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Ed - I thought the server kept the time not client. Am I wrong?
column90:
The server does not run the timer, but takes the timer information on each post.
Unfortunately the redirect/no JavaScript no redirect "You must have JavaScript." page solution that is standard in the usual cases does not apply, since the user will be deliberately messing up their user experience to cheat by shutting it off each time they post.

The server has to keep partial elapsed time to initialize the timer. This keeps the user from being dunned for page loading time (like in finals week).

Because of the number of pages hit (if on TOC, say) handling the JavaScript disable directly would be tricky.

Maybe we could put in a check that would be fairly easy to write.

Have a hidden field, or cookie that has a "bad" value and the page JavaScript sets it to a "good" value on post. Not super-duper secure, but we could have a validation on the server via a non-obvious algorithm. The client value creation JavaScript could be dynamic so that it won't work even for the same page at any other time.
column95: OK, I have worked out a more elegant approach. I will have the timer maintain the time since the current epoch, and therefore I can detect Javascript being suspended by the fact that there is a significant offset on an iteration of the timer.
column99:
OK partial fix. If the timer is restarted it compares the last seen time and if more than 10 second interval is seen the time is added in with a penalty, and a JavaScript must be enabled alert is thrown up.

The student will be forced to submit as no other navigation will work. However, to make this a perfect fix, we we could add an onsubmit code that sets a hidden variable, and throws an exception.

I have this code written, I just need to debug it, and hopefully check it in. As typical with delivery, this involves a large number of modules.
deliverAssessment.jsp
tableOfContents.jsp
DeliveryBean.java
DeliveryActionListener.java
SubmitToGradingActionListener.java
column103:
Fix revision 1477.

There are two fixes.

1) if you turn JavaScript off temporarily before posting, you should get your time incremented (should even include a penalty) when you turn it on.

2) if you turn it off and post
a) your submission Confirmation Number should be blank
b) an IllegalAccessException should be logged in the log

Note: if you turn off JavaScript before taking the test you can't get to it (a property of JSF commandLinks).

This fix is very complex and should be tested carefully. If it prevents most cheating it is probably fine. What we need to make sure of is that it doesn't screw up anybody on any supported browser platform.

By the way, I am aware that logging an error isn't a very good user interface in case 2, there will probably be an enhancement that gives an error message in the UI later on.
column107:
I've found a couple of ways to get around the fix so far, as discussed. Here's the first detailed scenario:

Environment: PC, IE, mysql instance

  • Log in, begin taking assessment
  • Let timer run for a few minutes on TOC
  • Go to question 1
  • Turn off javascript
  • Get "Javascript must be enabled!" box, timer skips forward and continues counting
  • Go to next question - now the timer is gone
  • Answer all questions, go to TOC, submit
  • Get no confirmation number, so it wasn't submitted.
  • Return to assessment list
  • Turn on javascript again
  • Retake assessment
  • The assessment still has my saved question data and also saved the timer at the point where I turned js off.
  • Submit again, and this time get a confirmation number. Tada!

Next scenario to follow.
column111:
Environment: PC, FF, mysql

  • Log in as student, begin taking assessment
  • Go to a question page (not TOC)
  • Turn off Javascript; the timer stops
  • Navigate back and forth through the questions w/buttons
    (don't just stay on the same page)
  • When ready, turn javascript back on
  • Navigate to another page w/button to refresh
  • Timer will resume right where it left off
  • Submit, get a confirmation number

It's hard to think of another scenario as long as these two work. (Like figuring out how to pick the lock while the door is wide open...)
column115:
Hi,

Just some thoughts: Would it be possible to store the user's start time in the database, and have the session counter check back against the database for the time remaining? This would seem certain to keep the time issues out of the user's control. In terms of network lag time and dunning, perhaps there could be a built-in grace period (~1 minute?) that faculty could be advised about. (I.e., students really have 11 minutes to take a 10 minute exam, but that extra minute is not advertised. Yes, they would find out about it pretty quick, but we explain it's there for their benefit, etc.)

Cheers,

Jim
column139:
OK I have checked in what I think is a reasonable solution for the first scenerio.

There are, I think, two reasons for timed assessments: 1) drill, and 2) high stakes. Drill would be where you want to develop the ability faster and faster but you are not really concerned with high stakes, but practice: language perhaps?

So my solution is to decrement the retake count by one.

If the instructor allows you to retake several times, reducing the retakes seems reasonable--why somebody would disable JS in such a case??? Show off their speed? Unlikely. What is more important is high stakes.

There the teacher would probably only allow one take, and the student would get their single submission thrown away.
column187: I think that it is dangerous for us to make assumptions about what a instructor does with a timed assessment and to provide penalties, ect. The begin and end time needs to be tracked if it is not. If a user is tinkering with the java script during the test, it'd be nice to prevent them from continueing through. If that's not possible, Perhaps a flag is set off upon submission so the instructor knows? I'm just throwing out ideas but I think this is something that needs discussion.
column191:
We need to be extremely careful in thinking about what functionality and utlimately what solution we provide here. Guessing at what faculty will assume and believe the tool is doing is not our best bet. IU has been using timed assesmments for over 5 years and we have tried a variety of solutions. One thing has held true. Faculty are extremely unhappy when an assessment is set as timed (fixed duration) and students can either defeat the timing or extend the time they have access to the test. Anything other than server side, secured time locking would be unacceptable in this situation.

The use case of someone testing their speed or ability to quiz themselves based on time can be accomplished so many other ways, but security can NOT be compromised in testing. There are a variety of features implemented in this tool by design to ensure that cheating is mitigated substantially. i.e. one question delivery at a time, randomized question and response delivery, question pools, etc. There are also a variety of test settings to allow faculty or facilitators enhance security. Our experience has been that timed test means just that. When you try to trick the system, add a minute here or give the student a break here or there, you are introducing major support issues. A timed test of 60 minutes should be just that, 60 minutes. From the second the server sends the test to the second it is returned. This all should be logged in the server as well and available to the instructor for varification.

Ed, if you are the developer working on this item and have specific questions about this functionality, please let me know. I would be more than happy to discuss this in great detail. Thanks.
column195: An interesting discussion, and I fully agree with Rob's comments. Even though I suggested it, I agree that adding "hidden" time is not a good idea. (But I was trying to think of a way around the, "This keeps the user from being dunned for page loading time (like in finals week)" issue). Does anyone know how these timing issues are handled if there are problems? Does anyone have experience they can share about student challenges? Thanks, Jim
column199:
From the discussions that we have heard from various folks, it does not sound like the slick continuous timer UI interface is designed in accordance with what the instructors want. Or at least it is a possibility, that you want to scrap this interface and start over. If that is correct, we need to do a design review and redesign of this feature. And I don't think there is time to add this in for 2.1.

However, I think we can have a solution within the scope of the current design that I can close off all the avenues of JavaScript trickery, and retain the current interface.

I have a technique where the submission will not post a submission id verification number and will decrement the allowable retakes (to 0 if it is 1) if JavaScript is disabled. I have also solved the issue of temporary disabling of JavaScript, but enabling it when posting. I maintain a last observed time in the timer loop, so that even if it is disabled, it resets the elapsed time on the client, when it is enabled. I currently have a penalty, but I can take that out.

We have yet to add similar logic to the other navigation buttons for previous and next navigation. We also need to add in some UI warning to the student, as a UI detail, so that their attention is drawn to the fact that the submission id has not been issued.

We do have logic to time the page loads, which could be significant at some peak usage periods ("keeps the user from being dunned for page loading time (like in finals week)"). During the period of page load the student cannot see the next page, and thus would gain no real advantage from that. In other words the design is to time from the second the client gets the test (not server sends the test) to the second the client returns the test. This is why we have a cooperative client-server clock, instead of just a server clock.
column203: Would it be possible to just refuse access to the assessment if the user does not have Javascript turned on? Or are we discussing what should happen if Javascript is disabled after the user accesses the assessment?
column207:
Yes. Welcome Kristol. That is exactly what we are discussing.
Actually you cannot use JSF-activated links at all if you have JavaScript disabled. In fact that means that you can't go to the test at all. So all this sturm und drang is about users that disable JavaScript so the timer stops, look up the answer and restart the timer.

While JavaScript is disabled, you can only navigate through JSF buttons but not links.

Because Daisy is ensuring that the server side timer is correct for a separate SAK issue, this becomes less pressing than it was before. To complete this, I just need to do the same for the next & prev buttons I did for the submittal button. Of course if the server side clock is realiable, it doesn't matter if the JavaScript clock is disabled.
column211: Because server side timer enforces persisted times, deferring past 2.1
column215:
I am flagging this "won't fix", but it is really a non-issue given Daisy's redo of delivery.
When that is completed, all time will be kept on the server, autosubmit will be done by the client with a fallback on the server, so the student will get no advantage out of turning off JavaScript.

column1: [SAK-1610] Ability to show all collections should be configurable
column6:
This is related to SAK-1466 Closed and SAK-1559 Closed .
Some sakai installations urgently need the ability to navigate upwards in Resources and/or in the file-picker. And others don't want that at all.
It should be possible to set a property for the Resources tool that allows upward navigation in the tool. The default should be that it does not allow upward navigation.
It should be possible to set an attribute in state as part of enabling invocation of the file-picker by a tool that allows upward navigation if that makes sense for the tool. If that attribute is not set, the default should that upward navigation is not enabled.
column10: Ability to show all collections should be configurable
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: The "new" file-picker is working in Calendar and Announcements. In both cases, it is configured to show only the resources within the current site, rather than showing all content collections the user has access to.
column90: Jim, the configuration for this setting should really go into sakai.properties. The ServerConfigurationService allows you to easily retrieve these settings. The naming conventions in there are sort of all over the place, but I might suggest a property name like resources.show.all.collections=true. Thanks, L
column95: We made this a tool-specific property tgo make it possible to show all collections when in MyWorkspace (where permissions are less likely to cause unpredictable results) but not in a course site or project site. This is especially important for the file-picker, because adding an attachment across site boundaries is likely to result in an error. Is it possible we could set the default property in sakai.properties, but still let it be set for each tool placement?
column99: Jim, I don't quite understand what you are saying. The setting as it stands is embedded in an xml file that gets deployed with that tool. Are you suggesting someone would physically deploy the tool more than once? I don't think so, but just clarifying. Right now you have a boolean that affects the behavor of that entire tool as far as I can tell. My proposal would be no different except that people expect to find these kind of settings in sakai.properties and they do not want to have to modify source code and compile to affect a change like this. To say it a different way, this needs to be a runtime configuration and not compile time. Thanks, L
column103: With the property in the content.properties file, when you create/edit the site in the Sites editor, you can go down to the tool level and change the setting of that property for this placement of the tool.
column107: The new file picker is working in Calendar and Anncouncements. Another ticker ( SAK-1624 Closed ) suggests that it should be used in other legacy tools.
column111: Due to insufficiant QA resources, this issue was not verified via the formal QA process but is included (ie fixed) in a production version of Sakai (2.1). If you find this report is still a problem, please re-open the ticket.

column1: [SAK-1609] Can't set permissions in Resources folders
column6: Can't set permissions for folders in Resources. The top-level permissions for the Resources tool take over (ignore) whatever permissions may be set for the folders.
column10: Can't set permissions in Resources folders
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Could we have more info about this ticket? Permissions can be increased as you descend into a file/folder hierarcy in Sakai, but permissions granted at a higher level in the hierarchy cannot be withdrawn deeper in the hierarchy. For example, if the collection's root folder gives "access" users read-only permission, a subfolder can grant "access" users read/write permissions, but cannot deny read access. Please clarify whether this ticket is reporting that the permissions are not working as described above OR suggesting a change in that policy.
column90: I am unable to reproduce this in Sakai-2.0.1. If you have further information, please feel free to re-open this issue.
column95:
I believe the problem being reported is that one can't ungrant a permission that has been granted to a role at a parent folder. So, since in order to see anything in resources, a role has to have content.read at the root level folder, there's no way to take that away on any subfolder.

So you can't block anyone (take away their read permission) from seeing subfolders. You can only add permissions (e.g. add content.write to allow them to upload to a subfolder).

This is asking for the deny ability - something we've wanted for a long time. I think this particular capability - w/r to resources - is coming with 2.1.
column99: Right. John has described eloquently the desired functionality/issues behind this request.
column103:
FYI, I've found a way to work around just my immediate problem.

1) turn off access permissions to "resources" for the role you want to control
2) create a subfolder in resources for things you DO want that role to access
3) alter the permissions on that folder to the the selected role appropriate permissions
4) right click to copy the link to that folder into the clipboard
5) go to site_info>edit_tools
6) add a "web content " tool with a name that indicates that it contains resources for the special role
7) paste the copied link into the tool url
8) finish/update the site info

Users with the designated role will have approriate access to the special tool, but be barred from the more general site resources.

It would be nice if one could also change the name of the "resources" tool to somehow also indicate that it is for use only by specific roles, thus avoiding undesirable "permission denied" errors, But I imagine a little experience will train users in what they can and cannot access on the site.
column107: We also considered taking the workaround approach that Jeff Barnett suggested above, but when we discovered that the permissions for Drop Box were hopelessly intertwined with the permissions for Resources, we had to abandon this work-around. Otherwise, by blocking students' read access to Resources we also blocked their ability to access their Drop Boxes. Unfortunately I don't think the granularity of Resources has been improved in 2.1....
column111:
We too have hit this issue and are finding that it is especially problematic for our fully online courses in which faculty often want to "release" or "open" course content at specific times. Finer grain control of permissions a the sub-folder level would be the best solution in our minds. Jeff's workaround is OK but not something we think the majority of our faculty will be comfortable doing...it also adds more options to the left nav bar which makes it useful for only a few cases as the bar become too long.

Another workaround we're trying for now is to use the Assignment tool. Faculty can attach their content to the assignment and then schedule it to "open" at a specific time. Not ideal but it is working for now.

Is there a way to get an update on the status of this issue? Sorry, I'm a newbie...

Josh
column115: This issue is not currently being worked on. It has been moved into the requirements process as SAK-8151 Closed .
column139: See SAK-8151 Closed for progress going forward on this issue.
column187: This ticket is now moot. The release/retract and hide features should take care of it. If there are still related issues, please open a new ticket for them.

The permission that allows instructors to "remove" class participants or make them "inactive" needs to be broken down into two separate ones. Instructors should be able to make class participants inactive, but there are cases where they should NOT have the ability to remove participants and their records from the site, as a result. In many cases, "drops" happen only with Admissions.

column1: [SAK-1606] unjoinable sites should not have the option to unjoin
column6: A site that is not "joinable" by default should not have an "unjoin" link under membership. The availability of "unjoin" causes users to unjoin sites for which they are members by mistake, including instructors who lose access to their sites and can't join back in because the site is not joinable.
column10: unjoinable sites should not have the option to unjoin
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
I can easily think of some circumstances where people will want to unjoin sites that are not joinable. Rather than remove the "unjoin" link entirely, it should produce a confirmation page that clearly states that the site cannot be rejoined, allow the user to remain in the site, remove themselves from the site, or go to the site (maybe in a new window) to see which site they are unjoining before making a decision.

As to the circumstances - at Rutgers our computing services took a very conservative approach to integrating rosters with WebCT. When the site participant list is synced with the rosters students are added but never dropped. The benefit is that if a student has registration problems their data is not removed from the course site, they can continue to access the course site while they work out the registration problem, and the instructor has no need to re-enter grades when the student finally gets back on the roster. The disadvantage is that the participant list contains students who are no longer taking the course.

I don't know if we will be using the same approach with Sakai, but in all likelihood the courses that automatically pull in the roster will not be "joinable", and if we proceed as we did with WebCT students who dropped the course will need to unjoin.
column90:
Yes, a confirmation page where users can make a choice or cancel would be best, as, clearly, different institutions handle things differently.

In our case, students drop with the Registrar's office, and if dropped, they are marked as "inactive" in Sakai under Student Info as opposed to "removed" from the site. We want the student records to remain with the site for grade desputes, incompletes, etc.
column95:
The original idea was to allow someone to unjoin a site that they had been added to. Someone might add you to a site and you don't want to be a participant of that site.

Seems the best would be to 1) add the confirmation screen to make it clearer what might happen if you unjoin (can't rejoin), and 2) make it configurable via sakai.properties as to whether an institution wants to allow users to unjoin nonjoinable sites. For example, if allow.unjoin=false in sakai.properties, then the unjoin action wouldn't show for non-joinable sites.

It should be the case (used to be) that a student coming into the class site via the provider id unjoins, they are re-inserted the next time the site's realm is updated (when some change occurs). So only the manually added participants would be unable to get back to the site after they unjoined an unjoinable site.
column99: Even better! The confirmation screen coupled with the sakai.properties file control (your #2 point) would allow for ultimate flexibility and control.

Example, the Slacker Astronomy podcast feed:

column1: [SAK-1601] configuration files don't belong in jar files
column6:
This is a general comment, because examples exist all over the place. The worst is probably all the files in legacy/bundle/src/bundle/.

Configuration files don't belong in jars. The current setup requires you to rebuild from source (or edit jars by hand) to change configurations and messages. That's a problem for sites that don't want to build from source, and even those that do will have to go through a much longer process than necessary.
column10: configuration files don't belong in jar files

If you are interested in working on this issue or feel it is still applicable to the latest Sakai release, please feel free to reopen.

column1: [SAK-1600] absurd approach to supplying text in long messages
column6:
This bug applies to a number of components. Consider for example the resources area, "Mange/Download multiple resources". This is a long piece of text, which is mostly static but has a few generated values (in this case, URLs) included. It is currently implemented via a number of text fragments in content.properties. The generated text is inserted between these fragments.

This has all kinds of problems.

1) It's incredibly inconvenient to change. If you want to change it, you have to look at the code to see how the strings in content.properties maps to the final text.

2) If you need to change the number of times generated text occurs, you have to change the code as well as content.properties.

The normal approach would be to do pattern substitution. Instead of having

foo1=The url you want is
foo2=. If you use this URL you will get to the main entry point for site
foo3=. We guarantee it

print foo1 + generateURL() + foo2 + getsitename() + foo3

you really want

foo = The URL you want is $1. If you use this URL you will get to the main entry point for site $2. We guarantee it.

print sakai-substitute(foo, generateURL(), getsitename)

column1: [SAK-1594] All announcements don't show until you change the number of Annc to display
column6: If I have many announcements, when I first go to the Annc tool, the 10 most recent are not showing. If I change to sort by the various columns, I still do not get the correct set of 10 announcements. If I change the number of annc to display to 20 or some other value, that seems to reset the list properly, and then all announcements show.
column10: All announcements don't show until you change the number of Annc to display
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
I don't think the problem is that the announcements are not showing, I think that's a side effect of a problem with the sort order. It seems that when you sort the announcements by date so that the most recent are showing first (which would be the natural choice for announcements), what it actually does is subsort only the announcements on the current page. The main sort order remains sorted by date, oldest first.

For example when set to sort by descending date, you end up with

– Page 1-- (containing the oldest announcements)
Sept 3
Sept 2
Sept 1

– Page 2-- (containing the newest announcements)
Sept 6
Sept 5
Sept 4

Page 1 and Page 2 should be reversed.
But Sakai should sort all the announcements first, then page them out, so the page order would be reversed. It seems to be paging them out prior to sorting.

column1: [SAK-1592] java.lang.OutOfMemory Error
column6:
On Jul 25, 2005, at 6:16 PM, Murthy Tanniru wrote:

Hi All,

We are running sakai_2-0-rc3 on tomcat 5.5 with mysql as database
running on
Linux with memory settings as JAVA_OPTS="-Xms256m -Xmx2048m".
Tomcat went
out of memory when about 15 users are using Samigo. Did any one
encounter
this?
column10: java.lang.OutOfMemory Error
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
From: "Glenn R. Golden" <ggolden@umich.edu>

  • set your -Xms and -Xmx the same, otherwise java is slower to manage
    memory
  • use -server too
  • we ran into trouble with garbage collection with -Xmx over 1 gig,
    so we just set it to 1 gig now.
  • tune your garbage collection parameters for best performance.
  • Glenn

-Xms256m is too small for running Samigo. We recommend that you have at least 1GB RAM in your service set

JAVA_OPTS="-Xms512m -Xmx512m".

If you are running solaris 10, try these setting to increase performance:

JAVA_OPTS="$JAVA_OPTS "-Xmx512m -Xms512m -XX:+UseISM -XX:NewSize=128m -XX:+UseConcMarkSweepGC -XX:+UseParNewGC

Daisy

Samigo does not impose any limit on file upload. However, I don't know if this is a condition imposed on the xml file that you used for importing assessment. Let's ask Ed.

Daisy
column95:
Lance,

isn't resource tool quota set at 1GB?
<property name="siteQuota"><value>1048576</value></property>

This is the only quota value that I found in kernel.

Anyway, it won't affect Samigo, 'cos we are using our own file upload jsf component.

Daisy
column99:
OK this is one of the tricky cases where you'd want to say infinity, except that you don't want to because you know it would break something.

It is really really hard to make an assessment xml that is of a huge size.

OK we have two options.

1. If it is a requirement that we specify a file size, we'll say 5MB. That is arbitrary, but if you want to say that, nobody will find a way to contradict you. The reason is because making 5MB of QTI requires a very! large! assessment! Like thousands of questions. So that is the easy way.

2. The hard way is to make a very large assessment. This would have to be done artificially, since we don't have the resources to do it manually. I don't see that happening for a bug of this low a priority.
column103: Say 5MB

column1: [SAK-1585] T&Q "Create New Assignment" help incorrect
column6:
nightly2.sakaiproject.org instance (still says 2.0.0)

The "Create a New Assessment" section of Tests&Quizzes help says (under Create a Question):

—
Note: The value you enter in the "Answer Point Value:" field will determine the point value for each response within a multiple correct question. If your question has two correct answers, entering 10 in the "Answer Point Value:" field will make each response worth 10 points and the entire question worth 20 points.
–

This is incorrect. Multiple choice multiple correct questions follow the same scoring rules as other types. If a question is worth 10 points and has two correct answers, each of those answers will be worth 5 points. FIB and matching questions are scored the same way.

column1: [SAK-1583] Ability of File Helper to save to Resources folder
column6:
Attachments should be accessible through the resources tool of people with permissions to view the attachments. This could be done by placing the resources in a known folder viewable within the resources tool for the site. Or the file picker could allow the user to designate where the file is saved.

This is especially important for OSP and NEES, but relevant to other users as well.
column10: Ability of File Helper to save to Resources folder
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
The need is for user to be able to select any resource she has access to or to create (and simultaneously select) a new resource. It seems like these two issues should be merged and dealt with simultaneously.

As I understand it, the resource/attachment should be saved in just one place, which is accessible by the person who is adding it as an attachment.

This functionality is needed within the OSPi tools, but the current file picker is already used in legacy tools. Randall is working on a new set of permissions for OSPi, that might restrict the user from modifying a file that has been attached in an OSPi tool (see http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/jira/browse/SAK-1476), but what about resources attached to calendar events or assignments? Should the user be able to delete/replace/modify them from resources where they might not realize they are also used as attachments? What if the same file is attached to two or more items?
column90: A "file-picker" helper mode has been created within ResourcesAction. It is used in Calendar and Announcements. It can be used from other legacy tools. See SAK-1624 Closed .
column95: The new file picker lets user upload a file from their computer, save it in a resources folder and attach it simultaneously. This satisfies the requirement because now all new attachments will be placed in a resources file accessible by the user.
column99:
When I attach a new file, that I browse for from my computer hard drive, to an announcement or calendar item, I do not see the item in my Resources folders. If I understand the above correctly, I should see it in Resources?

I tried this on all three sites, MySQL,HSQLDB and Oracle. In all three cases, I was able to attach an item from the existing files in the Resources folder--but was not able to designate the folder in Resources to which a new item being attached to an announcement/calendar item, should go. In fact, I have no idea where the new items I attached are stored.

I was using WindowsXP, SP 2, Firefox 1.0.6.
column103: This was backed out in response to a later JIRA ticket. Attachments are not publicly available for the time-being. This will be handled for release 2.2.
column107: Reopening this as a feature request.
column111: Please close this ticket and reopen a new one for each tool that uses attachments (or for each set of tools with common requirements) giving a clear description of what is required for that tool (or set of tools). This ticket has a lot of (now) irrelevant history. For Sakai 2.2, we will have the ability to leave resources where they are and make them available in other contexts. We'll also have the ability to make a copy of a resource in a hidden attachments area with the right permissions for the place it's to be seen. What we need is a clear description for each tool of the desired behavior and the UI that will make that available to the user.
column115: This work has been completed to the extent originally requested.

column1: [SAK-1579] Samigo: Templates: Feedback: Student's Response checked by default
column6: mARC, It seems that the student's response in feedback for the default template is checked by default. What this means is that as the student is taking the assessment, he/she can return to the table of contents to see if he/she received all of the available points for a question. I believe that most faculty will consider this a bug rather than a feature as it allows a student to change his/her answer(s) and check to see if he/she has received all of the available points for the question(s). I suggest we disable this option by default.

column111:
By subtle signs in the format, it appears that this is a 1.5 XML export. Apparently the 'Authenticated Users' type in its released to field is no longer supported but was available in 1.5. Thus no released to setting is selected and the settings screen misfires.

We need to have some setting by default, that still exists. Here is a possible fix. I will try it and see if I can confirm:

$ svn commit -m "SAK-1578: cannot save settings without a released to setting, setting set to obsolete 'Authenticated Users', in which case setting released to
'Anonymous Users'." business/entity/helper/MetaDataList.java
Sending business/entity/helper/MetaDataList.java
Transmitting file data .
Committed revision 820.
column115:
Seems to bypass above code, but have intercepted it as it is being set:
sakai-dev3:/usr/local/home/esmiley/sam/src/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/business/entity/helper: svn commit -m "SAK-1578: cannot save settings
without a released to setting, setting set to obsolete 'Authenticated Users', in which case setting released to 'Anonymous Users'." ExtractionHelper.java
Sending ExtractionHelper.java
Transmitting file data .
Committed revision 824.
column139:
Fix version 824.
Note that this is a quick fix affecting 2 files that fixes a 1.5 backward compatibility issue in released to settings.

I originally didn't want to expose this setting to automatic update in import from the settings of origin, for just these sort of reasons. However, the absence of the original settings was considered a bug when importing Sakai exports.

I think we need to revisit this for version 2.1. There may be changes in this for section awareness, which will increase the likelyhood of incompatibility of releasedto imformation between sites, or within the same site over time. Perhaps always setting it to a lowest common denominator released to setting, and always allowing it to be changed after import?

Stay tuned to the section discussions....
column187:

column1: [SAK-1577] WYSIWYG spacing issues
column6:
nightly qa builds on coursework-s1

Right now a line break in the WYSIWYG editor is interepreted as a double-space. If you create a question with line breaks in the text, like the following poem, it'll come out double-spaced like so:

Weasels are furry

Weasels are blue

Weasels have teeth

And so do you

That looks OK when you view the question in delivery, but in the TOC the question text looks like this (see attachments):

1. weasels are furryweasels are cuteweasels have teethand claws to boot (0.0/0.0 Points)

And when you grade the assessment, the model short answer looks like this (see attachments):

Model Short Answer: <p>wombats are fuzzy, wombats are blue. wombats have teeth, and so do you. </p><p>wombats have ears, wombats have feet. wombats dig tunnels that look pretty neat. </p>

Presumably doublespacing was put in for a reason, and that's ok, but it needs to be consistently interpreted.
column10: WYSIWYG spacing issues
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
Hmmm. I seem to recall that there is a method somewhere that gets all the text from a question and throws away the HTML formatting, to allow it to display as a single line of text.

Correct behavior, I'd guess, would be to add at least a space between every piece of text in TOC, since it is supposed to be on one line:

weasels are furry weasels are cute weasels have teeth and claws to boot (0.0/0.0 Points)

I am not sure what it should be on grading.
column90: Oops, I was going to assign this to Huong, but I think you need to take a look at this first.
column95:
It seems like the problem is that when <br />'s are stripped for TOC display, any space between words are also stripped. A space needs to be left in.

If this same problem is in grading it should also be fixed.

column90:
Maybe the fix wasn't pulled into the release, or maybe the nightly2, 3 stable 4c4, and oracle stable rc3 (8020) aren't setup for email properly. Still wasn't working on those when I just checked. Here is the sakai.properties for rc4 oracle (8120). I believe that notifyNewUserEmail=true is the default setting, so not having it in sakai.properties shouldn't matter.

  1. sakai.properties - the demo edition
  1. set the shared datasource URL to use a file based HSQLDB
    #url@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=jdbc:hsqldb:$ {sakai.home}

    /db/sakai.db

###################################################################################################
#

  1. examples of other driver class name values - HSQLDB is the default
    #driverClassName@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=org.hsqldb.jdbcDriver
    #driverClassName@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=com.mysql.jdbc.Driver
    driverClassName@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleDriver
    #
    ###################################################################################################
    #
  2. examples of other datasource URLs for other technologies: HSQLDB in-memory is the default, and above see how to put this in a file
    #url@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=jdbc:hsqldb:.
    #url@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/sakai?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF-8
    url@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=jdbc:oracle:thin:@pleione.mit.edu:1521:sakaidb1
    username@javax.sql.DataSource=sakai21user
    password@javax.sql.DataSource=sakai2password
    #
    maxActive@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=40
    maxIdle@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=10
    #
    ###################################################################################################
    #
  3. example vendor settings - must match your hibernate dialect set in the "placeholder.properties" file - "hsqldb" is the default
    #vendor@org.sakaiproject.service.framework.sql.SqlService=hsqldb
    #vendor@org.sakaiproject.service.framework.sql.SqlService=mysql
    vendor@org.sakaiproject.service.framework.sql.SqlService=oracle
    #
    ###################################################################################################
    #
  4. set the validation query - the default is for hsqldb "select 1 from SYSTEM_USERS"
    #validationQuery@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=select 1 from SYSTEM_USERS
  5. for MySQL and Oracle, change it to this:
    validationQuery@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=select 1 from DUAL
    #
    ###################################################################################################
    #
  6. Examples of interesting values to set. This is not an inclusive list, since every property can be overridden in the property files
    #
  7. set the default skin
    #skin.default=default
    #
  8. set the path to the skin repository
    #skin.repo=/library/skin
    #
    ###################################################################################################
                                                                                                                                                                                                      1. more setting G.Li
                                                                                                                                                                                                        serverId=sakai-stable
                                                                                                                                                                                                        #
                                                                                                                                                                                                        serverUrl=http://sakai-stable.mit.edu:8120
                                                                                                                                                                                                        #
                                                                                                                                                                                                        serverName=sakai-stable.mit.edu
                                                                                                                                                                                                        #
  2. email setting
    smtp@org.sakaiproject.service.framework.email.EmailService=asterope.mit.edu
    mail.support=dippel@ix.netcom.com
    setup.request=dippel@ix.netcom.com
    smtp.dns.1=18.72.0.3
    smtp.dns.2=18.71.0.151
    smtp.enabled=true
  1. add version G.Li 2005-06-06
    version.service=2.0.1.rc4-oracle
    version.sakai=2.0.1.rc4
column95:
Oops - sorry - I did receive the email notification from http://sakai-stable.mit.edu:8020 (I missed it as it was caught by my spam filter).
As I recall, email is setup properly on that server, but not on the other (rc4r) stable machines.
Make sure you haven't set notifyNewUserEmail=false in your sakai.properties. It defaults to true though, so if you wnat email notification of new account pwds you don't need to have notifyNewUserEmail in sakai.properties.

You also need to make sure you have email setup properly on your installation, via other property settings in sakai.properties. For example:

  1. smtp server for outgoing emails - overrides that configured in the email service
    smtp@org.sakaiproject.service.framework.email.EmailService=

Another check to make is to see if notification from adding a new announcement or resource is working.
column99:
My issue was that I did not have the setup.request in my sakai.properties. Once I put that in with an email address, everything worked.

In looking through the components.xml file, that property is commented out, leading me to believe that it's an obsolete property, but I guess that's not true. Any ideas how I could determine which settings do and do not go into sakai.properties?

At the very least, I would be interested in knowing which settings are mandatory for proper functioning of Sakai. For example, I would say that setup.request is necessary, but it's nowhere to be found in the sample sakai.properties files provided.

Thanks.

column1: [SAK-1563] serverId cannot have a space in its name
column6:
if you have a space in the serverId setting in sakai.properties, strange things happen after you log in.

Specifically, after logging in, a 302 redirect is sent to the browser. If you have a space in the serverId, there is no Location: header in the response, which causes a blank page to appear since the browser doesn't know where to go.

I guess one shouldn't put spaces in these names, but probably documenting this issue would help others avoid this problem. I also don't know whether it's possibly a parsing type of bug, with the space causing an abnormal end before the location header is set?

column6:

Visible as Tabs

would be parallel yet similar to what's already there. Or maybe

Hide tab for...
Show tab for...

I think a text change here could really improve users' understanding of the relationship between these lists.

I also think it would make more sense to have the list on the left that items start out in (i.e., the list of sites which already have tabs showing), and move items to the list on the right (i.e., sites whose state you have decided to change by hiding their tabs).

column111: This issue was not verified in the formal QA process but is included in a production version of Sakai (2.1). If you find this is still a problem, please re-open.
column115:
I don't have permission to re-open a ticket, and I'm not sure if comments are sent out if a ticket is closed, but I do have a few questions. I'm not sure what you mean, Megan, when you write "this issue was not verified by the formal QA process." Do you mean it doesn't vet as a bug? Or do you mean the QA team didn't think it was a usability issue? Or do you mean the QA team didn't review it at all?

Also, what does it mean that it "is included in a production version of Sakai 2.1?" Does that mean the Customize Tabs... feature is in fact part of 2.1? That the reported interface is still part of 2.1? That the issue might still be addressed by QA in 2.1?

Kristol's entries in the comment thread seem to imply that changes could be made that might improve the usability of this page. I guess I don't understand what happened between Kristol's Sept 7 comment and today's comment by Megan. If the interface remains unchanged, then indeed it is still a problem for our users. A bug, no. A feature request? Hardly a feature as it's mostly about clarifying the text prompt for the actions to be taken and perhaps tightening up the display. I'm still fuzzy about where UI refinements should end up, despite trying to pay good attention to the Discussion Group traffic on the Requirements process.
column139: Diane, the short answer is it was fixed in 2.1.0 as described above (see the Subversion Commits tab above), but insufficient QA resources were available for verifying all the fixes that went into 2.1.0. So, now that there is a 2.1.1 to occupy QA, all "out-of-date" issues are being closed with that generic comment.

column1: [SAK-1560] New Design for Handling Large Numbers of Users in Presence List
column6:
When a large number of users are logged on at the same time there is a vertical scroll bar in the presense window

IE 6.0.2900/ Windows XP
column10: New Design for Handling Large Numbers of Users in Presence List
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: in CTools only
column90: this also occurs in 2-1-1
column95: David, currently this is by design. The presence window is fixed-height, so once that is exceeded a scrollbar appears. Are you interested in seeing it behave in a different way?
column99:
Hi Peter,

We're generaly anti-internal scroll bars, they cause usability probekms for users (apart from asthetic concerns)

I cheked with our UI/interaction people with the question of "what should happen if 300 people are online in a site?" Their feelings where if the list is too long it should:
1) Indicate the number of users online "300 users online" with a click through to a full list . There was a feeling that this should be there in the case where the scrol bar exists anyway.
otherwise
2) Implement the option to switch off the presence on a per-site basis (I think there is a request for this).
or
3) drop the sroll bar altogether
column103:
It might be possible to implement #3 (suppress scrollbar) by CSS, if the presence list is included in a <div> with overflow:none. Perhaps Gonzalo can comment.

The number of users online sounds like a useful addition in any event.

column1: [SAK-1559] File Helper cannot navigate upwards
column6:
When a tool that depends on the File Helper is placed in a worksite, a user using that tool is restricted to only choosing Resource items from that worksite. After choosing "From Resources..." option, they cannot navigate to other sites, and more importantly, they cannot navigate to their own personal workspace Resources.

Ideally, the user would have a similar interface to the one in their Resource view, where they can navigate upwards to their personal Workspace files or to other worksite folders.
column10: File Helper cannot navigate upwards
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: See pages 20 and 21.
column90:
The need is for user to be able to select any resource she has access to or to create (and simultaneously select) a new resource. It seems like these two issues should be merged and dealt with simultaneously.

As I understand it, the resource/attachment should be saved in just one place, which is accessible by the person who is adding it as an attachment.

This functionality is needed within the OSPi tools, but the current file picker is already used in legacy tools. Randall is working on a new set of permissions for OSPi, that might restrict the user from modifying a file that has been attached in an OSPi tool (see http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/jira/browse/SAK-1476), but what about resources attached to calendar events or assignments? Should the user be able to delete/replace/modify them from resources where they might not realize they are also used as attachments? What if the same file is attached to two or more items?
column95:
Quoting John Leasia <jleasia@umich.edu>:

> Maybe I'm reading the doc wrong, but looks to me like you either pick
> a resource that already exists (using the Select link under the
> item), or you use add item to add the file to Resources, and then you
> would use the select to select it (or maybe after the add, since you
> are in the attachment flow, it automatically selects it for you for
> an attachment). I didn't see the part about making a copy into some
> attachments folder. I think making a copy could get confusing.
>
> John

You're right. That may have been my misreading the requirements. But with that in mind, this means a fairly significant change in the way attachments work. They will no longer be saved in a place the user can't get to. The attachment will be accessed from the user's workspace or a site resources folder (or possibly a dropbox folder?). What happens to the attachment if the user deletes the file from her workspace resources folder?
column99: I think what happens if someone deletes the file that was attached is that it just doesn't show up anymore as an attachment - it's not shown in the list of attachments to that thing it had been attached to. That's what happens now anyway, I think.
column103:
> John Leasia commented on SAK-1559:
> ----------------------------------
>
> I think what happens if someone deletes the file that was attached is
> that it just doesn't show up anymore as an attachment - it's not
> shown in the list of attachments to that thing it had been attached
> to. That's what happens now anyway, I think.
>

I tried this on nightly2:

1) added an attachment to an announcement in a project site
2) went to "attachments" folder in admin workspace and deleted the file
3) returned to project site and viewed attachment

John is correct. The disappeared attachment is gone. No problem at all.
column107: The "new" file picker is working in Calendar and Announcements.
column111: Verified on all 3 stables

column1: [SAK-1558] need at least a warning in assignments
column6:
It is known that grading in assignements doesn't flow into the gradebook. We're considered that faculty won't remember this. We suggest adding a warning next to the grade option of assignments: "NOTE: Grades entered here will not be put in the gradebook tool, if you are using it. If you are using gradebook, we suggest that you <link> open the gradebook <link>, make sure there is a column for this assignment, and put the grades there."

The link should open a second window. You should consider having only the gradebook itself, without the normal Sakai decoration. The window should be set to something smaller than the whole screen, since faculty often don't understand multiple windows very well, and won't realize what's going on if they can't see both windows.

If it's easy to test whether gradebook is active in the site, this should be done only when it is.
column10: need at least a warning in assignments
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: If Assignments (w/ grading option) and Gradebook exist in same worksite, then a warning should be presented in Assignments indicating that it is not hooked to Gradebook.

column1: [SAK-1557] melete: if you follow a link, there's no way back
column6: In melete, if you create a page with a link to an external web document. when the user follows the link, the new page will replace the melete page inside the iframe. Unfortunately the navigation is in the section that is replaced. Thus there is no obvious way back. I recommend making nested iframes, so that the navigation remains. (In fact, brower back will often recover, but Sakai users are trained not to use browser back. We don't want to try to explain that in just this one case they have to do so.)
column10: melete: if you follow a link, there's no way back

column55: Melete issues are not currently tracked in Sakai's Jira system. Please direct your inquiry to melete@foothill.edu.

column1: [SAK-1556] simple text leads to long lines and horizontal scrolling
column6:
Simple text produces a page with MIME type text/plain. Mozilla and IE do not wrap text. The text wraps when the user is enterring it. Most users will expect it to wrap when viewed. But in fact if they type a long paragraph, it will create horizontal scrolling through a very wide line.

I checked the RFC's. The suggestion is strong that text/plain should not have line wrapping applied. Thus I believe Mozilla and IE are right.

I see two solutions:

1) use text/plain; format=flowed [after verifying the Mozilla and IE implement it]

2) use a text entry box that's as wide as you expect typical browser to be. Perhaps set it to a width of 80. Include a warning that users should insert new lines where appropriate, because most browsers will not wrap the text.
column10: simple text leads to long lines and horizontal scrolling
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: See SAK-376 Closed for continuing progress on this issue.

column1: [SAK-1554] archive does not save gradebook
column6: Creating a site archive does not save the gradebook. We expect to be able to use archive/restore to move courses between copies of sakai (e.g. early adopters to the production version). We also need a way to save a user from errors. The obvious way is to start a copy of sakai on a backup of the database, export the user, remove the components that they didn't mess up, and then import the data. I don't want to go into production with a system where I can't restore the gradebook if something goes wrong.
column10: archive does not save gradebook
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column55: Oliver, pls. review and advise re: Priority of this issue then assign to Ray or Josh accordingly. Thanks! --C.
column90: What does it mean to archive the gradebook? Does it include the grade and student data? Or is it a shell w/ only grading scheme, the assignments and due dates for re-use in a later semester? Or just the assignments?
column95:
We would like archive to save all content on a site, whether gradebook or any other component.

1) Faculty often feel safer with an archive of their own. They expect everything to be there.
2) Archive and restore is a good way to move sites between beta and production status
3) Archive is useful if you're going to make a major change in a site, and want to be able to go back if you don't like the results.

I think it's a mistake to combine the functions of archive and "reset the site for a new semester." The correct design is for archive and copy site to move absolutely everything. Then there should be a "reset site for new semester" feature that lets you check which items you want to remove, e.g. all discussion content, all content except the topics, gradebook entries, turned in assignments. (Actually some more thought is probably needed for the next semester issue. The question is what to do about students with incompletes. Rather than clearing the gradebook and assignments, you'd actually like a new generation of gradebook and assignments, with the old one staying around as "previous semester." You can argue that it would be better to create a new course and copy the content, but I'm not sure as a faculty member I really want two different sites. If the hierarchy implementation comes out well, it may be possible to do what I'm asking.)
column99:
Complete Gradebook data should eventually be saved as part of the site archive by default. UCB will be unable to incorporate this change by 2.1.

Furthermore, committing to this now would mean large migration costs later because the gradebook is very likely to undergo significant changes over the next several releases, e.g., support for different grade types.

Full archiving should also be coordinated with new admninistrative UI for selective, fine grained archiving and re-use.
column103: Let's leave this as a Bug, even if it cannot be addressed immediatley. There is a high-expectation that any Sakai site can be exported and imported without loss of information. All tools need to support export/import for their data, unless noted otherwise in the Site Arhcive interface.
column107: Will this be resolved for 2.3.0?
column111: No. we do plan to revisit the issue this fall to see if we can finally define the requirements. Now that we have several tools sending grades to Gradebook in different ways, the issues around what should be archived and when are becoming clearer, we hope. We'll also want to understand any Sakai-wide approach. How are other tools archiving, what are the expectations/guidelines, and best practices, etc.
column115: Archive of the site content, when delete the site, is absolutely needed. Coz many users compliant that no archive is kept when the site is deleted. May I know what is the plan or schedule for this issue right now? Any good news? Thx a lot

column1: [SAK-1552] permissions in drop box do not appear to work
column6: As a site owner, I set permissions for "access" to be "read" but nothing else. (In fact, this is the default.) A user who is "access" is able to add items and remove them. This seems to be a bug. The user should only be able to do what permissions allow. Some faculty want to be able to give students read and new, but not delete. That way they can't put a document in the drop box and later delete or replace it. I believe it would make sense to default permissions to read, new, revise and delete, but if you clear one that should be implemented.
column10: permissions in drop box do not appear to work
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
A user with only the read permission should not be able to delete or revise items, unless they are also given those permissions. This is a bug.

The default settings could be changed, however, that is not a bug and those comments will be captured as a feature request.
column90: The default settings don't need to be changed as they are already set to allow only read-only access. It seems like these settings aren't actually being applied.
column95: We need to remove the Permissions page from Dropbox until finer grained permissions are added, and Dropbox is decoupled from Resources. Dropbox is showing the Resource permission page by mistake. By design, there shouldn't be a Permission page available from the Dropbox tool. The single permission - dropbox.own - can cause severe privacy problems if misused, so up to this point control of that permission hasn't been exposed to users. There are several other tickets on Dropbox permissions which address the desire for finer grained permissions, and decopuling from Resources. SAK-1828 Closed , 175.

column1: [SAK-1544] SakaiScript - doesn't require credentials to create users
column6: One can create a php script to create new users via sakaiscript and it will create the users despite no or bogus authentification details being provided. See atached sample code.
column7:
php with nusoap library
Sakaiscript-2005-07-07
mysql
column10: SakaiScript - doesn't require credentials to create users
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
Creating a new user in Sakai requires no authentication by default, OOTB. This design may need to change; I'd just like to point out that the reported behavior is by design, not a bug.

Using the New Account tool on the Sakai front page (gateway page), anyone can self-register. Anyone could self-register multiple times and create any number of accounts.

The web service for creating new users does automate the process, but as far as I can tell it doesn't open up a 'security hole' any larger than the classic self-registration problem posed by the New Account tool.

Dave, have you found further security issues beyond no-credentials-required? If there are futher issues, such as overwriting existing users, etc, we need to know about them.
column90:
Ok this was my error! with the user.add right removed from the !template.user realm annon role the service gives a permision error: "https://sakai.cet.uct.ac.za/sakai-axis/SakaiScript.jws?wsdl"

Behaves correctly when encountering duplicate accounts. However I believe a minor issue exists in that registering users anonymously can specify any TYPE and Sakai wil accept it. I think this is in the underlying code, but not exposed in the register tool, and not in the webservice per se
column95:
Allowing users to specify any TYPE is a significant bug - it would allow anonymous accounts to gain whatever priviledges are available through the user TYPE - potentially adding and deleting sites.

The TYPEs allowed could be a configuration variable on the web service. By default, it would only allow the "registered" type, the same as the New Account tool. But if an institution needed to allow other types, they could do so, and then lock down the web service. We might want a way to lock down web services by default, perhaps by requiring a valid Sakai admin account login to use them.
column99: Will this be resolved for 2.1.0?
column103: Any non-user can create a user - this is a feature of Sakai that allows a user to create new accounts. You can change this by changing the permissions setup to not allow new account creation except from authenticated users.

column55:
There are significant changes in how the tool title bars are rendered in 2.0.1. This only affects those developing new tools for Sakai, not those using only the existing tools. Only those new tools that also have their own online help document(s) would need to change anything in upgrading to 2.0.0. The change is forwards-compatible, in that a tool that works with its own custom titlebar in 2.0.0 needs only to add a configuration value or two in the tool registration, and it will work fine with the same code in both 2.0.0 and 2.0.1.

See the notes on SAK-1445 Closed for more detail on the changes.

column1: [SAK-1538] configure Sakai to force secure URLs
column6:
In some environments, we want to force the URLs back to Sakai to be https on some port, i.e. secure URLs. The rest of the URL can reflect the request URL, but sometimes we need to force the https.

Once case this is important is when using certain SSL hardware front ends - they will decode the SSL and forward the request to the app server as http, i.e. not secure. Sakai needs to NOT respond to this with URLs that are also not secure; instead, here's a case where we need to force the secure URLs even when the request is not secure.
column10: configure Sakai to force secure URLs
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
r711

force.url.secure can be set in the sakai.properties - set it to 443 for normal https, or some other port if needed. Leave it out to NOT force the urls to be secure

column1: [SAK-1535] 'remove user' doesn't really
column6:
Gonquin noticed that adding a user updates 14 tables, but on removal, a user is only removed from one.

Removing a user using the 'Users' tool only removes them from one table, and if a new user with the same userid is created later, things like their workspace and schedule are actually the ones from the first, deleted, user.

Bug or feature, this should be highlighted and noted in the 'Users' tool.
column10: 'remove user' doesn't really
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: This is a bug, not a feature. Deleting a user should delete all traces of them. New users should not be inheriting data randomly from previous users.
column90:
At this point, this should not be characterized as a "bug" because this is how the system is designed to work. Because users may come and go, we do not expunge all evidence of the user's existence when the user goes away.

Given that Sakai completely externalizes its user directory through a provider, there is no sure way to even "know" when a user has disappeared. It is a bug if some tool fails to handle the non-existance of a user gracefully.

At some point in the future, our "user IDs" will become real GUIDs rather than "Enterprise IDs" like "csev". At that point, we will have many deep design discussions as to who to handle users as they come and go. This will be a very complex discussion and require complete new features to be built to properly handle this.

Until we make that design change and the supporting changes needed, these type of "bugs" should be tracked and given a relatively low priority as they are not really bugs.

column95:
From Andrew Poland:

These tables need to be cleaned out by DBAs, or by some scheduled job. Sample script for Oracle follows:

Here's SQL to monitor and clean up SAKAI_SESSION:

– find all sessions still open from closed servers
select session_server, session_id, session_user, session_ip, to_char(session_start,'YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS')
from SAKAI_SESSION where SESSION_START = SESSION_END
and SESSION_SERVER not in
(select SERVER_ID from SAKAI_CLUSTER);

– find all open sessions more than 1 day old
select session_server, session_id, session_user, session_ip, to_char(session_start,'YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS')
from SAKAI_SESSION where SESSION_START = SESSION_END
and (CURRENT_TIMESTAMP - SESSION_START) >= interval '1' day(1);

– and close them
update SAKAI_SESSION set SESSION_END = CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
where SESSION_START = SESSION_END
and (CURRENT_TIMESTAMP - SESSION_START) >= interval '1' day(1);

– find all the presence records still around from closed sessions
select * from SAKAI_PRESENCE where SESSION_ID not in
(select SESSION_ID from SAKAI_SESSION where SESSION_START = SESSION_END);

– delete all the presence records still around from closed sessions
delete from SAKAI_PRESENCE where SESSION_ID not in
(select SESSION_ID from SAKAI_SESSION where SESSION_START = SESSION_END);

And this command will delete entries older than 24 hours from SAKAI_EVENT:

DELETE FROM SAKAI_EVENT WHERE (CURRENT_TIMESTAMP - EVENT_DATE) >= interval '1' day(1)
column99: The issue - and the above sample cleanup scripts - are now described in "Important Issues" for the Release 2.0.1 documentation.
column103:
Here is a proposed MySQL solution from James Watkin:

----Original Message----
From: James Watkin james.watkin@anderson.ucla.edu
Sent: Tuesday, August 16, 2005 7:22 PM
To: sakai-dev
Subject: Sakai 2.0.1 - DB tables grow without bound - MySQL Fixes

Regarding the Sakai 2.0.1 "System Administration Issues DB tables grow
without bound ( SAK-1533 Closed )", I've rewritten the SQL statements for MySQL.
I don't seem to have the designated problems on my test server at the
moment so maybe someone can verify these MySQL statements on their server?

– find all sessions still open from closed servers
select session_server, session_id, session_user, session_ip,
CONVERT(session_start, CHAR) AS 'session_start'
from SAKAI_SESSION
where SESSION_START = SESSION_END
and SESSION_SERVER not in(select SERVER_ID from SAKAI_CLUSTER);

– find all open sessions more than 1 day old
select session_server, session_id, session_user, session_ip,
CONVERT(session_start, CHAR) AS 'session_start'
from SAKAI_SESSION where SESSION_START = SESSION_END
and (CURRENT_TIMESTAMP > (SESSION_START + INTERVAL 1 DAY));

– and close them
update SAKAI_SESSION set SESSION_END = CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
where SESSION_START = SESSION_END
and (CURRENT_TIMESTAMP > (SESSION_START + INTERVAL 1 DAY));

– find all the presence records still around from closed sessions
select * from SAKAI_PRESENCE
where SESSION_ID not in(select SESSION_ID from SAKAI_SESSION where
SESSION_START = SESSION_END);

– delete all the presence records still around from closed sessions
delete from SAKAI_PRESENCE
where SESSION_ID not in(select SESSION_ID from SAKAI_SESSION where
SESSION_START = SESSION_END);

SQL statement to delete entries older than 1 day from SAKAI_EVENT:
DELETE FROM SAKAI_EVENT WHERE (CURRENT_TIMESTAMP > (EVENT_DATE +
INTERVAL 1 DAY));

  • Jim
    ______________________________
    James Watkin
    ACIS Software Development
    UCLA Anderson School
    james.watkin@anderson.ucla.edu
    Voice: 1-310-825-5030
    Fax: 1-310-825-4835

column1: [SAK-35469] Preview assessment and permission denied
column6:
2.0.1, all local instances

When you preview an assessment, the first page you see is the begin-assessment page. You click the begin assessment button to start previewing the assessment questions. Then you click the done button when you're finished, and that takes you back to the main authoring page. This is good.

However, if when you click the begin assessment button you're not allowed to preview the assessment (because of the security settings), you get a permission-denied page with a Return button. When you click on the Return button you are taken to the main delivery page, instead of the authoring page. This is not good.

When you click on the Return button as part of previewing an assessment, it should take you to the main authoring page. Does that make sense?

Steps to reproduce the problem:

1) Create a new assessment or choose a core assessment you already have.

2) Go to the assessment settings and edit the "High Security" settings. Put in a username and password (it doesn't matter what) and click the checkbox.

3) Save the settings and return to the assessment questions. Click Preview assessment.

4) On the begin assessment page of the preview, don't type in the username and password, just click the begin assessment button.

5) You will see a permission denied page with a Return button. Click the Return button.

6) You will see the main delivery page with the list of available assessments (if any). This isn't right - you should see the main authoring page instead.

I identified two issues affecting FIB. One, in processing the extracted data, there is a routine
to handle FIB with instructional text (for externally generated non-Sakai XML) that can
produce a null pointer exception. Although extremely rare, I spotted this and put in a fix.

The significant problem was in the XSL data transformation that was pulling only
partial trees when HTML is put into the FIB question.

column1: [SAK-35829] random draw parts in imported/exported assessments
column6:
Sakai 2.0.0[506121] (all local qa instances)

If you export an assessment with a random draw part, when you re-import it to Sakai the part will contain all the questions from its source question pool, regardless of how many it should have.

Steps to reproduce:

0) Make sure you have a question pool with more than one question in it available.
1) Create an assessment.
2) Add a random draw part, with 1 question drawn from the question pool.
3) Export the assessment.
4) Import the assessment.
5) View the imported assessment; the random draw part now has all the questions in the pool, instead of the one it should.
column10: random draw parts in imported/exported assessments
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: linked to general import/export bug
column90:
This is "by design." I am assigning it to you to confirm.

Remember that the export is agnostic as to what system it is in, or even if it is in Sakai at all. So it can't "know" (in all cases) what pooled questions it "has", so it does the best it can do.

There are three alternate interpretations I can think of, but they all involve a lot of work.

For completeness they are:
1. Spec #1. Extend to use the QTI random draw stuff on export-it's pretty complicated-then develop a whole new bit of code to do build special pools to hold the questions. If exported and reimported into the same system, it will duplicate the pool.

2. Spec #2. Extend the special assessment meta-data for Sakai to record the name of the pool, and leave the questions out entirely. This will only work if in the same system, and the pool still exists at import time. Otherwise the questions will be missing.

3. Spec #3. Support as in 2, above, but only in IMS content package format with both an object bank for the pool and the assessment--that's extra development work. If the pool
exists, use it, if not use the questions in the O.B.

column90:
There are six respondus types, five of which correspond to Samigo types. Uploaded examples with the types:
RespondusEssay
RespondusEssayFeedback
RespondusFIB
RespondusMatching
RespondusTrueFalse
Respondus_MCMC
column95:
Note:
1. There is an algorithmic question type not supported by Sakai Test and Quizzes.
2. Respondus supports both XML and ZIP/IMS content types as export. (the zip file has a manifest and the assessment xml file, so unzipping it will give you this format)
3. Respondus claims that it will soon support version 2.0, but does not now (as of this month) do so.

For this JIRA entry I propose that the acceptance criterion should be that all these attached types (above) are importable. (The only type that supports feedback is Essay). Supporting a non supported question type, or IMS content packaging is out of scope for SAK-35123 Closed . We will not target import support for Respondus 2.0 exports in 2.1.

column1: [SAK-1529] Action links for viewing/editing properties
column6:
In 2.0.1, all users see a "properties" action link for each resource shown in the resources list context. Users with permission to revise the resource also see an "edit" action link. This is not correct. Users with permission to revise should see one link labeled "Edit properties", which do the same as the "edit" link now does. Other users should see an action link labeled "View properties", which should do the same as the "properties" link now does.

Clicking "View properties" should display the item's properties in read-only mode. Clicking "Edit properties" should open an editor for the properties.

Basically
a. in delievery: because there are only 2 permission checks, it is cleaner
to not show any assessment list when take Assessment function is not
checked and hide the submit for grade button when submitForGrade permission
is not checked.

b. in authoring: because there are ~10 permission checking on the Authoring
Front Door and many of these links are duplicated across all the jsp pages
for authoring. It is simpilier/faster to do the permission checking inside
the listener. However, we shall consider doing it in the UI level after
2.1. We probably should move those 3 links at the top to a include file for
this purposes. We would also need to expose the Preview link in the
Authoring Front Door later.

c. both template & questionpool are person scoped and the permission is
"own" so it won't matter 'cos there is nothing to hide. All the permisison
should be checked. If not, you are being silly.

For Samigo, my guess is that project sites created before 2.1 that uses both Samigo & GB won't be able to publish any new assessments 'cos GB would thow SecurityExcpetion 'cso they don't recognise the "maintain" role.

column55:
[Comments on Placeholder]
Are we using the Queries directly? Really we are exposing the service layer.
We could inject the QueriesAPI classes for internal consumption, but really they expose all kinds of internals, such as OSID that we don't want to externalize, so if we want an API that is externally useful, that's not enough.

I think we need to review what Berkeley has done.

I think what we want is to expose a pure interface service (...shared.api) API layer (as I have done for the QTI Service) and bind it to the implementation (...shared.impl) through Spring injection.
