column253:
Refactored the builds for api, component and tool, made the component jar
live inside the samigo tool war.

Eliminated the integrated/standalone overlays for the Spring configuration files, just gave them different names; different web.xml files reference them;eliminated the sakai-samigo/src directory which had Spring config files remaining (only webapps is overlaid now).
Moved all the Spring utilities and configuration files inside the component jar.
Moved most of the osid and util packages into component
So the architecture of Samigo is now pretty much like that of gradebook. One war file and two jar files. One with the api interfaces, in the tomcat shared/lib, and one with the component implementation classes for the interfaces and the spring configuration. Only task remaining is cleaning up more of the packages that support the component implementation and moving them to component.
column257:
I have completed migration of the implementation code for the Samigo API interface to the component.jar.
This is revision 2797. The directory structure of Samigo is significantly different than it was in 2796.

Substantial amounts of code have been moved.

Overview:
There are now three full-fledged subprojects in Samigo (there is also an audio recorder applet, which is not really involved).

1. tool. This has the webapps and application/ui-related code. (samigo.war)

2. api. This has the new service interfaces. (sakai-samigo-api-TRUNK.jar)

3. component. This has all the implementation logic components to support the service interfaces, and all the spring configurations. It is included in the samigo.war lib. (sakai-samigo-component-TRUNK.jar)

Here is an outline of how the code is laid out:

1. Samigo Application packages (/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment) :
api (new package, factory for getting the Samigo api impls)
bundle (test properties for i18n)
jsf (JSF tags and renderers)
settings (internal setup stuff)
ui (listeners and backing beans etc.)
ws (web services)

2. Samigo API
data.ifc (abstract representation of the data)
data.model (data modeling)
shared.api (the external service apis)

3. Samigo Components
business (some model/business helper classes)
data.dao (data implementations)
facade (data behavioral objects)
integration (overlays for standalone and integrated)
osid (osid implementations --inside the facade covers)
qti (QTI import export logic)
services (internal services)
shared.impl (external api impls)
util (misc utils)

also, spring configuration files and utilities are in org.sakaiproject.spring

column1: [SAK-1525] Enable ability to restore deleted resources in Resources Tool
column6:
When a resource is deleted from the Resources tool, the row should not be dropped. Since the file in the NAS is stored with virtually no useful metadata, the row in the table is the only entity that contains the metadata required for system admins to perform a restoration of one or more files.

Essentially what we are asking for could be termed a "soft" delete; where the row would not actually be dropped from the database. This could be accomplished a number of ways including adding a new status column to the existing table (e.g. A=active, D=deleted), or by copying the row from the primary table to a "deleted" table.

I would like to solve this generically as I am certain other institutions will want restoration capabilities.
column7: Network attached storage (e.g. AFS, NFS) hosted resources
column10: Enable ability to restore deleted resources in Resources Tool

column90:
Jim, I wanted to make you aware of this issue as Himansu is starting work on it. Please validate the current thinking:

We will add a shadow table to store deleted rows from the ContentHosting service. Without changing the API (yet?), we will hook into the delete resource method and copy the row into the shadow table before dropping the row from the primary table.

Thanks, L

column187: Design suggestion for 2.5
column191:
From SAK-10890: (John Leasia)

One way might be to add a column to the content_resource_delete table that is the file's path before the delete.

That is essentially what we have done by the workaround we are trying here in the meantime is to on the Oracle db side. We put in a trigger for content_resource table. Anytime a row is deleted from that table (as happens with a delete), the trigger copies that row first to another table. That gives us the filename (we can get it from the resource_id field) and the file's path (from the file_path field). So, we can check that table and find the path, request the filesystem folks restore the volume and we can retrieve the file from the restored volume.
column195:
This work was started by Indiana and never finished. If they had design specs, it might be helpful if someone from Indiana could add them to this tickets or one of the other related tickets.

It seems like the way this should work is that the file contents would not be deleted until the item was removed from the delete table. In that case, the filepath could just be copied to the new table. Not sure if that was the design the was intended.
column199: We do not have any formal specs on this issue. As you know we began some work to provide the capability on the back-end. When that was complete we were going to tackle the UI. We envision some kind of screen within Resources where the user could view and search through deleted files and then selectively restore them. There should be some kind of shelf life for deleted items (e.g. 30 days) to control disk growth. Thanks, L
column203:
In the spirit of community mindedness (and as an act of informal peer review!), I thought I'd elaborate on my investigations into the svn commit 56824 associated with this ticket. This was as a result of following up this reply to this question on the sakai-dev mailing list:

http://thread.gmane.org/gmane.comp.cms.sakai.devel/28843/focus=28848

A 'restore' option becomes enabled on any parent folder when files have been deleted from it. A template is provided to enable files in a site to be restored to their previous location. By default, deleted files are stored as BLOBs in the database. If the property 'bodyPathDeleted' (analogous to 'bodyPath') has been set in sakai.properties, then files that have been deleted will be stored under that location, according to the FILE_PATH column of the CONTENT_RESOURCE_DELETE table.

There are a few dangling matters (such as handling the removal of deleted resources from the database and / or file system after a certain period of time), but otherwise it seems like a great contribution to moving forward on this issue .
column207: I agree with Alexis. We'd find this very useful. What we currently do is dump the whole list of files nightly to a file, so that if someone wants a file back we can find it from a Netapp snapshot.
column211:
Work to accomplish this has been done in the feature branch (based off of Sakai 2.5.x) located at

https://source.sakaiproject.org/svn/msub/unicon.net/distros/branches/SAK-1525

The subtasks associated with this Jira represent the known issues that remain with the work in that feature branch.

As of June 11, 2009, the feature branch is known to work when using the file system to store content/resource bodies.

As of June 11, 2009, there are 3 subtasks associated with this feature branch.

  • SAK-15208 Resolved represents a bug, when trying to store content/resource bodies in the database (in this case restore does not work correctly)
  • SAK-15210 Closed represents additional functionality that would be nice to have (restore folders)
  • SAK-16543 Closed represents additional functionality that would be nice to have (confirmation dialog on permanent delete)

If you are storing content/resource bodies on the file system and you do not need the extra functionality in the two subtasks ( SAK-15210 Closed and SAK-16543 Closed ) then this feature branch can be considered complete.

For the general Sakai community, it's strongly recommended the 3 subtasks (at a minimum) be complete, before this be considered as a general patch. Also no work has been done to migrate this feature branch to Sakai 2.6.x or Sakai trunk (future 2.7.x).
column215:
If you use the feature branch, a new property may optionally be configured. The property

bodyPathDeleted@org.sakaiproject.content.api.ContentHostingService

may be set to a place on the file system where deleted content/resource bodies will be stored. If this property is not set, then the deleted content/resource bodied will be stored in the database.

column1: [SAK-1523] Need finer grained permissions on  functions controlled by site.upd
column6:
Currently, a role having site.upd is allowed to edit everywhere in the site. They can in particular do everything possible to users (add, remove, active/inactive in a site). Finer grained permission control on these particular edit functions are desired particularly with respect to editing users in a site. Something like user.activate, user.remove, user.add, etc. Below is a thread on the topic.
----------------

Right. This is a major request from our users as well, and our support staff who will have to deal with users being "removed" in error. The site.upd permission needs to be split into two or another needs to be created that allows a faculty "type" to make a user "inactive" but NOT have the ability to "remove" a user and thus their recorded work.

John - can you report this as a feature request for us? Many thanks!

--Vivie

At 12:44 PM 7/14/2005, you wrote:

> I think we want instructors to be able to "disable" students in particular sites rather than delete them (another "soft delete" area to go along with the content ones discussed here in the past). This allows the faculty to still control who has access to their course site (and there seem to be scenarios where it's important for the faculty to have that discretionary control) without threatening the recorded work of the student involved.
>
> ~Clay
>
> Cheryl Wogahn wrote:
>
>> We've been playing with creating a custom 'instructor' role (basically the maintain role for a site) and we have some issues that we were wondering if security can be made more granular.
>>
>> For instance, we granted the realm.update permission so that instructors could grant permissions to resources (or revoke, as necessary). BUT, we do not want to give the instructors to set permissions at the Site Info level so they can also add/delete participants from a course site. Our site participants are going to mainly be set by the registrar's office or special request.
>> There is no way to grant this level of permission without giving the instructor the 'whole ball of wax' at this point.
>>
>> Down the road, we would also like to see the ability to grant permissions maybe at the user level, but that is much further down the pike.
>>
>> Anyone else have thoughts/ideas on this?
>>
>> Cheryl Wogahn
>> Yale University
>>

column1: [SAK-1521] URL contains entire path to file
column6:
After uploading a file into Resources the URL listed shows the enire path from my local computer as the filename.
If I add the title prior to selecting a file to upload this does not occur and the path is normal.
See screen shot of Properties view.
column7: Win XP, IE 6.0, Firefox, nightly2 after 3pm build, 7/15/05
column10: URL contains entire path to file
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
I'm seeing this on 2.0.1rc2 on stable. I'd like the priority to be changed to major, as the full path to a file on a user's workstation is sensitive data that should not be recorded by a web application after they upload said file.

The path is also used when browsing resources through WebDAV.
column90: I'm submitting a patch for this one. Hasn't caused any problems thus far in my testing.
column95: Can you determine the most appropriate course of action for this?
column99:
The refactoring design called for a default entry in the title field to be supplied dynamically when the user selected a file (if the title field was blank at that time). That has to be done in JavaScript, which doesn't have a robust approach for selecting just the filename (as opposed to the full path) on various operating systems with different file separators, etc.

I think of four possibilities:

1) Go back to the old approach: eliminate the javascript that places the filepath as a default in the title field. Then if the user fails to enter a title, supply the filename as the title on the server without consulting the user.

2) Treat it like we do other required info: eliminate the javascript that places the filepath as a default in the title field. Then if the user fails to enter a title, flag it as an error and let the user enter a title.

3) Treat it as a special case: eliminate the javascript that places the filepath as a default in the title field. Then if the user fails to enter a title, flag it as an error and let the user enter a title, but supply the filename as a default. (Many users will think they filled in that value and think they have to change it).

4) Develop a complex javascript function for parsing the filename out of the filepath and supply that as the default in realtime as the user fills out the form (assuming the user has not already filled in a title before choosing the file).

Item 2 is probably the best short-term solution. Item 4 might be best in the long-run, but it may not be feasible.
column103:
I originally thought after reading Jim Eng's comments here that my patch wasn't needed and I just hadn't noticed that the UI was overwriting my title value. However, after a few people disagreed with my assertion that this was just a UI issue and could be fixed via. javascript, I did some retesting and lo and behold Sakai DOES retain and display the full path on your local system regardless of what the value of the "title" field is when adding a resource.

Can anyone else confirm this behavior?

thanks,

Dave
column107: A solution to this problem has been checked in at head of sakai. It may not be the complete solution discussed here. But for systems that use '/' as the path separator, it uses the filename instead of the full path as the seed value for the title. If a title is already filled in when the file is chosen, it makes no change. If a system uses a path separator other than '/', it probably still uses the full path. If anyone has information about other possible path separators, we can work out a refinement to deal with them.

column1: [SAK-1514] Email notifications for announcements silently fail if the user adding the announcement has an empty email address
column6:
Email notifications for announcements silently fail if the user adding the announcement has an empty email address, e.g.:

Login as admin and check that admin has no email address
Go to a site with an announcements tool
Add announcement, selecting Email Notification: High - All participants

The announcement is added, but no email notification is sent. No error message is displayed to the user, and no warnings or errors are logged in catalina.out.

The tool should display a warning to the user, e.g. "You have selected email notification for this announcements, but you have not set an email address for your account. No email notifications will be sent."

This is a new bug that's present on the MIT instances of m2 but not on the local Stanford QA instance (http://coursework-s1.stanford.edu:8080).

After you publish an assessment to anonymous users, if you then try to take it using the published assessment url, your answers will not be saved.

Workaround: Open a new browser window and take the assessment there, and it'll work.

This is a minor problem, but it worries me that there's this difference in the code between the two versions right before we do a release.

column1: [SAK-1511] Create Global Hibernate SessionFactory and TransactionManager
column6:
----Original Message----
From: John Ellis john.ellis@rsmart.com
Sent: Tuesday, July 12, 2005 7:23 PM
To: sakai-dev
Subject: Transaction Manager problem

I am running into a problem when using transactions managers in the
sakai 2.0 way. It seems that the convention is for different components
to define their own transaction managers. I see different ones for
gradebook, help, and syllabus. This makes sense because we have to
define a different sessionFactory (even though they are all derived from
the base one) to specify different hibernate mapping files (I don't
think we would want all those in one place).

The problem I see is when one transacted service from one component
calls a method on another transaction service in another component. It
seems that since they are both wrapped by transactions that are managed
by separate transaction managers, the
org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTransactionManager has a
problem (log details below). Looking at that line of code, it appears
to be checking

getDataSource() != null &&
TransactionSynchronizationManager.hasResource(getDataSource())

if this is true, meaning the current data source is already under
transaction management, the exception is thrown. This is also probably
going to affect us when we have transacted legacy code calling services
that are implemented with hibernate transactions. According to the
message even straight JDBC calls should be managed by
HibernateTransactionManager if you are mixing JDBC and Hibernate (which
we will be doing when integrating lock management with the
ContentHostingService).

One possible way we can all use the same session factory, and therefore
the same transaction manager is to use a class we (OSP) derived from
org.springframework.orm.hibernate.LocalSessionFactoryBean. What this
derived class does is before it initializes, it looks in the application
context for beans of a certain type
(org.theospi.utils.mvc.impl.beans.AdditionalHibernateMappings). These
beans have additional resource mappings defined. The SessionFactoryBean
then adds all these mappings to it's own before initializing. We could,
of course, change these packages around to be more appropriate for
sakai.

Any other suggestions/comments would be appreciated.

John

Log details:
===============================================================
WARN: Handler execution resulted in exception - forwarding to resolved
error view (2005-07-12 16:43:12,229
http-8080-Processor25_org.springframework.web.servlet.DispatcherServlet)

org.springframework.transaction.IllegalTransactionStateException:
Pre-bound JDBC connection found - HibernateTransactionManager does not
support running within DataSourceTransactionManager if told to manage
the DataSource itself. It is recommended to use a single
HibernateTransactionManager for all transactions on a single DataSource,
no matter whether Hibernate or JDBC access.

column99: Same result with no properties files with both sakai-maint r702 and trunk r703. Will try running with a debugger next.
column103: Screenshots Eclipse showing null pointer exception breakpoints. I'm new to debugging with Eclipse, so hope these are helpful - otherwise please advise in more detail about how to debug this from the Eclipse side.
column107:
I've reproduced this exact bug on Windows XP SP2, latest from HEAD.

The behavior I see is exactly as described previously in the bug report.
column111:
Here is the problem:

This is an intermittent bug having to do with our Spring component management. The SessionManager is being called before its been properly initialized by Spring (unbeknownst to Spring), causing a NullPointerException, causing the components packages to not deploy properly, causing the server startup to fail.

Here is exactly how its happening:

1. Spring attempts to initialize the BasicSqlService.
2. The init method of the BasicSqlService runs the DDLs (ie, runs some SQL to to initialize the DB tables).

The next steps happen only in the debug logging code, so they only happen (and fail) when the DEBUG logging is turned on.

3. The logging statement calls into the UsageSessionService to get the current session ID to log it.
4. This calls into the UsageSessionServiceAdaptor.
5. The SessionManager is called, its not been initialized yet.
6. This causes a NullPointerException
7. This causes the deployment of the components packages to fail.
8. This causes the server startup to fail.
column115:
The solution:

Check for a null SessionManager in the UsageSessionServiceAdaptor and handle it more gracefully.

The patch is attached and can be applied to 2.0.0 or 2.0.1.
column139: Apply this patch to fix this issue in 2.0.0 and 2.0.1.
column187: Fix checked in as r1444.
column191: This bug is now a known issue in 2.0.0 and 2.0.1 and should be added to the list of known issues. However, since it only affects developers (NOT production), it should be noted that its not a huge issue.
column195: Checked in for 2.1.
column199: Due to insufficiant QA resources, this issue was not verified via the formal QA process but is included (ie fixed) in a production version of Sakai (2.1). If you find this report is still a problem, please re-open the ticket.

column1: [SAK-1506] Update copyright header and file footer for Subversion
column6:
There is a copyright header and file footer in Sakai code.

When Sakai's version control system was changed from CVS to Subversion (SVN), the header and footer got a bit broken. They are supposed to contain information about where the source file is located, who last modified it, the last revision number when the file was modified, etc.

CVS would generate this automatic information like this:

  • $Header: /cvs/sakai2/kernel/active-tool/src/java/org/sakaiproject/api/kernel/tool/ActiveTool.java,v 1.9 2005/04/18 14:23:33 ggolden.umich.edu Exp $

However, that doesn't work for SVN because SVN uses different keywords.

SVN can generate automatic information like this:

  • $URL: https://source.sakaiproject.org/svn/trunk/sakai/jsf/widgets/src/java/org/sakaiproject/jsf/component/MessagesComponent.java $
  • $Id: MessagesComponent.java 597 2005-07-13 20:26:17Z janderse@umich.edu $

So we need to update all the source files to have the correct keywords.
column10: Update copyright header and file footer for Subversion
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
The plan is to use the SVN keyword $URL$ in the header, and $ID$ in the footer.

So a full example source header would look like this:
/***********************************************************************************

  • $URL: https://source.sakaiproject.org/svn/trunk/sakai/jsf/widgets/src/java/org/sakaiproject/jsf/component/MessagesComponent.java $
    ***********************************************************************************
    *
  • Copyright (c) 2003, 2004, 2005 The Regents of the University of Michigan, Trustees of Indiana University,
  • Board of Trustees of the Leland Stanford, Jr., University, and The MIT Corporation
  • Licensed under the Educational Community License Version 1.0 (the "License");
  • By obtaining, using and/or copying this Original Work, you agree that you have read,
  • understand, and will comply with the terms and conditions of the Educational Community License.
  • You may obtain a copy of the License at:
  • http://cvs.sakaiproject.org/licenses/license_1_0.html
  • THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED,
  • INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE
  • AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM,
  • DAMAGES OR OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING
  • FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE SOFTWARE.
    *
    **********************************************************************************/

And a full example source footer would look like this:
/**********************************************************************************

  • $Id: MessagesComponent.java 597 2005-07-13 20:26:17Z janderse@umich.edu $
    **********************************************************************************/
column90:
Some ideas:

What I did for now for Samigo Java code is add in the subversion keywords, HeadURL, and Id, viz:

/**********************************************************************************

  • $HeadURL: https://source.sakaiproject.org/svn/trunk/sakai/sam/src/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/util/XmlUtil.java $
  • $Id: XmlUtil.java 201 2005-06-23 19:21:11Z esmiley@stanford.edu $
    ***********************************************************************************
    *
  • Copyright (c) 2005 The Regents of the ....

I also put the Id into an HTML comment in the JSF files, this means that if you build with keywords, you will be able to do a view frame source and see the revision used to build the tool:

JSF:
<!--

  • $Id: editAssessment.jsp 233 2005-06-24 01:32:45Z esmiley@stanford.edu $
    <%--
    ***********************************************************************************
    *
  • Copyright (c) 2005 The Regents ....
    *
    **********************************************************************************/
    --%>
    -->
    <f:view>
    <f:verbatim><!DOCTYPE html
    PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN"
    "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">
    </f:verbatim>
    <f:loadBundle
    basename="org.sakaiproject.tool.assessment.bundle.AuthorMessages"
    var="msg"/>
    <html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
    <head>...

generated HTML:
<!--

  • $Id: editAssessment.jsp 233 2005-06-24 01:32:45Z esmiley@stanford.edu $

-->
<!DOCTYPE html
PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"><html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<head>...
column95: We don't need footers. Glenn and Jon decided to follow the majority opinion and remove them.
column99: We'll put both $URL$ and $Id$ into the header, so the last revision (and by whom) as well as the URL are all available.
column103: Done. All headers and footers now contain proper Subversion keywords.

column1: [SAK-1505] Merge both Sakai JSF tag libraries into one tag library
column6:
There are currently two Sakai JSF tag libraries, "sakai" and "sakaix".

These should be merged into one single Sakai JSF tag library that supports older Sakai JSF tools, as well as new development.

The merged JSF tag library should be backwards-compatible with the older Sakai JSF tools, as well as add new widgets. It should also support both Sun and MyFaces.

This will reduce confusion and duplication and prepare for future JSF improvements.

column1: [SAK-1500] Assignments w/o grading wording not accurate
column6:
One of our users brought this up and I thought it was a valid point that I would pass onto the Sakai community. When you view a students submission in the assignments w/o grading there is some wording that doesn't accurately portray what is occuring on the screen.

Step by Step
1) Choose assignments (w/o grading)
2) View Submissions
3) Choose a student's submission

column1: [SAK-1499] unable to import xml file
column6:
I have been unable to import an XML file into Samigo. I receive the following error:

"There was an error importing this assessment. Ensure that the file is correctly formatted IMS QTI. Error details: org.sakaiproject.tool.assessment.services.qti.QTIServiceException: java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.NullPointerException Choose an IMS QTI-compliant XML file from your computer.

Steps taken
1) Create new test (mysql- 4972c769-e4e5-41eb-809d-bceeaf377161)
2) export test (click download >> then file > save as)
3) Then click import and select file I just exported, recieve error above
column10: unable to import xml file
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: ss is screenshot of error and I also attached the file I exported (I believe this was from the oracle db version)
column90:
This is something that has just come up and I am investigating.
It is a bug outside the import/export code inside of JSF logic rendering of XML files.

It turns out that if you load the file in question in Firefox you will see
XML Parsing Error: xml processing instruction not at start of external entity
Location: http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/jira/secure/attachment/10699/exporttest.xml
Line Number 2, Column 1:
<?xml version="1.0" ?>
^

JSF is inserting (I have verified that the data being passed does not have it) a blank line in front of the XML contents, without being asked to--even if the JSF code is all on one line. This puts the blank line in the file on export, and then import (correctly) complains.

Oddly enough it wasn't doing it with a previous build of Sakai (with the same JSF and XML code).

You can verify this yourself by deleting the extra line above the XML processing instruction.
column95: I am investigating a way to make the XML parser forgiving of blank lines on import. That would make it more robust in this case. However, the export should not be prepending the blank lines, so this is also under active investigation.
column99:
I did a little testing to see if it is reproducible.
I can't reproduce it on my Solaris machine with the latest build as of today.

I also looked at http://sakai-stable.mit.edu:8020/portal/, which is a little older , and does not have the problem--clearly an older build without portal styles on SAM.

I saw it yesterday on our automated Stanford builds but can't test it today, due to a general automated maven/build problem I just documented to core (I have a manual workaround).

I should be able to take your XML file, though, and test with it.
column103:
I added special code to trim blank lines from InputStream in XMLUtil before passing it into the DocumentBuilder.

$ svn commit -m "SAK-1499: trim extraneous blank lines from XML before processing" src/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/ui/bean/qti/XMLImportBean
.java src/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/util/XmlUtil.java
Sending src/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/ui/bean/qti/XMLImportBean.java
Sending src/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/util/XmlUtil.java
Transmitting file data ..
Committed revision 605.

This should be a "good enough" fix for 2.01. I am planning to take control of the XML export through a servlet in 2.1, so that I should be able to prevent the extra lines from getting into the XML file at all (as well as controling the name, mime type and extension of the XML file). JSF and JSP technology seems to be too flakey to reliably control blank lines.

Still, this is probably a good thing to leave in, so that "nearly correct" XML files will work with Sakai.

Verified that I can import "Megans new test" (the XML file, above), as well as a 26 question test.

Fix version: 605.
column107:

Megan is the best!
True.

column1: [SAK-1498] missing style sheet in anon delivery assessments
column6:
coursework-s1, all 3 nightly builds, Sakai - 2.0.0 - Sakai 2.0.0[506121]

When I take an assessment using the published URL, anonymously or not, the pages are displayed with no style. The assessment is still takeable, but it looks very odd. (See screenshots for examples).

When I take the same assessment by logging into Sakai and choosing it from the menu, the screens look normal.

Example assessment:

http://coursework-s1.stanford.edu:27080/samigo/servlet/Login?id=marith1121200797264
column10: missing style sheet in anon delivery assessments
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Ed, did the skinning break the link to the stylesheet?
column90:
No. The skinning is there. But the stylesheet is assigned dynamically.

The web.xml sets up a prelude for jsp that sets the style information in the request from header.inc. Normally, JSF sees this, and includes the prelude and then compiles the jsp as a JSF page and the FacesServlet associates the compiled page with the specified faces url (i.e. .jsp-->.jsf).

In this case however, there is so much going on that it is really difficult to follow. The external URL is a servlet, which authenticates the user and forwards them to a JSF page which is under control of the FacesServlet, but which does a meta refresh to a new JSF page, also under control of the FacesServlet, these are POSTS. At the end of this, the information is not in the request any more and the information is displayed as "null".
column95:
Aha! I have got it.

The problem is that you are accessing the assessment through an external url, but Samigo is in a Sakai portal build. There are two versions of header.inc, integrated and non-integrated. In the integrated, the portal style is in the request, so we just add in the samigo.css to it. Ine the non-integrated we set all the styles.

But there is a third situation, where we have Samigo integrated into the protal and being accessed outside it. In that case the style information is null, and we get

<head>null<link href="/samigo/css/samigo.css" type=....

so what we need to do is a test for null and fall back to the way we do in the non-integrated version.
column99:
$ svn commit -m "SAK-1498: supply the standalone versions tool styles if request.getAttribute('sakai.html.head') is null" header.inc
Sending header.inc
Transmitting file data .
Committed revision 636.

FIX DETAILS:
<%

  • // get the HTML fragment for the header from the Sakai portal,
  • // and then add Samigo's own tool-specific CSS file to it.
  • String head = (String) request.getAttribute("sakai.html.head");
  • head += "<link href=\"/samigo/css/samigo.css\" type=\"text/css\" rel=\"stylesheet\" media=\"all\" />\n";
    -
  • request.setAttribute("html.head", head);
  • request.setAttribute("html.body.onload", request.getAttribute("sakai.html.body.onload"));
  • request.setAttribute("html.head.sakai", request.getAttribute("sakai.html.head"));
    -
    +
    + if ( (String) request.getAttribute("sakai.html.head") != null)
    + { + // get the HTML fragment for the header from the Sakai portal, + // and then add Samigo's own tool-specific CSS file to it. + String head = (String) request.getAttribute("sakai.html.head"); + head += "<link href=\"/samigo/css/samigo.css\" type=\"text/css\" rel=\"stylesheet\" media=\"all\" />\n"; + + request.setAttribute("html.head", head); + request.setAttribute("html.body.onload", + request.getAttribute("sakai.html.body.onload")); + request.setAttribute("html.head.sakai", + request.getAttribute("sakai.html.head")); + }

    + else
    +

    { + // supply the standalone versions tool styles + request.setAttribute("html.head", + "<link href=\"/samigo/css/tool_base.css\" type=\"text/css\" rel=\"stylesheet\" media=\"all\" />\n" + + "<link href=\"/samigo/css/tool.css\" type=\"text/css\" rel=\"stylesheet\" media=\"all\" />\n" + + "<link href=\"/samigo/css/samigo.css\" type=\"text/css\" rel=\"stylesheet\" media=\"all\" />\n"); + request.setAttribute("html.body.onload", ""); + }

    +
    +
    %>
column103: Fix version 636.
column107: Fixed! Created and published anonymous assessment in all 3 nightly qa instances. They're all displayed correctly when I take them.

This is still an issue in the 2.1.0_001 tag, on Firefox 1.5-beta2 (not on IE).

To reproduce: visit the gateway site of a 2.1.0_001 / TRUNK Sakai instance. Resize the browser window making it smaller or larger. At certain display sizes, the right-hand tool border disappears.

See attached screenshot.
column103: Stephen, can you verify that this is an error with a non-beta version of Firefox? Thanks.
column107:
It's not an issue in Firefox 1.0.7 (Gecko/20050915 rendering engine) but is an issue in 1.5-beta2 (Gecko/20051006).

So I guess the options are:
1. Leave it until FF 1.5 is released (at which point it may or may not be an issue)
2. Investigate further to see whether it's a CSS problem or a Gecko rendering problem, and if the latter make sure there's a bug report filed with Mozilla about it.

I don't know enough to add much more on option 2.
column111:
Verfied as fix in current production version of Firefox (1.0.7).

When a production version of Firefox 1.5 is released, then it will be more appropriate to test against. If the problem still exists, then please re-open the issue.
column115: Reopening this issue for production release of Firefox 1.5 (see screenshot, from 2.10.006).
column139: Note missing tool right-hand border.
column187: Well - the iframe borders overlap the wrapping box borders with FF on redraw. That is basically the issue. The solution is to redo how borders get drawn - letting the iframe carry the border weight. Will get to this as soon as the title iframe is no longer an iframe (am told this will happen any time now) -as it will eliminate an important variable.
column191: Is there a short-term workaround? On FF 1.5 on 1280 x 1024 display size (19" monitor), none of the Home worksite tools get right borders. It looks a bit unfinished...
column195:
Sure -

Adjust the widths and borders of the iframes (both content and title) and the wrapper blocks of both as well. This will work for individual institutions. The OOTB skin is problematic because of the bgcolor and all the graphic background elements - they all need to match and align across all browsers - and not all browsers size iframes the same way.

Or just forget about borders at all - see:

http://burgoo.ummu.umich.edu:8080/portal (admin/admin)

My Workspace and Med Skin sites dispense with borders. GLRC site has a very simple title iframe content, alowing the border of the content to be carried by the iframe (because it does not need to align with pixel precision with the title iframe content).

column55: A nice example of this sort of dock/undock functionality these days is provided by Meebo, a web-based way to access your various IM identities. They use it for popping-out and popping-in "windows" between their web-page desktop-like view and an undecorated browser window in the OS. column1: [SAK-35470] auto-save  not implemented
column6:
Under the "Submissions" settings category in Assessment Settings and Templates, there used to be a choice for "Autosave":

o User must click "Save" button to save input
o All user input saved automatically

This feature was never implemented, and so it was taken out of the assessment settings and templates for 1.5 onward.

Two questions:

1)
Do we now want to implement this for the next version? This would mean not only putting the settings back, but when autosave is turned on, saving user input in delivery automatically in the background.

2) If we implemented this...why would anyone ever want to turn it off? It seems like a good thing to save student input in case their browser crashes during delivery or something. Is there a use case for why someone would want to turn it off? And if not, should it just be implemented automatically and not be a configurable setting?
column10: auto-save  not implemented
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Ed, can you make a work (days) estimation on this and reassign it to me?
column90:
In looking at the original autosave design in aam, it made use of JSPs in dummy frames.

Since that time, we have implemented JSF inside and outside portals, and the old design doesn't look appropriate. We'd pretty much have to implement the design from scratch.

So the steps would be
1. Review requirements for this hypothetical feature. Is this triggered by a timer, or by an onchange event? It needs to slip in cleanly intothe current design.
2. Create a new design based on the current architecture, so that it works both inside and outside the portal, and looks scalable (more server round trips).
3. Implement a proof of conceptto test new design.
4. The actual work.
column95:
Based on a very vague guesstimate I would say about 40 hours. This would be subject to progress on the initial R&D.

That being said, I don't think that we should pursue this in light of schedule and performance tradeoffs.
column99: I put this as a non-issue, as it looks like we are pulling this as a feature. I will reassign to Marc, as he is going to do a final user requirements review for this feature.

column1: [SAK-1483] Email Archive tool changes Message-ID
column6:
When sending a message to a course site using the Email Archive tool, the Message-ID header is incorrectly replaced. e.g. An incoming message might have a Message-ID generated by the client such as:

Message-ID: <42CE6804.4080509@ched.uct.ac.za>

but the outgoing message from the course site has a Message-ID like this:

Message-ID: <1583049.1120823305869.JavaMail.root@espresso>

This can be seen by sending an email message to a course site which you are a member of, and CC'ing it to yourself. The email returned from the course site has a different Message-ID to the CC'ed copy.

Email redistribution in this way is in effect mailing list behaviour. Most well-behaved mailing lists (e.g. mailman) do not alter the Message-ID. RFC2822 (http://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc2822.html) has this to say about Message-IDs:

—
3.6.4. Identification fields

The "Message-ID:" field provides a unique message identifier that
refers to a particular version of a particular message. The
uniqueness of the message identifier is guaranteed by the host that
generates it (see below). This message identifier is intended to be
machine readable and not necessarily meaningful to humans. A message
identifier pertains to exactly one instantiation of a particular
message; subsequent revisions to the message each receive new message
identifiers.

Note: There are many instances when messages are "changed", but those
changes do not constitute a new instantiation of that message, and
therefore the message would not get a new message identifier. For
example, when messages are introduced into the transport system, they
are often prepended with additional header fields such as trace
fields (described in section 3.6.7) and resent fields (described in
section 3.6.6). The addition of such header fields does not change
the identity of the message and therefore the original "Message-ID:"
field is retained. In all cases, it is the meaning that the sender
of the message wishes to convey (i.e., whether this is the same
message or a different message) that determines whether or not the
"Message-ID:" field changes, not any particular syntactic difference
that appears (or does not appear) in the message.
—

It is clear therefore that to be standards-compliant, Sakai should not replace Message-IDs of incoming emails when redistributing them.
column10: Email Archive tool changes Message-ID
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Sakai should not be changing the ID.
column90: Will this be resolved for 2.1.0?
column95: Raised priority to Critical per Chuck's request.
column99:
I think that we should maintain the message ID if possible. There are two sides of the issue. One side might suggest that because we are extracting attachments and transforming the message somewhat, we should change the messsage ID "to be compliant". But the other side would say that this is mere syntactic transformation and as such should be the same message id.

I am thinking that the downside of keeping the message is that some mail system might not forward or deliver the second copy of said message. This seems like a pretty small downside. But of course, when that day comes and someone gets ticked we will get another JIRA

But whe that happens - perhaps they will take a look back at this JIRA and be charitable

column1: [SAK-1950] Tests and Quizzes (SAMigo) 2.1 Release Notes
column6: Known issues...
column10: Tests and Quizzes (SAMigo) 2.1 Release Notes
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
Mysqldb configuration changes:

These settings allow the Tests&Quizzes tool in Sakai to support file upload questions.

1) The data type for SAM_MEDIA_T should be "longblob". To set this, use the mysql command:

ALTER TABLE SAM_MEDIA_T MODIFY MEDIA longblob;

2) The max_allowed_packet variable limits the size of files that can be uploaded in Tests&Quizzes. Files larger than the max allowed packet size will be truncated. To set this variable, use the mysql command:

mysql> mysqld --max_allowed_packet=16M
column90:
Ah. The SAM_MEDIA_T needs to be different for each dbtype, according to Daisy:

oracle -> blob
mysql -> longblob
hsqldb -> varbinary
column95:
Possible release note for Firefox users. Or is this too fiddly and small to document?

A newly created anonymous assessment may not display correctly the first time in Firefox. If you are using Firefox and see a blank screen when you try to take a new anonymous assessment, open a new browser window and try again.
column99:
SAK-1419 Closed If you add a random draw part to an assessment, the pool that part uses is now considered off-limits for use elsewhere in the assessment (to prevent duplicate questions).

This is intentional behavior, but it looks like a bug to the user. For example:

1. I add some questions to part 1 of an assessment, saving them to question pool Foo as I go.

2. Then I create a random draw part 2 for the assessment and have it draw questions from the same pool Foo.

3. As soon as I create part 2, poof! part 1 is suddenly empty.

This needs to be documented both in the release notes and preferably on-screen for the user. It'd be better still if pool Foo was marked unavailable when I went to create the random draw part.

column1: [SAK-1910] Need warning when max upload file size exceeded in mysql
column6:
Sakai - 2.0.0 - Sakai 2.0.0[506121], mysql only

The 'max_allowed_packet' variable in mysql controls the maximum size of files you can upload in delivery. If you try to upload a file larger than that you get an out of memory exception and the following in logs:

WARN: forward: javax.servlet.ServletException: org.springframework.jdbc.UncategorizedSQLException: (Hibernate operation): encountered SQLException [Packet for query is too large (1360344 > 1047552). You can change this value on the server by setting the max_allowed_packet' variable.]; nested exception is com.mysql.jdbc.PacketTooBigException: Packet for query is too large (1360344 > 1047552). You can change this value on the server by setting the max_allowed_packet' variable.

Instead of getting an exception, users should just see a warning message when they exceed the file size limit. How about something like:

Error: File larger than the (#MB) limit

if it's possible to list the current limit? Marc, what do you think?
column10: Need warning when max upload file size exceeded in mysql
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: related to the general file upload bug
column90: Can you provide mockup and assign this to Daisy.
column95: I added an error message to page 17 of the delivery.051025.pdf mockup:http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/confluence/display/SAM/2.1+Mockups
column99:
Marc,

please see the attached screen shot of the error message (file_upload_error.jpg). Deal to the flow of taking an assessment, the upload button is on the same page of the assessment and we refresh the assessment screen after an upload instead of going to another screen. So I put the error message in the same screen rather than on another screen. Hope this is OK with you.

For peoplr who are interested in changing the size liit or the repository path (i.e. where the file should be upload to in a file system). You can update the following settings in sam/tool/sakai-samigo/webapp/WEB-INF/web.xml. This way, you can set the limit based on your system.

<filter>
<filter-name>Upload Filter</filter-name>
<filter-class>com.corejsf.UploadFilter</filter-class>
<init-param>
<param-name>com.corejsf.UploadFilter.repositoryPath</param-name>
<param-value>/tmp/</param-value>
</init-param>
<init-param>
<param-name>com.corejsf.UploadFilter.sizeThreshold</param-name>
<param-value>1024</param-value>
</init-param>
<init-param>
<param-name>com.corejsf.UploadFilter.sizeMax</param-name>
<param-value>40960</param-value>
</init-param>
</filter>

Note: files changed
M sam/tool/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/bundle/DeliveryMessages.properties
M sam/tool/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/ui/bean/delivery/DeliveryBean.java

M sam/tool/src/webapp/jsf/delivery/item/deliverFileUpload.jsp

column1: [SAK-1481] Latest titlebar change broke Mercury portal display of legacy tools
column6: Latest titlebar rendering change broke the Mercury display of legacy tools. When legacy tools are brought up in Mercury, a blank page is produced because of an exception.
column10: Latest titlebar change broke Mercury portal display of legacy tools
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
The problem is that the titlebar is now rendered by the portal, not the tool. So the title bar shouldn't be rendered in the Mercury portal; only Charon does titlebars (at this point).

So, the fix is to fixthe legacy tool rendering support. Instead of causing an error when a panel isn't specified, default to the Main panel. The Layout panel isn't rendered anymore, neither is the Title panel, since the portal takes care of all that.

Gradebook still produces a blank screen when a non-logged-in user attempts to use it in Mercury, but that is a different issue (not this one).

column95:
On nightly2, if there is a value in the URL field, the URL is shown regardless of the radio button setting. So if I have a URL entered, but then decide I want to show the worksite's info by clicking the radio button for 'show worksite info', I still get the URL. So once a URL has been entered, you cant then show the worksite's info (without removing the URL).

It should show whatever is selected via the radio buttons. If there is a value for the URL field, and the user selects the show worksite info radio button, then worksite info should be shown (and the URL value shouldn't be removed). It is the radio buttons that control which is displayed, not whether there is a value in the URL field or not.

column1: [SAK-1930] multiple choice multiple correct  - grading problem
column6:
Sakai - 2.0.0 - Sakai 2.0.0[506121] (instances on coursework-s1)

Marc, how should incorrect answer choices for mc mc questions get scored? Right now it looks as though you get no points off for choosing a wrong answer, so checking all answer choices is a valid strategy.

Example: Which of the following animals are not in the Chinese zodiac?
(6 pts)

tiger (no)
pig (no)
fish (yes)
leopard (yes)
mouse (yes)
rat (no)

When I answered this question in delivery and checked every one of the choices, my score was 6.0.

(When I made the question worth 1 point, took the assessment again and checked all the answer choices, my score was 0.9 out of 1, interestingly.)
column10: multiple choice multiple correct  - grading problem
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
Marc:

Please give more specifications on how the score should be when the user choose all of answers. Would a wrong choice result in a minus score? and what is the scale for this minus score?

Thanks.
column90:
The score should be calculated using correct responses - incorrect responses with a minimum score of zero.

Note: there are many ways of scoring multiple correct but only the method listed above will be implemented for version 2.1. Post 2.1 SEPP members may expand MCMC questions so that the user can set variables to have scoring choices for the user to include: all or nothing or partial credit, negative scores, and different weights to different selections.

A Blue eyes (yes)
B brown hair (yes)
C fair skin (yes)
D green toes

When I take this and check off a,b, c I receive a 20.099998. However, when I take it and check off all answers (a,b,c,d) I receive a 20. Seems like the points are being evenly divided and then added up. This is problematic when the student gets the question right but receives more than the max # of points.

  • set answers' points to 0 if one question gets negative total score"

column139:
Sorry, but I'm not sure that it is fixed, or at least it doesn't all work as I expect (sakai-stable:8030 - 2.0.1.003 - MySQL)

Multiple choice question with a value of 3 marks

Two out of three answers are correct

User ticks all three

I would imagine that they would get + 2 for the two they got right, and -1 one the one they got wrong, so a total of 1

In fact, I get 1.5

I have a screenshot but can't post it here.
column187:
Tested on 2.1.0.004-oracle

Multiple choice question with 3 options, a value of 3 marks - 2 out of 3 answers are correct.
User ticks all 3 answers - gets score of 3.

Multiple choice question with 5 options and a value of 5 marks. 3 out of 5 answers are correct.
User ticks all 5 answers - gets score of 5.
column191:
In Harriett's example above, 1.5 is the correct score. Every correct answer is worth totalpoint / # of correct answers. In this case, the total points for this question is 3, and the # of correct answers is 2, 3/2 is 1.5. The student picked all 3, so his/her score is 2 X 1.5 - 1.5 = 1.5.
if each correct answer is worth 1 point, then the user would never be able to get 3 points even if he answered the question correctly.

I also tried Greg's examples, In this case, I got 1.5 for his first question (this is the same as Harriet's example) and in the 2nd case, I got 1.666666. (1.666666 x 3 - 1.6666666x2 = 1.6666666.) (this needs to be rounded up, there is a bug filed for this already)

let me know if this is not what you see.
column195:
Same example,
1) MCQ with 3 options, value of 3, 2 out of 3 if correct
2) MCQ with 5 options, value of 5, 3 out of 5 is correct

On 2.1.0.005-mysql
1) Get 1.5 out of 3
2) Get 1.66667 out of 5.
Total 3.2 out of 8.

On 2.1.0.005-oracle (running much slower than the other 2 stables)
1) Get 1.5 out of 3
2) Get 1.6666666 out of 5
Total 3.2 out of 8

On 2.1.0.005-hsql
1) Get 1.5 out of 3
2) Get 1.6666666 out of 5.
Total 3.2 out of 8.

So in terms of the marking it seems to be fixed.
The rounding issue is filed under another bug so can we close this one?

column1: [SAK-1475] Implement "structured objects" in Resources tool
column6: Implement a new type of "item" that can be created/edited in the Resources Tool, called a "Structured Object". Definitions for the structure of such items are retrieved from the StructuredArtifactDefinitionManager. The list of item-types in the "add-item" context will include "Structured Object" as well as "File Upload", "URL", "HTML Page" and "Simple Text Document". When the user selects "Structured Object", the resources tool will offer a choice of object types and display an appropriate form to create an object of the type indicated by the user. When the user seeks to edit a structured object, a similar form will be used.

column1: [SAK-1473] Add UUID support to ContentHosting
column6: Add methods to retrieve and resolve UUIDs (universally unique IDs aka globally unique IDs [GUIDs]). These are created on demand for individual Resource. They are useful when a handle to a Resource needs to be maintained regardless of URI changes (e.g. they remain constant after a file is moved.) They also tend to be shorter than the URI but more cryptic.

column1: [SAK-1471] Two different export options in Gradebook - UNCLEAR

This option exports only the student names, IDs, and cumalitive Letter grade

column1: [SAK-1466] Resources tool should show all collections the user has access to
column6:
The list view of the resources tool should show all of the collections the current user has access to. When the user enters the tool in any site, the top folder should be the root folder for the current site. That folder should be "open" so the folders within it show up also.

Below the root folder for the current site should be one folder for each collection the user has access to. Those should start out closed. The user can open and close these folders to navigate to any resource item she has access to.

If a user navigates to a subfolder, the breadcrumbs should give a direct link back to the original top-level view. For example, if the user is in site "S1" and navigates to S1/f1/f2/f3 (where f1 is a folder within S1, f2 is a subfolder of f1, and f3 is a subfolder of f2), the breadcrunbs will show "S1 Resources", "f1" and "f2" as active links to views of the corresponding collections (or subcollections). If the user enters the resources tool in site S2 and navigates to S1/f1/f2/f3, the breadcrumbs will contain active links to "S2 Resources", "S1 Resources", "f1" and "f2".

column1: [SAK-1464] Should anonymous assessments be available to take within Sakai?
column6:
Sakai - 2.0.0.rc3-mysql - Sakai 2.0.0.rc3

In the current version of Samigo there's two release settings, "Anonymous" and "Sitename". You can publish an assessment to either or both.

Right now the "Anonymous" setting is all-inclusive. If you publish an assessment to Anonymous but not to Sitename, then it'll still show up in Joe Student's list of available assessments when he logs into Sakai. If Joe takes it, he'll do so non-anonymously (grading options aside).

I know this issue has been raised before by Nadine, but I'm raising it again. It's difficult to explain when writing documentation that the "Anonymous" setting actually doesn't mean any such thing.

So I still think the "Release To" section should be organized differently in future versions. My suggestion is to split it into 2:

Setting 1: Who should be able to take this assessment?

  • Everybody
  • People who can log into Sakai
  • Only members of these sites: (list of the sites you maintain)

(Users can only choose 1 of these 3 options. If they choose "only site members", they can pick any number of sites from their list.)

Setting 2: How do you want to make this assessment available to users?

  • Direct URL
  • Through the "Tests and Quizzes" section of Sakai

(Users should be able to pick either or both of these options.)
column10: Should anonymous assessments be available to take within Sakai?
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Since we only have Anonymous and <current site>, I think the best way to solve this is assessments are either Anonymous or <current site>. Then anonymous assessments are not listed in the Available Assessments and only available by URL. The selection for Anonymous or <current site> in settings needs to be made radio buttons rather than two checkboxes. (Will be in next mockups.)

column1: [SAK-1460] Title bar displays raw HTML instead of proper title
column6: The title bar on sakai-stable is showing up as raw HTML (the source of the page) instead of properly displaying the title.
column10: Title bar displays raw HTML instead of proper title
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
The titlebar wasn't outputting a proper Content-Type header. My testing didn't surface the bug since when no Content-Type header is present in my dev setup, the browser handles it fine.

HOWEVER, sakai-stable is configured to send down a default Content-Type of text/plain, which is incorrect. This causes Mozilla-based browsers to display the source of the HTML.

The fix is to change Charon to correctly set the Content-Type to text/html.

I'll be checking that in shortly.

-Jon

column1: [SAK-1457] Time-Limited Public View
column6:
A user has written in with an interesting request (see CTools Footprints ticket# 23128). they would like to make their site public for a specific time period, then visible only to registered members after that period.

One possibility would be to add a "Public for <blank> days" option to the current public/private options. This feature lines up very well with the way a number of core schools ar organized. It would be useful for schools like Michigan, which have a late add/drop deadline, or Stanford, with its "Shopping Period". In this manner, students could use the CTools site without registering until the registration deadline approached, to get a feel for the class.

column1: [SAK-1454] Buttons should appear in left "tool" menu only if user has rights to access content
column6: If permissions settings for a tool within a site deny user any access to view/create/modify the content of a tool, it would be good if the tool were hidden from that user. For example, a site maintainer might want to add a chat that is available to a limited set of users within the site. Ideally, other users would not see the button for that chat tool. This requires that permissions be checked when determining the tool buttons to be displayed within a site.
column10: Buttons should appear in left "tool" menu only if user has rights to access content
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
Copied over from SAK-4120: Comment by Charles Severance [15-Sep-2006 14:07]

This is implemented for Sakai 2.3 - This solution is different than proposed in the patches because
it is based on Sakai security functions rather than roles. The patches also proposed an
allow/deny pattern. The use of functions instead of roles aligns much better with the Sakai security model and does not require the allow/deny.

Each tool in its registration file indicates the Sakai functions which are needed for
the execution of this tool. For example, the Presentation tool is completely
non-functional without content.read so the following line is added to the tool
registration:

<configuration name="functions.require" value="content.read" />

You can specify more than one security function using commas. The implication is "and" so if two functions are specfied the user must have both permissions.
column90:
Checked with the webcontent tool and presentation tool and they are working - no menu buttons if the permission isn't there for a role that is specified in the tool's config field.

An interesting note - if there are two tools on a page, and one tool is excluded to a role because it is missing the permission, the page shows up with just the other tool. That seems a reasonable behavior, kind of useful actually.

Subject: RE: HELP: Search, Missing Content & Refactor

Carol,

A bit off-topic here.... Where do we put new feature requests? Here is one related to Help.

Students find the Help irrelevant and too "instructor-centric." I think this is a legitimate complaint. If users have "access" permissions why should they be directed to Help information that is geared for "maintain" types and provides information on functions that they are not permitted to perform? It is very confusing to them.

It would be nice if a different Help knowledge-base was called when users are logged as "access" versus "maintain" – and perhaps other roles, such as assistants, tutors, etc. I realize that this adds another layer of complexity in maintaining different kinds of help, but it is critical to providing pointed user help. At the very minimum, providing two for the types that Sakai supports - the access and maintain - is important.

If you can pass this on to whoever you think is appropriate, it would be great.

Thanks,

Vivie

column1: [SAK-1452] HELP: Add Feedback Button to Help Tool
column6:
Add Feedback button to Help Tool.

A Feedback button on the Help Tool would allow QA WG folks to provide immediate feedback re: the Sakai KB (OOTB vs. IU OnCourse). We would modify our QA process to have Feedback be the central way to submit Help content change requests. This would mean QA would no longer log Help content issues in Jira. Such changes take too long to implement using the current Jira method today so this would provide good process improvement. Help content change requests submitted via the new Feedback button would be directed to Jonathan Bolte's KB team IU. This team is responsible for keeping Sakai KB content up to date.

column1: [SAK-1450] Outgoing mail sometimes does not have Date: header
column6:
Outgoing email messages from Sakai, for example those generated by creating an Announcement with email notification, do not have Date: headers.

As recent versions of some MTAs such as exim do not add Date: headers by default in accordance with RFC2822 (para 3.6.1), this means that mail generated from Sakai can reach end-user mailboxes without a date header.

In clients such as Thunderbird, this means such messages get a reported date of 1/1/70 and don't appear at the top of inboxes sorted by date.

Here's an example message:

Return-Path: <marquard@ched.uct.ac.za>
Received: from mail.uct.ac.za ([unix socket])
by mail.uct.ac.za (Cyrus v2.1.18) with LMTP; Fri, 01 Jul 2005 20:02:17 +0200
X-Sieve: CMU Sieve 2.2
Received: from smtp1.uct.ac.za ([137.158.128.183])
by mail.uct.ac.za with esmtp (Exim 4.44 (FreeBSD))
id 1DoPqD-000LLs-QD
for marquard@ched.uct.ac.za; Fri, 01 Jul 2005 20:02:17 +0200
Received: from sakai.cet.uct.ac.za ([137.158.135.1] helo=sakai)
by smtp1.uct.ac.za with esmtp (Exim 4.30; FreeBSD)
id 1DoPqD-0005Am-Lq
for marquard@ched.uct.ac.za; Fri, 01 Jul 2005 20:02:17 +0200
Message-ID: <3534409.1120240937580.JavaMail.root@sakai>
From: marquard@ched.uct.ac.za
To: smtest <smtest@sakai.cet.uct.ac.za>
Subject: [ Stephen's site - Announcement ] 11
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Type: text/html

11<br />
<br />
----------------------<br />
This automatic notification message was sent by Connect2Sakai (https://sakai.cet.uct.ac.za) from the Stephen's site site.<br />
You can modify how you receive notifications at MyWorkspace > Preferences.<br />

column90:
I've been able to work around this issue by setting up a local Postfix instance running on a non-standard port (9725 in my case). I then pass "-Dmail.smtp.host=127.0.0.1 -Dmail.smtp.port=9725" to the startup options. This forces James to send through the local Postfix, which has a cleanup service that writes missing headers, such as Date.

Still have a problem, however, if "Resent-Date" header exists (a rare case, I realize), since Postfix doesn't add Date with presence of Resent-Date. Thunderbird wonderfully ingores the Resent-Date header. Argh.
column95: Raised priority to Critical per Chuck's request.
column99: Verified in 2.1.0_006

column1: [SAK-1449] Running James on port 25 breaks outgoing mail
column6:
If James is configured to run on port 25 on the local server in sakai.properties, viz.:

smtp.port = 25
smtp.enable = true

then outgoing mail is incorrectly handled by James, regardless of a valid smtp server configured in sakai.properties such as:

smtp@org.sakaiproject.service.framework.email.EmailService=smtp.some.domain

James does not handle outgoing mail correctly, and ends up delivering a bounce message for each recipient from postmaster@some.domain to the user who submitted a message, effectively breaking outgoing mail.

James logs errors such as this for each outgoing message:

01/07/05 15:27:50 WARN spoolmanager.spam: Message Mail1120224470127-30 reached the end of this processor, and is automatically deleted. This may indicate a configuration error.

c/f email from Glenn Golden (last para specifically):

% Date: Thu, 14 Apr 2005 10:10:42 -0400 (EDT)
% From: Glenn R. Golden <ggolden@umich.edu>
% To: sakai-dev <sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org>
% Cc: sakai-dev <sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org>
% Subject: Re: james and sakai
%
% James is not supposed to be handling outgoing email, only incoming.
%
% The "smtp" setting in your config is to identify the smtp server to
% contact for outgoing email.
%
% While it's an interesting idea to point at your local James for
% this, this is not something I've ever tried. I recommend you setup
% a valid smtp server that will take mail from your application
% server.
%
% All that said, I have seen James take over outgoing email even when
% so configured with a valid smtp server not localhost, which is
% naughty of it, and not a great idea, because of problems I've seen
% in the way it does this. This is one reason we don't run James on
% port 25 in our environments.

The problem has also been observed at two other sites (reported to sakai-dev and sakai-user, 1 Jul 05).

Either the problem with James intercepting mail should be resolved, or the documentation needs to be revised to indicate that James should never be run on port 25, specifically docs/readme.txt (which includes an example with smtp.port = 25), and docs/sakai.properties.
column10: Running James on port 25 breaks outgoing mail
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: docs need updating as the quick solution.
column90:
See this comment from the sakai-dev list

From: dave.ross@gmail.com
Subject: JAMES on 25 problem solved
Date: August 2, 2005 9:37:10 AM EDT
To: sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org
Reply-To: dave.ross@gmail.com

If you are like me and want to run JAMES on port 25 just like any
other normal SMTP service, but then found that doing so causes JAMES
to swallow outgoing mail into its gaping mouth, you'll be happy to
know that a workaround has been found.

Thank you, Mike De Simone, for adding the following comment about this
issue into the SakaiPedia:

"I have had all sorts of trouble getting James not to try and handle
outgoing mail. If you pass tomcat the java system property
-Dmail.smtp.host=<host ip> , this seems to work. IIRC, when I looked
into this, the code was somehow always using 'localhost' for outgoing
mail for some reason."

Just tried this and yep, it works. James happily runs on 25 while
letting an external SMTP host send mail from Sakai.

Thank You!

-Dave

----------------------
This automatic notification message was sent by Sakai (http://collab.sakaiproject.org) from the Sakai Development site.
You can modify how you receive notifications at MyWorkspace > Preferences.

Ed has been working on this issue and found a fix. The problem is that some questions exported from Respondus and then imported into Samigo lose their scores (or maybe never had scores in a format Samigo could recognize).

Ed says:

Got a fix in. I was able to go into and save the first 5 questions.

The score in some imported questions was not created. (The score is displayed as blank in the UI).
It now interprets this as a floating point 0.0.
The fix is available in version 335.

For there reference, here is the patch code:
/svn/trunk/sakai/sam/src/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/ui/listener/author:
$ svn diff -r 334:335 ItemModifyListener.java
Index: ItemModifyListener.java
===================================================================
— ItemModifyListener.java (revision 334)
+++ ItemModifyListener.java (revision 335)
@@ -116,9 +116,17 @@

itemauthorbean.setItemNo(String.valueOf(itemfacade.getSequence().intValue() ));
}

  • //System.out.println("lydiatest bena.getItemtype() " + bean.getItemType());
  • //System.out.println("lydiatest itemauthor.getItemType() " + itemauthorbean.getItemType());
  • bean.setItemScore(itemfacade.getScore().toString());
    + Float points = itemfacade.getScore();
    + String score;
    + if (points!=null)
    + { + score = points.toString(); + }

    + else // cover modifying an imported XML assessment that has no score yet
    +

    { + score ="0.0"; + }

    + bean.setItemScore(score);
    if (itemfacade.getHasRationale() !=null)

    { bean.setRationale(itemfacade.getHasRationale().toString()); }

column1: [SAK-1445] Proposal for improved tool title bars
column6:
Problem: A tool's title bar rendering is portal-specific. And its been frustrating for tool developers to figure out exactly how to output a good title bar, including reset and help buttons. The JSF tools don't currently have reset buttons, and Samigo doesn't currently have a help button. The old solution to this was full of crud and presentation-layer specific.

Solution: Allow the portal to take responsibility for the title bar. The tool can provide a small amount of registration through the tool registration (or placement), which the portal will use to construct the title bar.

Below is a proposal for simplifying and improving the tool title bars. It addresses providing reset buttons and help buttons for JSF tools. It also fixes a few existing bugs in the process. And it simplifies future portal development. I've already implemented most of this and I'm testing it.

I'd like to get this proposal cleared by whoever needs to clear it. I've already implemented most of this on my own. But this should probably be cleared by the gradebook team, the Samigo team, and the IU team.

Pros:

  • This is closer to the portlet way of doing things. A portlet title bar is up to the portlet container to render.
  • Cleans up existing code. This proposal is much simpler for developers to use, and much more agile to future changes than the existing way of handling title bars.
  • The code pertaining to title bars is only a few lines long, and all in one place - the portal. Better factored code.
  • I've already implemented and tested this, including the small amount of changes necessary to existing tools.

Cons:

  • This might be a tiny bit less theoretically flexible than the current solution. However, the current solution has so much crud built up that flexibility isn't an issue.

Implementation:
The portal (Charon) will output the title bar, using information provided by the tool in its tool registration. There are several new configuration parameters for this purpose. The new tool configuration parameters are "portal.titlebar", "reset.button", "help.button", "help.id", and "help.url".

"portal.titlebar" - boolean - If true, the portal will render the tool's title bar. Defaults to true. Set to "false" for a tool that really, really, really wants to take over its title bar. (I'd like to get rid of this option, and force all tools to use the new way).

"reset.button" - boolean - If true, a reset button will be rendered in the tool's title bar. Defaults to true. Set to "false" for a tool that should not have a reset button.

"help.button" - boolean - If true, a help button will be rendered in the tool's title bar. Defaults to true. Set to "false" for a tool that should not have a help button.

"help.id" - The Sakai help document ID for the help button. Defaults to the tool ID. Used to link the help button into the Sakai help system.

"help.url" - Alternative to "help.id". A URL to the help for this tool. Allows the tool to host its help in its own webapp, or externally, etc.

When the reset button is clicked, the portal will reset the tool to its original state by:
1. Clearing the ToolSession. This clears any session data which the tool has stored in its session. For example, this cleans up JSF component trees and JSF messages stored in the session.
2. Redirecting the main frame of the tool back to the original tool URL.

Testing:
I've already been testing this solution against the legacy tools, Samigo, Gradebook, Syllabus, Profile, Presentation, and other tools. It works great.

Documentation:
Once this is approved, I can add it to the dev documents on collab.sakaiproject.org.

column55:
For the Gradebook: Do you mean neccessarily or unnecessarily? That is, do horizontal scroll bars appear in the iframe even though everything seems to fit OK? It's easy for invisible space to sneak in with complex CSS hierarchies.

Note that the Gradebook's Roster page will always be stuck with horizontal scrolling at some point, since the table contains one column per assignment. Once you get enough assignments, that's it. We created the CSS class "allowWrap" to allow word-wrapping in the column headers to help with just this problem, by the way. It might be worth adding Sakai-wide support for it.

When the Gradebook gets updated to include assignment categories, we'll provide ways to collapse and expand that table horizontally.

Hi Gonzalo -
This is Huong from Stanford. This bug refer to the width setting in listHier in file: /library/skin/tool_base.css. I talked with Marc and he suggested me to ask if you could remove the width setting in that. Could you please do that ? Thanks,
Huong
column211:
I think this may not be a good idea. There are many different tools that have build or reformatted and are using that class under the assumption that it will be 100%.

There are 3 items that I have found cause this problem:

1 Improper nesting of blocks
2 Comments in the prolog (that IE will bung)
3 Validation errors (unclosed block nodes, for example)

In the case of Samigo I was able to fix this problem by correcting all of the above in selected views. Number 2 took a while to puzzle out - need to substitute the HTML style comments with JSP style comments in the *.jsp so that there is nothing in the response above the doctype.

If the three things above do not correct the problem (I did not experiment will all possible views), add the "narrowTable" class to the table class so:

<h:dataTable cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" styleClass="listHier narrowTable">

or override with a width attribute in the JSP. But you should not have to.
