column55:
> That is, is the method of operation that the selection
> of "Anonymous Users" releases the assessment to ALL worksites?

Yes. We basically got rid of the "authenticated" users type altogether. Either you release an assessment to a specific site only, or you release it to everyone. (and therefore all sites).

Marc, in the future instructors should be able to release an assessment to more than one specific site, correct? This functionality was lost in 2.0.

>Because (AND HERE'S THE SECURITY ISSUE), I published an
> assessment to anonymous users only but put in that, for the >grading option, I can see names of the student. AND IT WORKS. >Even though it's published to anonymous only, the name of the >student appears to the graders.

This isn't actually a security problem - it's a naming problem. "Anonymous" release might be better renamed to "Anyone" or "World".

You can take a assessment released to anonymous whether you're logged into sakai or not. If you are logged into Sakai as an authenticated user when you take the test, then Samigo will record that fact. The Total Scores page will either display your username or not depending on the grading settings. Has nothing to do with 'anonymous release'.

Does that make sense? It is confusing, I agree. I'm going to downgrade this to minor and leave it for Marc to consider when he returns from vacation.
column90: not really a security issue.
column95:
I'm not sure this is the best way for anonymous assessments to be released. Most of the time when a group is being surveyed but the identities of the respondents isn't needed/wanted, there is still a focus on which group has access to this assessment. By releasing the anonymous test to all sites, we would take away the ability for a site maintainer to get such a focused response pool. Releasing by URL solely could account for this.

Also, if a user is taking a survey that is supposed to be anonymous, the identity of that user should not be recorded in any fashion. If there are other settings that can circumvent that setting, perhaps those two should be linked (if anonymous is selected, then the grading options are set to not record usernames).
column99:
Also, I've been digging around for some documentation on how this was speced out and finally found this information!! The functionality described in this ticket doesn't seem to match these specs. Has this changed and if so, is there a place that contains this information?

Thanks!
Megan

======================================================================================================

Hello all,

Just want to let you know that the published url for anonymous user has been implemented based on the following spec that Lance sent us last week. The only thing that I didn't do is item 6. I am not sure if cookie is the way to do it as people do share computers in public clusters. I need more time to think about it and decide how we can add this to 2.0 so we can keep track of the attempts. OK?

Daisy

At 02:57 PM 2/9/2005, Speelmon, Lance D wrote:

Let me see if I can help clear things up regarding anonymous assessment delivery.

1. If assessments are published to the "Anonymous" target, the URL is the only form of navigation that anonymous users have to find the assessment.
2. The generated URL will be used by both anonymous and authenticated users.
3. If a user accesses the URL and the assessment has been published to "Anonymous" then the user would begin the assessment without any additional input.
4. If a user accesses the URL and the assessment has not been published to "Anonymous" then the user would be prompted for authentication, and then taken to the begin assessment screen.
5. We suggest that a new Agent (and AgentId) is generated for each anonymous test taking session. This will help identify unique response sessions; i.e. if the assessment is published to "Anonymous", and the user is beginning the assessment via the URL, then the number of attempts is effectively infinite. However, if the user is not using the URL, then number of attempts can be enforced as the user is identifiable.
6. Number of attempts and Anonymous delivery are somewhat incompatible. The only way I can think to possibly address this issue is to use a browser cookie in an attempt to track state.
7. Remember that we also have an "Authenticated Users" publishing target which can be useful if the behavior described above does not suit the needs.

Thanks, L

column111:
Hi Margaret,

please test this by creating an assessment with a mix of question type. Be sure to add a couple of file upload questions. Notice that the Time Remaining is reset to the second when users clicks the "Upload" button or "Save & Continue" button. This way, they are not being penalized by the speed of the system. This is the general implementation. Please ask Ed & Marc if you have question about it. Thanks.
column187:
Retested on all 3 local instances. File uploads no longer mess up the timer, but about one time in five they throw a "string out of bounds" exception. (see the new attachment):

java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -41
column195:
I retested this on all 3 MIT rc3 instances and also on our local qa mysql instance. Here's what I found.

What I did on each instance:

1) Created/took an assessment with all the questions on one page and at least one file upload question.

2) Created and took an assessment with one question per page and at least one file upload question.

3) Created and took a timed assessment with at least one file upload question.

-------------
Results:

  • Uploading a file in delivery still causes the "string out of bounds" exception intermittently on all instances. (see attached).
  • If the assessment is all on one page, answering a file upload question will remove any answers to other questions you already filled in. (That is, if it doesn't throw an exception.)
  • Multipage and timed assessments work fine with file upload questions, when they don't throw an exception. The timer no longer gets screwed up, and answer data doesn't get lost.

----Original Message----
From: Margaret marith@stanford.edu
Sent: Friday, August 12, 2005 11:17 AM
To: David Haines; Marc Brierley
Cc: Carol Dippel; Daisy Flemming
Subject: Re: http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/jira/browse/SAK-1346

At 06:22 AM 8/12/2005, David Haines wrote:
Hi,

Should this be a blocker? We need an assessment of how bad this
problem is and whether there are work-arounds. Losing answers when
uploading a file seems bad to me.

http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/jira/browse/SAK-1346

  • Dave

There is a workaround for the problem with losing answers - publish the
assessment with one question per page, instead of all on one page or one
part per page. (This is the default value, fortunately).

The "string out of bounds" exceptions are more of a problem because they
happen intermittently no matter what. Daisy says these are fixed in svn
#840, and asks that Dave include the file
"SubmitToGradingActionListener.java".

Unfortunately Marc has been laid low by food poisoning and may not be able
to weigh in on this one. But if the exceptions are fixed I don't think this
is a blocker.

Margaret

column1: [SAK-1324] Case sensitivity of usernames
column6:
If you create a new user with a username which has caps in it (e.g UCTstudent1) you can encounter several problems:

Realm Admin: adding the user to a realm with the capitalisation as above, the realm manager will show the user as belonging to the realm but the user won't have access if they login with the capitalized username.

Membership: if the user logs in to the site with the capatalized username, they can join joinable sites. However when they try to enter the site they will get a 'site unavailable' error. If the user logs in with the username in lower case they can access and join sites as expected.
column10: Case sensitivity of usernames
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: I'm assuming, based on regression test instructions, this issue does not occur on Oracle & MySQL in RC3. However, change to Blocker if it turns out this occurs in other DBs. We should then create a single-fix patch vs. wait for next release.
column90: Checked on mysql and it does not occur.
column95: Resolved since it doesn't need development work at the moment. It can be reopened if it does not pass QA.
column99:
I just tried the membership issue, and it's still a problem. The user was created with caps, but the user list shows them in lowercase, and logging in with the original caps does not allow the membership access I have if I login with lowercase.

Does not pass QA.
column103: I tried this on http://sakai-stable.mit.edu:8020 (RC3: Oracle with email)
column107: Just tested this on stable ( Sakai - 2.0.1.rc1-hsql - Sakai 2.0.1.rc1) Problem still occurs as decriped - does not pass QA - reopening
column111: Still a problem in 2.0.1-rc1
column115: Will a lower case version of the username always work? I.e. would that be a work-around?
column139:
It appears not. If you've joined a site with the capital version of your name, logging in with the lowercase version will not show that site to you.

Further, if two account names differ only by a capital letter Sakai appears to treat them as separate accounts, each with their own membership.
column187:
Here is the underlying problem. Sakai will ignore case in the account name for authentication / authorization purposes. It does not ignore the case for creating the user's own "My Workspace". So someone who has an account under one name can login using a different capitalization of that same name. That login will succeed because it is authorized based on the lowercase account name. However the user will then be looking at a different "My Workspace" which will have its own unique setup information. They can customize this workspace as they wish, and join new sites, but since authorization will be done based on the lowercase account name the users will only have access to sites that happen to also be in the workspace with the id of the lowercase account name. This can be very confusing.

However this is not a security risk and is likely to be encountered mostly when someone mistypes only their account name, so this won't be considered a blocker.
column191: We see this issue on 2.0.0 on Oracle. This seems like a very annoying problem that will cause a support headache. Case sensitivity should be consistent throughout the application.
column195:
This is not an acceptable solution. If an external data provider is used, case sensitivity can be an issue (it is here at IU). If a user with a username of "Megan" is added to a site, site info changes the case to lower case in the UI, however this user does not have access to the site.

If an external data provider is not used, the user can log in, but there are 2 My workspaces. clicking on the other makes them both become unavailable.
column199:
The best solution here is to add a property setting, which would allow the choice of case-sensitive and case-insensitive. This would allow Sakai's behavior to be matched to an external data provider's behavior. Of course, Sakai would need to be fixed to properly handle the appropriate senstivity choice; the bug reported here and the fix above indicate that Sakai would not correctly operate currently in a case-sensitive mode.

I would suggest that the most appropriate default for the property would be case-sensitive. A quick, unscientific survey shows that to be the most common, though one noteable exception is Microsoft.
column203: updating the severity
column207:
Case should be preserved throughout the Sakai code. It's not known whether a Provider is case sensitive or not and should therfore be treated as if it is. The current solution is to use the functions in the StringUtil class (trimToZeroLower() or trimToNullLower() ) on the id in multiple places within the BaseUserDirectoryProvider class. This causes problems when case sensitivity is actually needed.

A temporary workaround to this problem for sites that use lowercase ids (username) is to convert the id (username) to lowercase upon login as follows:

In the file:

login/login/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/login/LoginTool.java

insert the following line:

eid.toLowerCase();

in function doPost(...) after this line:

String eid = req.getParameter("eid").trim();
column211:
Ok, minor error in what I posted:

eid.toLowerCase();

should be:

eid = eid.toLowerCase();
column215:
Being one more of those who have observed the login user id case sensitivity issue, I would just like to add that in our case we are using an Oracle database back end.

I was also asked to share how I would like to see it work. Essentially, I would like this to work in the same fashion as other systems I have used and that is that case sensitivity should only be reserved for passwords and not for user names.

Thanks.
column219: Moved to Post-2.1 at Release Management Meeting.
column223:
Another contribuion to this long-running discussion:

  • Local parts (usernames) of email addresses are allowed to be case-sensitive, i.e. an email system at xyz.com may legitimately consider ABC@xyz.com a different account to abc@xyz.com
  • Email addresses can be added as external participants for a site in worksite setup. This has the effect of creating a user with the email address as the userid.
  • However, the worksite setup UI forces the email addresses entered to lower case.

In the worst-case scenario of a user at a remote system which implements case-sensitive local parts being added to a Sakai worksite (and having an account like ABC@xyz.com), the account would be added to Sakai as abc@xyz.com. The user would never receive the email notification from the Sakai system with her new account details.

This is admittedly a very unlikely scenario, as very few if any email systems today still have case-sensitive local parts for email addresses, but is noted here for posterity.
column229:
Sakai is currently defined to have case-insensitive user ids. This is realized by using the lower-case of the user id that is defined when an account is created.

We have bugs in the current system. If a user logs in with a mixed case user id, the login is accepted, but all hell breaks loose. The user can have a new "my workspace" site created, using the mixed case (although this may have been "fixed" at some point). User permissions to sites they join seems to be messed up - the permission is given to the user with the mixed case id, which does not exist, and is later not active.

I've cleaned this up. The user id available from the user's session after login is now their official and properly cased user id; that this was not true was the root of all the errors we were facing..

If your system has not experienced any of this confusion so far, there will be no database conversion from this. But if you have been running with real users, chances are you have some cleanup to do.

Sites with ids starting with "~" and continuing with any non-lower-case letter are not going ever to be used again, and can probably be deleted.

Permissions grants in the SAKAI_REALM_RL_GR table with any non-lowercase values in the USER_ID column should be changed to lower those values, unless the resulting record already exists.

Resources created in /user/<some non-lowercase user id string> folders could be a problem - they will not be available to the user; they should probably be merged into the proper /user/<lower case user id> folders, but again watch out for name conflicts with existing records there.

Sessions stored in the SAKAI_SESSION table might have values in the SESSION_USER column with mixed case, which should be lowered.

Preferences... Messages, events, etc created-by, modified-by fields and from fields - anywhere a user id is stored, it could be confused with a mixed case id that will not work when it's compared later to a user id. These all can be lowered. (Some are not easily accessed, as they are within some XML fields in the database).

I'm not sure how important it is to clean this all up. The permissions is probably the most important.

  • * *

To find out the user id of the current user, use:

SessionManager.getCurrentSessionUserId();

or

Session sakaiSession = SessionManager.getCurrentSession();
sakaiSession.getUserId();

If you ever set the user id:

Session sakaiSession = SessionManager.getCurrentSession();
sakaiSession.setUserId(authn.getUid());

Make sure you set it to a User object's getId() value (or an Authentication object's getUid() value). Don't set it to something the user typed in.

Never apply case manipulation to the User id value. Let the user directory service enforce any case policy.

Don't assume you know the user id or any other field from the User object just because you used it to do a find - get the User object and user the getId(), getEmail(), etc.

  • * *

I've updates all the core Sakai code (code in the /sakai/ tree of our SVN) to play nicer with user ids (SU tool, BaseUserDirectoryService, WorksiteSetup (i.e. SiteInfo), DavServlet). And most importantly, I've fixed the bug in the Authentication component which set the users typed user id as the session user id rather than using the User object's getId().

  • * *

This is being tracked in Jira as SAK-1324 Closed . The "fix" from r1269 has been revoked in the new checkin, as it was not quite right.

SAK-3277 Closed is also fixed by this.

  • * *

Ok, now that that's working, I've added a flag to the UserDirectoryService to let you control if the user ids are going to be case INsensitive, always lowered when we store and search, or case sensitive, preserving how the name is entered. This is controlled in the user directory service's components.xml entry:

<bean id="org.sakaiproject.service.legacy.user.UserDirectoryService"
...
<property name="caseSensitiveId"><value>false</value></property>
</bean>

This defaults to "false" - meaning we are NOT being case sensitive. You can override this in your sakai.properties:

caseSensitiveId@org.sakaiproject.service.legacy.user.UserDirectoryService=true

If you switch to case sensitive, all the ids you already have are in lower case.

If you run in case INsensitive for a while, then switch to case sensitive, you are in some trouble - as all the ids are in mixed case, and when we are running case INsensitive, we expect them to be stored in lower case - none of the mixed case ids will work. You will need to manually lower their case in the database if you swtich to case INsensitive.

It's probably best to get it the way you want it at the start.

There is no database change or conversion needed (other than the above warning about switching mid-stream). The default OOTB behavior is unchanged (but working, now).

  • * *

A few other fixes as part of this work:

The TestEmail service was fixed to deal with some NPEs it was running into (and totally messing up the code that called it).

WorksiteSetup was generating possibly negative values for the new user's random password - these are all positive now. ( SAK-3277 Closed )

5.6) WinXP/MySQL

column115:
Pls. remove the following documents from 2.0.1 final release:

sam/sakai-samigo/README-INTEGRATION.txt
sam/README.txt

See below for background.

----Original Message----
From: Seth Theriault slt@columbia.edu
Sent: Thursday, August 11, 2005 4:05 PM
To: Carol Dippel
Cc: clayf@bu.edu; dlhaines@umich.edu; 'Marc Brierley'; 'Daisy Flemming'; marquard@ched.uct.ac.za
Subject: RE: [Jira] Assigned: ( SAK-1321 Closed ) Samigo READMEs in sakai-src provide confusing information (fwd)

Quoting Carol Dippel <dippel@ix.netcom.com>:

> Two documents are referenced:
>
> README-INTEGRATION.TXT
> sam/README.txt

column1: [SAK-36039] export/import assessment needs to handle special characters in text fields
column6:
found on MIT rc3 build (oracle)

If you try to export an assessment with a special character in the title or any other field (&, for example) the export will fail with an improper-XML error.

The workaround is to avoid special characters or put in their html escape codes (& for & and so on).

In the future, however, export/import should handle special characters more gracefully.
column10: export/import assessment needs to handle special characters in text fields
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
Added documentation on how to fix Sakai exported (or for that matter externally generated) QTI files with special characters in README.import_export.txt.

"6. Import and Export of Character Entities and Non-XHTML Data.

Through cut-and-paste operations or use of unusual ASCII characters such as mathematical symbols it is possible
to create an incorrectly formatted QTI document that is not importable into Tests and Quizzes.

There are two workarounds for this, using a text editor:

a. For the well-known symbols, "&", "<" and ">" you can work around the problem by replacing them with their
XML named entity equivalents, "&", "<", and ">" respectively.

For all other well-known unicode entities you can replace them with their numbered XML entity equivalents (see http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/sgml/entities.html).

For example, (FORALL) x (SUCH THAT) x (IS GREATER THAN) (SQUAREROOT OF) x

could be rendered as

<mattext charset="ascii-us" texttype="text/plain" xml:space="default">∀ x : x > √ x</mattext>

Note that legibility for some entities may be dependent on the browser used.

b. A more general solution is to enclose the non-XHTML text in CDATA. For example:
<mattext texttype="text/html"><![CDATA[True-False: Ist diese Frage richtig oder falsch? (Richtig) ]]></mattext>

Note that the XML parser will make no attmempt to validate the enclosed character data, and will then accept non-XHTML and even bad HTML."
column90: Strategy will be to either surround non-wysiwyg fields esp. title with CDATA or remove unusual characters.
column95:
In analyzing the problem, the text fields are either metadata properties or titles. It turns out that you can't use CDATA in attributes, so the simplest solution is to replace every darned unacceptable character with its XML entity equivent. Fortunately there appears to be a fairly simple solution to that in apache commons utility that does it for you.

So I set the ASI base class setFieldEntry() method to do use the XML escape, and also the assessment, section, and item titles to do the same.

Need to test it a bit, but it looks good so far. Fix details:
esmiley@esmiley ~/svn/trunk/sakai/sam/src/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/business/entity/asi
$ svn commit -m "SAM-489: XML escapes for setFieldEntry() and setTitle()" *.java
Sending ASIBaseClass.java
Sending Assessment.java
Sending Item.java
Sending Section.java
Transmitting file data ....
Committed revision 519.
column99: Looks pretty good. I attach an XML export that imports OK with illegal characters in the assessment and part titles, the metadata and author.

Transmitting file data .

column1: [SAK-1316] Size of submenu text
column6:
Something I've been keeping on the back burner, but thought I'd share it now.

If you look at the T&Q (Samigo) page, you'll see that the submenu text (the words that are under, say, the name of a test eg. Settings | Remove | Export) are in a smaller font than and INDENTED under the actual item.

I like this format because it makes the material on the page more visible.

Can this be done for the other tools? In particular, the Resources tool would benefit significantly (I think) from such a format. Things would not look so cluttered. This gets particularly confusing when there are several subfolders.

It would be nice.

column1: [SAK-1312] Gradebook results different from Samigo Score
column6:
I'm hoping this is a duplicate bug.

Work done on the 'NB - Project 1' worksite

1. As admin, created a test in the T&Q tool (1 question, 2 points for correct answer)
2. As flmover, took the test with correct answer
3. As mickey, took the test with wrong answer

In Gradebook tool, the Avg. score showed up as 50% (which I think is correct) and the scores for each student looked as expected.

Went back as mickey to the test and retook the test, but did NOT submit for grading.

ISSUE:
The Gradebook tool pick up score based on the redone test, even though it test was not submitted for grading. The Gradebook Avg score changed to 100% and the grade for mickey changed from F to A+

I don't think this is the way it should be done. I think Gradebook should only pick up scores from SUBMITTED tests.

column10: Download Submissions produces "empty" files without extensions

column55: Nadine, SAK-1286 Closed covers the fact that the link is mislabled as "download spreadsheet". Is that the problem you are reporting here? Or, are you saying something is wrong with the contents of the zip, assuming that it is a zip archive of the students' submisstions?
column90: SAK-1286 Closed covers mislabling of link.
column95: The problem is with the files that make up the content of the zip file. These files have no extension. I'm assuming they are supposed to be xls files, but I don't think I should have to make assumptions here. It should be explicit.
column99: Nadine, the files would be whatever the students have submitted, they are not necessarily Excel files. Did the students' submissions have extensions that have gone missing? Thanks.
column103: The student didn't have any attachments, if that is your question. The student put her answers in the inline HTMLArea box of the Assignment tool.
column107: For both Homework 1 and Homework 2 the files are 1 character in size. So, I'm interpretting the issue here as (1) The link is mis-labled, which is already covered in SAK-1206 Closed , and (2) the students submission are empty, so the download of their submissions as the zip file should have something more meaningful in it. It is the later issue, which needs to address here.
column111: When downloading student submissions, the files containing the content of the typed-in answers should have a useful extension, such as .html. Also, if the student has not submitted any anwser, then the file should contain meaningful text, such as "Student has not answered the assignment"; currently the file contains the single number "8".
column115:
Just so that we are on the same page ...

The student answered the assigment question. The answer to the assignment question was '8'. The student put her answer in the HTMLArea box, an inline answer, rather than attaching a file. The issue is that 'Download Spreadsheet' functionality, which downloads a zip file that contains the answers of each student, is not assigning an extension to the file containing the answer, ie. the file generated as a result of the HTMLArea box not being empty.
column139: So this is to add a .txt to the text file portion of each student's submission, if there is one.
column187: Checked against 2.0.1.rc2 on all three builds. "Download Spreadsheet" has been renamed to "Download All" but the subsequent zip file that is downloaded does contain .txt extention for the student's submission.

column1: [SAK-1309] Move domain objects into request threads as necessary
column6: We avoided carrying Hibernate-mapped objects in our request thread pseudo-scope for Sakai 2.0, mostly to constrain the number of possible problems. We should now give it a try and see what changes are needed to keep scalability high and contention low.
column10: Move domain objects into request threads as necessary
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: JSF backing beans are now using domain objects directly in the UI. In addition to simplifying the backing beans, this has also enabled us to use optimistic locking.

column1: [SAK-1308] Bogus warning "Unknown element (attribute) in attribute"
column6:
Reported by Gongqin Li:

"When adding a participant to the course and clicking update button, one can see
WARN: Unknown element (attribute) in attribute (2005-06-14 09:48:02,478
http-8020-Processor24_org.apache.jasper.compiler.TagLibraryInfoImpl)"

Josh's comment: "This is odd. I'm not sure why JSP tag library code is being called when (attempting to) adding a gradebook through worksite setup."
column10: Bogus warning "Unknown element (attribute) in attribute"
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
I don't see the warning when I add a participant, but afterwards, when I go to the Gradebook Roster or Course Grade page.

I don't remember seeing this before, but it's possible that we missed it among the bogus MyFaces and JSF resolver warning messages.
column90:
This is a bug in
sakai2/jsf/widgets/src/META-INF/sakaix-jsf.tld in the "inputDate" tag definition. The "showSecond" attribute is mistakenly inserted into the "showTime" attribut (probably bad copy-and-paste).

I changed the the relevant portion of code to:

<attribute>
<name>showTime</name>
<required>false</required>
<rtexprvalue>false</rtexprvalue>
<description>
If true, enable input for user to enter the time. Default is true.
</description>
</attribute>
<attribute>
<name>showSecond</name>
<required>false</required>
<rtexprvalue>false</rtexprvalue>
<description>
If true, and showTime is true, input seconds.
Default is false.
If false, default to zero seconds.
</description>
</attribute>

And the bogus warning disappeared.

I wasn't sure about making the change myself, though, so I'm passing it on to Jon. If you'd me to check it in, just say the word!
column95:
Fixed in CVS HEAD, just as Ray Davis described above.

This fix should be in 2.0.1 because the bug was causing a lot of bogus and worrying errors in the logs.
column99: Fixed in SVN.

column1: [SAK-1307] WebDAV (Windows Only) uploading or moving file triggers Resource email notification
column6:

An email notification is sent for each individual file.

(This problem is not apparent when using Mac OSX 10.4)

column90: Can someone update this?
column95: We couldn't confirm this for Sakai (although we could in CTools). This issue was only found for Windows 2000, not for Windows XP
column99: And it was only happening on one of the two Windows 2000 machines that we could test it on.
column103:
Additional testing found the real problem. Steve Lonn reports in CT-151:

This bug happens when a user either moves or copies & pastes files from one WebDAV window to another. This has been tested with new and old sites.

Note that this bug does not occur when uploading files – only when copying or moving between two open WebDAV windows.

This seems to only occur on Windows machines (most recently tested on Windows XP SP2). Macinotsh OSX machines appear unaffected.

This bug also happens when you cut/paste or copy/paste files within an individual site (individual WebDAV window).
column107:
I think I was able to trigger this bug on Mac OS X 10.4, indirectly.

I mounted the Resources for a course via WebDAV using the Mac's built-in utility (not Goliath), then opened a Powerpoint file that was stored locally on my hard drive. I "saved as web page" directly to the network volume.

I received one email notification for a "Powerpoint Temp" file. Despite the dozens of files that powerpoint created, I only received this one notiification, so the problem is not as severe on the Mac but it can happen.
column111: This was verified as still and issue under Windows XP today by Kristol.
column115: Peter, I noticed this bug wasn't assigned. Could you please assign it to the appropriate developer? Thanks!
column139: Chuck has volunteered to take this one.
column187:
I just spent a while trying to reproduce this with some debugging enabled. I attach a file of those results. The simple answer is that I could not reproduce this. All kinds of events and notifications are happening, but all the events for the work done in DAV were priority=0 which means ignore/no notification.

I need to have precise reproducing instructions. I am pretty confident that if I can reproduce this, I can find it pretty quickly with the instrumented versions of the code that I have.

I tested the following cases

Pasting between folders on the same site
Pasting between folders on different sites

All worked pretty well.

column1: [SAK-1306] WebDAV Folder Creation Issues for Mac OS 10.1-3
column6:
When connecting to Sakai using Goliath (for Mac OS 10-10.3), users cannot create new folders remotely and cannot drag existing folders from their hard drive to Sakai.

This is highly problematic as the instructions on the system instruct users to use Goliath for Mac systems.

--------------

The native WebDAV in the new Mac OS 10.4 (Tiger), does not have these problems. Users can create folders and drag in existing file structures from their hard drive without problems.

However, there are no instructions for how to connect using the native Mac OSX 10.4 WebDAV (it's pretty easy - just Command-K from the finder, and then enter the URL in the box)
column10: WebDAV Folder Creation Issues for Mac OS 10.1-3
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Remove Goliath from instructions and replace with MacOS instructions, because MacOS works correctly now as of 10.4.
column90:
Possible MacOS 10.4.x Instructions:

Note: There must be at least one object (file, folder etc.) in the group or class resource area before you begin the setup procedure. This procedure needs to be done once for each site in Sakai before you can use WebDAV to transfer files to and from any one site.

These instructions are for MacOS 10.4.x
Older versions of MacOS are not supported for WebDAV

1. From the Finder, select "Go" from the menu bar and then select "Connect to Server..."
2. In the resulting dialog box, type in the path:

<code></code>

3. Press the "+" button to save this path for future use.
4. Click "Connect"
5. Type in your username and password and click "OK"
6. You will now see a window on your Mac screen that represents the resources in your Sakai site. You can now drag and drop files into this window and delete files by dragging them to the Trash.
column95: Screenshot of MacOS 10.4 Connect to Server window
column99:
I am not sure the description of this issue is totally accurate, especially in light of 2.0.1-rc2.

Using Goliath 1.0.1 on 10.3/Panther, you do get the same connection error. However, if you refresh the view (command-R), the folder you tried to copy appears. It's empty but it's there and writable so the folder's content can be added.

I'll admit this is ugly, but it's sort-of-workable solution for anyone who is not using Tiger (or happens to prefer Goliath).
column103: Is this issue still relavent for 2.1.0?
column107: Golaith has had long-standing issues
column111: It sounds like these two are related.
column115: I think the fixes implemented to resolve SAK-3640 Closed might actually have fixed this problem. Need to be verified.
column139: Resolving as Fixed so that QA can verify.
column187: Verified on qa1-us and qa1-uk with the .007 tag against our current build (2.1.x). You can now create folders remotely as well as drag them in to Goliath. Our current build (2.1.x) fails to do both.

column1: [SAK-1304] Clicking "Update Options" twice for a bad feed results in error message
column6:
In News, I edited the options and entered a bad URL for the feed ("bad feed!"). I clicked the Update Options button, and got the following warning label:

Alert: bad feed! is an invalid RSS feed.

So far so good. However, without changing anything, I clicked on the Update Options button again. I left the options page and returned to the main page of News. I got the following two error messages:

$tlang.getString("gen.alert") "bad feed!" is not a complete and valid URL.
Alert: bad feed! is an invalid RSS feed.

If I open up options again, the bad URL I entered was still there. If I clicked Update Options again, I returned to the main page and got the same errors.

column1: [SAK-1301] Incorect configuration leads unjoinable site
column6:
When seting up a site it is possible to create a unjoinable site by:

1) Setting joinable to true
2) leaving "Role to assign to joiners" empty or with an invalid (undefined) value

A site set up in this way will show up as joinable in the membership tool, however when a user tries to join the site nothing happens (no error message is given to the user).
column10: Incorect configuration leads unjoinable site
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Should not be able to leave role choice blank. Required to choose one.
column90: If the site is made joinable, then the entry in the role to assign joiners field should be non-blank and match one of the existing roles.
column95:
The worksite setup tool is asking users to select a role for a joinable site. If no role has been seleted, there is no way to continue.
Not an issue any more.
column99: It's possible (in 2.0.1-m1) to set up an unjoinable site through Admin workspace | Sites | New site and leave the joiner role blank. So this is still an issue.
column103: This is a fix to the admin sites tool - insure that if the site is marked joinable, there is a role in the joinable role field, and it matches an existing role in the site.
column107:
Admin Sites tool was updated -
When a site is being created or edited as joinable, a qualified joiner role must be given. if the joiner role is missing or invalid, an alert message shows up, saying "Please specify a qualifed joiner's role".
When the site type is given, the tool checks the realm template for that site type. If the site type is null or has no an associated template, the tool uses !site.template.

This fix is in svn r943, and should be available for testing tomorrow, 8/3 on nightly2.

-Joanne
column111: This is not in 2.0.1.
column115: This issue was not verified in the formal QA process but is included in a production version of Sakai (2.1). If you find this is still a problem, please re-open.

column1: [SAK-1298] Notification after uploading an assesment
column6:
When importing an assesment you click on the 'Browse...' button and then on 'Upload'. After clicking 'Upload', and given that no problems were found with the file, the assesment uploads but the user is not notified by any means that the upload has been successful. column1: [SAK-1295] Site Tabs: Changes to the Browser's text size cause the Tabs to disappear
column6: If i decrease my browser's text size (view -> text size), the site tabs disappear. Additionally, the menu on the left and the tool header where the reset and help buttons live is affected as well. Please let me know if you need any additional information. thanks!
column7:
oncoursecl.iu.edu/portal, sakai-stable.mit.edu:8020/portal, nightly2.sakaiproject.org/portal
Windows XP SP2, IE 6 SP2, Mozilla 1.0.4
column10: Site Tabs: Changes to the Browser's text size cause the Tabs to disappear
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: What are you changing the text size from/to? What are the exact details for reproducing this? Thanks.
column90:
To reproduce this bug in IE:

1. Click the View menu, then click Text Size. You will see a menu with the following choices:

Largest
Larger
*Medium
Smaller
Smallest

For me, Medium is selected by default.

2. Click Smaller.
3. View the site tabs in Sakai. You will see that they are cut off. You will also notice that the tool header has started to get cut off as well.
4. Click the View menu, then click Text Size.

Smaller should now be selected by default.

5. Click Smallest.
6. View the site tabs in Sakai. You will see that they no longer appear. You will also notice that the tool header is extremely cut off now and at this point the menu on the left has started missing separation lines.
7. If you change the text size back to medium by clicking View, then Text Size, then Medium, you will see that the site tabs have returned and are appearing as expected.

To reproduce this bug in Mozilla Firefox:

1. Click the View menu, then click Text Size. You will see a menu with the following choices:

Increase
Decrease

2. Click Decrease.
3. View the site tabs in Sakai. You will see that the site tabs are cut off. You will also notice that the tool header has started to get cut off as well.
4. Click the View menu, then click Text Size again.
5. Click Decrease.
6. View the site tabs in Sakai. You will see that they no longer appear. You will also notice that the tool header is extremely cut off now and at this point the menu on the left has started missing separation lines.
7. If you increase the text size by clicking View, then Text Size, then click Increase, then click View, then Text Size, then Increase again, you will see that the site tabs have returned and are appearing as expected.

Please let me know if you need any additional information. Thanks!
column95: Reassigning to Peter.

column111:
Daisy, here is my 2 cents: It seems in displayFileUpload.jsp file, you assume that question is itemContentsBean, so you call question.mediaArray. But in fact, it is a publishedItemData, so it throws notfoundProperty error for mediaArray.

Here is some code in QuestionScoreListener.java:
ItemDataIfc item = data.getPublishedItem();
bean.setTypeId(item.getTypeId().toString());
bean.setItemId(item.getItemId().toString());
bean.setItemName("Section " + item.getSection().getSequence().toString()
+ ", Item " + item.getSequence().toString());
System.out.println("Qingru: TYpe id = " + item.getTypeId().toString());
item.setHint("***"); // Keyword to not show student answer

ArrayList deliveryItems = new ArrayList(); // so we can use the var
deliveryItems.add(item);
bean.setDeliveryItem(deliveryItems);

It seems item is gotten from data.getPublishedItem(), thus a publishedItemData.
Hope this helps your fix.

Qingru

column1: [SAK-1289] Make it clearer that having no email address will prevent you from using Email Archive
column6:
If you have no email address set up for your account, the Email Archive tool will display the following text when you open it:

"No email address associated with your account. Email sent to the following addresses will be archived and sent to participants:"

which doesn't make a lot of sense since without an email address set up, you can't send email to your site. It might be a good idea to make it clearer that until you get an email address set up, you will not be able to use this feature.
column10: Make it clearer that having no email address will prevent you from using Email Archive
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: For the rare case where a user has no email address we do need a better warning. Need to tell them they cannot send in email until they have an email addressed configured for their account.
column90:
Joanne -can you change the message when the user doesn't have an email address from
No email address associated with your account. Email sent to the following addresses will be archived and sent to participants
to
There is no email address specified for your account. You must specify the email address for your account in order to send email to or receive email from this site.

Note that there is a different message that appears if the user doesn't have permission to email that should still be shown. In that case it doesn't matter that they have or don't have an email address if they can't send email to the site due to not having the mail.new permissions.
column95: Wording was changed. Fix was checked in.
column99:
Message wording for accounts with no email address specified has now been updated to say:

column55:
It looks like the icon recently switched from being explicitly included in an <img> tag to being implicitly brought in through CSS. Here's the relevant part of "skin/default/tool.css":

.toolTitle td.action{
background:url(images/titleright.gif) top right no-repeat;
padding:3px 22px 2px 2px;
text-align:right;
vertical-align:middle;
}

And an excerpt of the generated HTML for the Announcements tool bar:

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" class="toolTitle" summary="layout"><tr>
<td class="action"><a href="...."><img src="/library/image/transparent.gif" alt="Help" border="0"></a></td>

The Gradebook continues to be the only JSF tool with any Help link in its title bar, which may explain why we didn't hear about this.

I'll change our "title.jsp" to take the new approach and add the background image to our standalone CSS.

column1: [SAK-1277] Samigo database mis-handling file uploads
column6:
The Samigo database schema has a bug that breaks Samigo file uploads. It only breaks file-upload-type questions in assessments, not other question types. The database column is too short - 255 bytes - and so uploaded files get truncated.

A schema patch will be available shortly.
column10: Samigo database mis-handling file uploads
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
this is teh fix. Tested it in Oracle & hsqldb

Daisy
<property name="media" type="binary">
<!-- HSQLDB do not support blob - too bad, so let's Hibernate deal with it then
<column name="MEDIA" not-null="false" sql-type="blob"/>
-->
<column name="MEDIA" not-null="false"/>
</property>
column90: Rewrote bug description + renamed bug so that people aren't misled about the scope and problem here.
column95:
Update - the fix above is insufficient.

Suggested fix to 2.0.0 source release:
Change the file /sakai2/sam/src/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/data/dao/grading/MediaData.hbm.xml to read:
<column name="MEDIA" not-null="false" length="1000000000"/>

Suggested fix to 2.0.0 binary release:
Change the file /tomcat/webapps/samigo/WEB-INF/classes/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/data/dao/grading/MediaData.hbm.xml to read:
<column name="MEDIA" not-null="false" length="1000000000"/>
column99:
Tested on both HSQLDB and oracle nightly builds on aam-dev. I tried uploading and then opening an rtf document, a jpg and then a pdf file in turn.

On the HSQLDB instance, the rtf document and jpg were fine, but the PDF wouldn't open after uploading (no error messages, just nothing happened).

On the oracle instance, all 3 test files were corrupted and would not open after uploading.
column103: fixed.
column107:
1. <column name="MEDIA" not-null="false" length="1000000000"/>

does not fix the problem for all three databases (oracle, mysql & hsqldb) that we support.

2. let me explain the data type that Hibernate has selected for the field SAM_MEDIA_T.MEDIA (this is the field where the file uploaded will be stored) using the above declaration.

oracle --> blob (good!)
hsqldb --> varbinary (good!)
mysql --> tiny blob (not good 'cos that can only contain 255 bytes)

3. So,if you are using mysql and would like to support file upload to mysql. Please check that the data type for SAM_MEDIA_T is "longblob". If not, execute this command:

ALTER TABLE SAM_MEDIA_T MODIFY MEDIA longblob;

4. You would also like to get the patch "sakai-2.0.1-m1.tar" posted in SAK-1356 Closed . In this patch, instead of using Hibernate to retrieve the SAM_MEDIA_T.MEDIA, we opt to use JDBC prepared statement and by calling resultSet.getBinaryStream(). This way, we were able to guarantee that the file content are being retrieved instead of file locator. Note that when file is over 4000k, oracle for one stores the file outsid ethe table and what is stored in teh table is a fiel locator (read http://forum.hibernate.org/viewtopic.php?t=940988&highlight=byte).

Hope this works... sigh... it is not easy to support multiple DB using one common OR map and code. Let me know if it doesn't work, then I will have to think of something else.

Daisy
column115:
Trying to test the fix on the mysql instance at coursework-s1.

So far I can upload and then view small files (a few kb in size), but when I try to upload a 1.25 MB pdf file, I get out of memory errors and also this new one:

WARN: forward: javax.servlet.ServletException: org.springframework.jdbc.UncategorizedSQLException: (Hibernate operation): encountered SQLException [Packet for query is too large (1360344 > 1047552). You can change this value on the server by setting the max_allowed_packet' variable.]; nested exception is com.mysql.jdbc.PacketTooBigException: Packet for query is too large (1360344 > 1047552). You can change this value on the server by setting the max_allowed_packet' variable.
column139:
Further testing!

3 test files:
small gif (10kb or so)
medium word doc (800kb)
largeish pdf (1.25mb)

Created and published an assessment with file upload questions on each of the 3 instance, took it as a student, and tried to upload and view each of the files above. Then tried to view each file in grading as instructor.

Results: Everything worked fine on the oracle and hsqldb instances. On the mysql instance, the two smaller files were fine, but trying to upload the 1.25mb file caused an out-of-memory exception and the "packet for query is too large" exception in the previous comment.
column187:
to avoid the abve problem in MySQL, you need to increase max_allowed_packet in MySQL,

mysql> mysqld --max_allowed_packet=16M

see this for details:
http://dev.mysql.com/doc/mysql/en/packet-too-large.html
column191: please check after Julian increase the max_allowed_packet
column195: Can we have an update.
column199:
You want an update half an hour after the last one? Geez.

File uploads in Tests&Quizzes are now working properly except in mysql. The mysql problem is due to the default max allowed packet size, not anything in Sakai code (see Daisy's comment). We'll be confirming this shortly.
column203: related to the general file upload bug
column207:
Increasing the max packet size in mysql fixed the problem. I was able to upload both a 1.25MB and a 30MB file in delivery, and download and view them in grading, with no problems.

Will leave this as 'resolved' until the patch can be installed and tested on sakai-stable.mit.edu.

Today I'm getting 2 new exceptions when I test file uploading on the MIT oracle instance.

Exception 1: (see attachment 7.20.mit-oracle-file-upload)

java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -40 at java.lang.String.substring(String.java:1444)

Exception 2: (see attachment 7.20.mit-oracle-remove-file-upload)

].[/samigo].[sakai.samigo]) org.springframework.jdbc.UncategorizedSQLException: (Hibernate operation): encountered SQLException [Stream has already been closed];

Steps I took:

2) Restarted browser. Created new assessment with file upload question, took assessment, appeared to successfully upload file.

3) Went to grading screen and attempted to view the uploaded file - got exception #2.

column229:
Retesting after the media type variable was set on the oracle instance and the max packet size was increased on the mysql instance.

File upload now works fine on the mysql instance. On the oracle instance uploading a file in delivery causes a new exception:

org.springframework.jdbc.UncategorizedSQLException: (Hibernate operation): encountered SQLException [ORA-01502: index 'SAKAI21USER.SYS_C0017445' or partition of such index is in unusable state ]; nested exception is java.sql.BatchUpdateException: ORA-01502: index 'SAKAI21USER.SYS_C0017445' or partition of such index is in unusable state

column233:
Gonqin said:

index sakai21user.sys_c001745 is generated by oracle when you specify sam_media_t.mediaid as primary key for this table. I dropped primary key constraint and re-created primary key constraint for sam_media_t.

I tested again today and file upload is now working correctly in all 3 builds.

column1: [SAK-1895] Total Score for random draw parts off in authoring
column6:
Sakai - 2.0.0.rc2-hsql

When you're in the Questions view of authoring, there's a line on the top left showing you the total number of questions and possible points for the assessment so far, like this: "X existing questions | Y total points"

If you add a random draw part to the assessment, that total scores line will reflect the total number of questions and points in the draw pool - even if your part doesn't draw all those questions.

Steps to reproduce:

1) Create an question pool with 4 questions in it.
2) Create an assessment.
3) Modify the first part to be random draw, drawing 3 questions from the pool you made.
4) Return to the questions view. The random draw part will say 3 questions, but the total scores line will say 4 questions.
column10: Total Score for random draw parts off in authoring
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Sorry back to you, Marc. What am I supposed to put then?
column90: The Total Scores line should list the number of questions drawn from the question pool, right? Not the total number of questions in the pool.
column95: Yes, the number of total questions for the assessment that gets added up should include the number of questions for random draw part, not the number of questions in the pool from which the part is drawn.
column99: yes I agree it should say the number of questions drawn from the pool, but I wasn't sure what to put in the total score field? not all questions have the same scores right?
column103:
For points, let's do this "X existing questions | Y total points*"
At the very bottom of the Questions view:
"*This assessment contains a random draw part, the "total points" is an estimate"
Let's add the first choosen n number of questions from the question pool to the total points for the estimate.

column103: Hi Jon - Any help you might have on this?
column107:
The problem is that certain tests&quizzes JSP files don't properly include the JavaScript from the Sakai portal. There is a JS file and JS fragment that the portal passes along to the tool, which causes the frame to resize properly. Ed and Daisy have both looked at this JavaScript before at some point, it has to do with the header.inc and JSP files.

When its working you'll see the following in the output in every page:
<script type="text/javascript" language="JavaScript" src="/library/js/headscripts.js"></script>

<body onload="...;setMainFrameHeight('Main6e9604e2x0f19x4a24x80ecxe3ac38e90fff');setFocus(focus_path);">

Check the output of the offending pages. You probably won't see those JavaScript fragments.

To understand how this should be done see the Sakai Tool documentation, in the section
"Tool-Portal Cooperation in HTML Generation":
http://collab.sakaiproject.org/access/content/group/1097928811887-22636/Architecture%20Docs/Sakai%202/sakai_tool.pdf
column111: Can you take a look at this?
column115: Huong, I think it is a typo in the body onload, like a missing comma or quote. It should be loading a portal JS that resizes the portlet dynamically.
column139:
Margaret - I think it is an old bug which has been fixed. Can you please verify? Thanks,
Huong

On our nightly mysql instance, the question pools frames are the same length as the other ones.

column199: Well, the frame width and height is adjusted based on the content when the page is first loaded. So, the frame could be small or large depends on the content in it when the page loads So, if there is a hidden information is extended, like in templateEditor, or table of content in delivery view, then the vertical bar will show. That is how it should.

column107:
There are a few files related to fixes -
java files: component/.../tool/assessment/facade/AgentFacace,
AgentHelper, component/.../integration/helper/integrated/AgentHelperImpl,
component/.../integration/helper/standalone/AgentHelperImpl, DeliveryBean, ShowMedisServlet
jsp files: deliverFileUpload, displayFileUpload, displayFileuploadAnswer
Summary of fixes:
1. Some of null pointer exceptions are thrown out because currentPlacement
is null. This is caused by a new pop up window when users click on the
file name links. It goes throught another servlet to show up the file
content. ToolManager can't get the placement for it - set
"sam_fileupload_siteId" as a parameter to request instead of getting
"currentSite" by ToolManager.
2. Role and Authz check is not right because of 2 - added another method
to AgentHelper: getRoleForAgentAndSite(String agentString, String siteId)
to check roles by two parameters instead of getting "currentSite" through
ToolManager.
3. Modified several jsp for setting sam_fileupload_siteId for file links.
Current site ID is got through DeliveryBean.
IU will still turn this question type off because it creates "/tmp" under root. We need to get this integrated with ContentHosting before turn it on.

column1: [SAK-1262] No safe way to skin tool-specific CSS
column6:
The "DRAFT DRAFT" recommendation at http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/confluence/display/STT/Sakai+2.0+CSS+Strategy suggests the following:

<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="css/tool-default.css"/>
<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="css/tool-toolname.css"/>
<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="css/tool-inst.css"/>

This makes sense. The tool builds on the defaults. Then the institution can override the tool and the default, all in one skin definition.

But the way skinning is being done right now is to automatically insert two CSS includes together:

<link href="/library/skin/tool_base.css" type="text/css" rel="stylesheet" media="all" />
<link href="

{skin.default}

/tool.css" type="text/css" rel="stylesheet" media="all" />

The tool can't insert its own CSS file in the middle, and so the tool's own CSS definitions can't be overridden by the institution (except by changing them & repackaging the WAR, of course).

In conversation, Jon Andersen pointed out that an easy way for the tool to put its CSS after the default and before the installation skin would be to split the runtime attribute "sakai.html.head.css" into "sakai.html.head.css.default" and "sakai.html.head.css.inst".
column10: No safe way to skin tool-specific CSS
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: The runtime attributes "sakai.html.head.css.base" and "sakai.html.head.css.skin" have been created, as Ray described above. These attributes will be in the 2.0 release.
column90: Resolved, in the sense that the necessary pieces are in the portal now, so that tools CAN skin tool-specific CSS if they wish too. The gradebook tool can go ahead and do it any time they want.
column95: I just checked in the changes which allow institutions to override even Gradebook-specific CSS styles with their skins. Tests out fine. Thank you, Jon.

column1: [SAK-1254] Resources: Add Back Bulk Delete
column6: The bulk delete was removed as a result of the Sakai-2.0 legacy refactoring sub-project. As I understand it, the argument for removing this feature was the obscured placement of the Update button at the bottom of a long list of resources. I understand the concern, however, I believe that the functionality gained by a bulk delete heavily outweighs the problem of finding the Update button. We can certainly train users with long lists of resources to scroll for the update button. The alternative is to require users to click twice to delete every resource. For example, deleting 10 resources would require 20 clicks, whereas using bulk delete to delete those same 10 resources would only require 12 clicks. Additionally, the style guide allows for this feature solely for the purpose of doing bulk deletes. My request is to revert this functionality as spec-ed back to the bulk delete as shown in the style guide.
column10: Resources: Add Back Bulk Delete
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Daphne, could you comment on the rationale for the removal of bulk delete before we deciede to proceed on this one. I expect there are a lot of people on both sides of the fence for this one. Thanks.
column90:
UM support folks are already worried about that missing piece too.
We weren't supposed to loose any functionality with the refactor, and in this case in particular, we had used resources as the example when we had the style guide discussion and specifically accomodated the bulk delete in resources - a tool team decision and the example in the style guide. I would mark this as a 2.0.1 requirement.
column95: As I explained to John previously, this was not a refactor project decision. Resources was a different bird as the goal was to try to get it closer to the advanced resources tool. That's where this functionality was removed. I've asked Peter to assign this to someone else.
column99: Rob, as Daphne asks, can you please comment for posterity on the rationale for the removal of the checkboxes? Thanks.
column103: The removal of the checkboxes is *major source of dissatisfaction for us as well – not only for the changes in the delete functionality, but more so for the absolute clutter of the new UI. The resource items and action links per item run into each other and make it for a very crowded and confusing screen for adult learners. The checkboxes in the earlier version of the legacy tools allowed users to consciously make a choice to select an item for deletion, replacing, etc. It was VERY nice. Discovering this unexpected change while testing 2.0 has been very upsetting. I hope the team considers bringing the checkboxes back and putting the action links at the top, as they were before. Thanks.
column107: Not having heard any further on why this feature should remain missing, the majority of opions expressed are to restore bulk delete. Last chance to comment otherwise before it is fixed for 2.0.1. Thanks.
column111: This is done. The interface is a little different from the mock-ups. In particular, the "Check All" and "Uncheck All" is done with a checkbox. Please try that out. If you want it changed to an action link instead of a checkbox, I'll do that. Also, I already had labels done saying "Select All", "Remove Selected", etc (instead of "Check All", "Remove Checked", etc). I think the earlier mockups said "Select" instead of "Check". If you want that changed to "Check", let me know.
column115:
I was having trouble creating an issue, so I'm reopening this one

Can we removed the checkbox to delete the top level folder? Allowing deletion of this creates a nasty error message. It deletes the content and then leaves the tool pretty useless
column139: The fix for this is checked in. The checkboxes have been removed for the top-level folders in sites. That takes care of the problem Megan mentioned. A similar problem could occur if the sakai administrator deleted top-level folders from the "group" or "group-user" folder in the resources tool in admin's workspace. That is far less likely to occur than the problem Megan mentioned.
column187: Able to "Bulk Delete" by selecting items (checking the checkbox for the item), then clicking "Remove Checked" at the top. Alert screen asks whether you are sure you want to remove the selected items? If a folder is selected for deletion¿the alert notes that the contents of the folder will also be removed. Click "Remove" and they're gone! Bulk delete works on MySQL, Oracle, HSQLDB sites, with Windows XP SP 2, Firefox 1.0.6.

column1: [SAK-35496] assessment preview doesn't reflect changes to assessment
column6:
Observed on: MIT stable builds 2.0.0.rc2-oracle , mysql

When I create an assessment and preview it in authoring, the first time it works fine. If I then modify the assessment (by adding another question or part, for example), the preview won't reflect the changes.

Steps to reproduce:

1) Create an assessment
2) Add 1 question to assessment
3) Preview assessment (shows 1 question), quit preview.
4) Add another question or part to assessment
5) Preview again - you still see the old 1-question version.

I can't determine whether this is an integrated-version-only bug or not because creating or viewing any assessment on the SA build throws an exception.

I tried to test this on the aam-dev builds as well, but other problems get in the way in both places.

column1: [SAK-1248] Shorten text fields in synoptic discussion options so they display on same line as labels
column6:
I'm looking at the options for the synoptic Discussion tool on my laptop, so I don't believe this is a problem on larger displays. However, on my computer, the text fields for "number of days in the past" and "number of discussion items" appear on the next line after their labels. These text fields are very wide, but would not typically accept values that large (the default figures are a single and double digit number, leaving lots of space). If we shortened the length of those text fields, then they would fit on the same line as their labels, making it clearer what they are for, and making the tool look better.

This was originally reported in SAK-962 Closed with a few other issues that have been addressed.

column1: [SAK-1246] HTML tags and labels appear if htmlArea text is deleted from Feedback field
column6:
In Test & Quizzes, when creating a new assessment html tags will appear with the corresponding label if text is typed in the htmlArea of the Feedback field and then deleted.

Steps to reproduce:
1. create a new assessment
2. select multiple choice question
3. type in the question and answers and select correct answer
4. in any of the Feedback boxes type something then delete it.
5. Save it and you see, "Feedback: </p>" next to the answer where you deleted the text (Firefox shows <br />).

This only displays when creating assessments. It does not display when taking the assessment.
See attachment for clarification.

The assessments used can be viewed at http://sakai-stable.mit.edu:8020/portal in the ls - test worksite.
column10: HTML tags and labels appear if htmlArea text is deleted from Feedback field
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: escape turned on for some reason?
column90: Yep.
column95:
The problem is that HTMLArea is making XHTML, and authoring displays the items you complete as escaped out HTML (it is really putting "<p>" not "<p>", which displays as the code for a paragraph tag).

This is actually a general problem. Any HTML in HTMLArea displays in authoring as source code, in essentially all the feedback fields! (Delivery is correct.)

This is incorrect, the JSF component should have its escape attribute set to false.

Fix details (revision 81):
svn/trunk/sakai/sam/webapp/jsf/author/preview_item
$ svn commit -m "SAK-1246: set escape to false in item display in authoring"
Sending preview_item/FillInTheBlank.jsp
Sending preview_item/Matching.jsp
Sending preview_item/MultipleChoiceMultipleCorrect.jsp
Sending preview_item/MultipleChoiceSingleCorrect.jsp
Sending preview_item/MultipleChoiceSurvey.jsp
Sending preview_item/ShortAnswer.jsp
Sending preview_item/TrueFalse.jsp
Transmitting file data .......
Committed revision 81.
column99: This fix should catch all the HTML code display.
column103: I am still experiencing this problem - verified on Nightly2 and IU's latest build from head.
column107:
My bad. Looks like I missed some places this can occur in

preview_item/MultipleChoiceMultipleCorrect.jsp
preview_item/MultipleChoiceSingleCorrect.jsp
preview_item/MultipleChoiceSurvey.jsp
preview_item/ShortAnswer.jsp
preview_item/TrueFalse.jsp

(There were some extremely long code lines that are very hard to read, that I appear to have missed.)

The others seem to have all the escapes.

column1: [SAK-1241] RSS News tool fails to update correctly
column6:
After initializing a newsfeed, a user may leave and return (or refresh) expecting to see updated information from the feed. The NewsService is designed to cache channels for 10 minutes. If the user attempts a refresh within 10 minutes or if another user attempts to view the same channel within 10 minutes, the cached version should be used. If the cached version has expired, it will be retrieved again.

The problem is that sometimes a null channel is returned. This shows up as a blank page in the news tool. Seems to occur when the cached item is expiring.
column10: RSS News tool fails to update correctly
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Will this issue be resolved for 2.1.0?
column90: Will this be resolved for 2.3.0?
column95: will be looking at this problem soon (hopefully)
column99:
The only time I can reproduce this is if there is an error retrieving a feed.. the error is cached instead of the real feed and then all views of the feed from all users until the cache timeout expires see a blank feed. I'll be committing a fix for that shortly.

Are there other cases where the user is given a null feed? I can't find seem to find any others...
column103: This should now be fixed as of -r15676, I've spent much of today trying to find other ways to reproduce this with no luck. If other cases still cause the issue please reopen and describe thoroughly, thanks.

column1: [SAK-1239] Missing URIEncoding="UTF-8" attribute from Connector element in Tomcat's server.xml for DEMO
column6:
Glenn,

The reason we are having problems with UTF-8 is that we missed a setting in server.xml for Tomcat. I verified this setting is missing from the rc2 demo zip. Here are the details. Thanks, L

I've checked in some improvements to international character handling and
file upload. These improvements are necessary to allow Melete, Syllabus,
Profile, Samigo (and other new JSF tools) to do successful JSF file uploads
as well as have fuller international character support.

All developers using the code in HEAD (or in the sakai_1-5-0 branch) will
need to make a change in order for international character handling to work.

The change is in Tomcat's configuration. The Connector needs to specify
URIEncoding="UTF-8". This is the standard way of allowing international
characters in URLs to be processed correctly by Tomcat, and it means less
Sakai-specific code for international character handling in JSF.

Please add URIEncoding="UTF-8" to tomcat/conf/server.xml like so:
<Connector
port="8080" maxThreads="150" minSpareThreads="25" maxSpareThreads="75"
enableLookups="false" redirectPort="8443" acceptCount="100"
debug="0" connectionTimeout="20000"
disableUploadTimeout="true"
URIEncoding="UTF-8"
column10: Missing URIEncoding="UTF-8" attribute from Connector element in Tomcat's server.xml for DEMO
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Peter - please assign for verification. Thanks. -Glenn

column107: Glenn, can you comment on Stephen Marquard's issue?
column111:
Comment from Glenn Golden.

This issue addresses configuration of a Sakai installation, not even in the Sakai side, but the tomcat / Apache side, and is likely not something we can do with the source code, since we make NO changes to the tomcat ROOT webapp.

I'm not sure how this is best done. One way that works very well is to use Apache rewrite rules. I've got this setup on one Sakai installation (MLE). Another is to put a index.html in the tomcat ROOT to redirect, but we can't distribute that way without messing with the tomcat ROOT. It has also been shown not to work reliably in certain configurations (i.e. MLE)

At best this is a documentation issue. Or we decide to mess with the demo's Tomcat 5.5.9 image more (we already change the server.xml for Sakai).
column115: Since we are already modifying server.xml, it does not seem like to far of a stretch to modify the ROOT webapp. Thanks, L

column1: [SAK-1236] "localhost" appears on the portal title on remote host
column6:
Incorrect host name "localhost" appears on the portal title when I am accessing a copy of Sakai running on a Solaris machine not my own laptop. The term "localhost" applies to the loopback IP address (127.0.0.1).

This will be embarrassing if released like this, although no functionality is impaired.
column10: "localhost" appears on the portal title on remote host
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: I believe the value for this string is read from sakai.properties (local.properties?). L
column90:
Looking at sakai.properties, I would say it's being read from:

1.5 --> ui.service
2.0 --> serverId
column95:
The original problem reported was just a mis-configuration - the "localhost" string was, as already commented, picked up from the configuration, and can be changed to reflect the proper DNS name by configuration.

BUT.. investigating this I found that the portal really was using the WRONG configuration string- the server DNS name, which is incorrect, instead of the string "ui.service". This defaults to "Sakai" and is set by the Sakai installer to the name they want to use for their service ("CTools" for U of M, for example).

SO, I've fixed this so the Portal picks up the proper configuration for the browser window titles.

svn r 398
column99: Fixed.

column1: [SAK-1235] Action menu disappears without Read permission in Resources
column6:
As a maintain user, I went into Resources and edited the permissions to take away my read permission. When I saved these permissions and returned to the main page in Resources, I got the error message "Alert: You do not have permission to view this folder." and the action menu was gone, so I couldn't go back and edit the permissions to restore my read permission.

I know that the error message is the correct behavior, but I found it a little frustrating to not be able to get back into permissions!
column10: Action menu disappears without Read permission in Resources
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
This may be an issue with the Permissions tool rather than the Resources tool, but mostly it's a non-issue because there is an admin-level fix if a user shoots herself in the foot.

In the Resources tool, we could try fixing this by establishing a new permission for setting permissions (content.permit). Then the permissions action link would be independent of other permissions. But the maintainer could still deny content.permit permission to maintainers. It's possible that the permissions helper could restrict maintainers from denying permission to content.permit permission, but that would require special semantics for the "maintainer" role that don't really exist now. When a tool grants permission for a user with a certain role to edit permissions for the tool, that user probably needs to have full power to change permissions in any way she chooses. It's hard to predict what situations might require that ability, so it's hard to tell whether a change like that would affect current uses.

In any event, it looks like the admin can edit the permissions for a site like this, either using the "permissions" action link in the tool itself or in the realm editor. So a user who did this could ask for help restoring functionality.
column90: There are a lot of things that can go wrong in Sakai that admin/support can ultimately fix. The main point is that from a usability perspective, we want to eliminate as many possibilities for the user to make errors that we can--particularly errors that they can't recover from.
column95: This has been fixed. Menu item for Permissions is detemined by ability to update site, rather than on permission to revise site's top-level folder.
column99: This issue was not verified in the formal QA process but is included in a production version of Sakai (2.1). If you find this is still a problem, please re-open.

column1: [SAK-1234] Worksite info can't accept URL of item in resources with spaces in filename
column6:
I uploaded an image to the Resources tool. The filename had spaces in it (for example, "too wide 1.jpg"). I then went to the Worksite Info frame in Home, and changed it to display the URL of the image in the Resources tool. I got a message in the frame saying:

"The requested resource: /content/group/6e317a54-3b7c-46c8-0043-4122ad274085/too%20wide%201.JPG
is not currently available.

"The resource was not found."

When I went to Resources, I was still able to open the picture.

It looks like maybe it is escaping the spaces and then can't figure out how to put them back in, maybe?
column10: Worksite info can't accept URL of item in resources with spaces in filename
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Assigning this to Glenn as it seems to be someting with how we are now processing URLs. I didn't think there were any changes to web content - and URLs with spaces (that were changed to %20) worked ok in 1.5. Now Web content cant take a URL to a file in Resources with an id with %20 in it.
column90:
URLs with a "%20" in them are somehow being rewritten to have an additional "%25"

so "too%20wide%201.jpg" becomes "too%25%20wide%25%201.jpg"

and the link fails.
column95:
Since "%25" is the encoding for the % symbol itself, it looks like the URL is getting double-encoded.

It seems a temporary workaround is to remove the original URL encoding from the the URL, so

/content/group/6e317a54-3b7c-46c8-0043-4122ad274085/too%20wide%201.JPG
becomes
/content/group/6e317a54-3b7c-46c8-0043-4122ad274085/too wide 1.JPG

Sakai will encode that (even though it shouldn't encode anything at this point) and the end result works. Until the bug is fixed, and then we'll all have to go back to the original, correct URLs.
column99: Will this be resolved for 2.1.0?
column103: Will this be resolved for 2.3.0?

On sakai 2.2.1 demo I don't seem to be able to reproduce this issue.
Entering a filename with spaces in it into the Workspce Info -> Site Info URL box results in the linked image being displayed correctly.

column1: [SAK-1230] Indentation Unclear in Refactored Resources
column6: In the refactored alignment tool, the indentation is not sufficient to indicate relative levels to the user. When a folder is open, the twiggle icon pushes it inward so that it becomes difficult to tell which level the folder occupies in the hierarchy, because the folder icon is actually aligned further right than its own subfolders. When a folder is closed, but has subfolders, it is somewhat more clear, but still not great.

column55:
I would much rather reconsider the whole issue of how to indicate hierarchy. Indentation - no matter how well implemented - may always be insuficient - to be really clear it will eat up the h whitespace, which is already in VERY short suply because of the lavish number of links associated with each item.

Do we have any leeway to think about this?
column90: Did best to fix indentation - was necessary to remove the twiggle

It may have been done with regret, but removing the twiggle also happens to remove a UI complaint we've been getting in our pilot. People didn't get the twiggle.
