column1: [SAK-1225] Verify Password Field Not Checked when Creating Account
column6:
The first problem is that the 'Verify New Password' field does not work. It does not compare the two passwords you enter for equality. If you enter two different passwords the system will use the one you entered in the 'Create New Password' field. You don't even need to type anything in the 'Verify New Password' field.

The second problem is the you don't even have to type any password to create an account. You only have to enter a 'User Id' and then you will be logged-in to the account. The problem is that when you do this you can't log in back to the account because you don't have a password (leaving the password field blank or using the User Id as the password doesn't work). This happens beacuse the password field is not a required one.

column6:

column55:
I agree, it's nasty. But we're stuck between a rock and a JSF place. This is one of the mismatches I mentioned in the BaseCamp entry on finalized formatting:

"Couldn't add padding right for the first two columns of Assignment Details without also adding it on the Points column: JSF limitation."

I tried centering the point values, but that looked far worse. One thing I haven't tried yet is to do a special CSS class for that last column, though, putting more left-hand padding in. Maybe I'll give that a shot while waiting for other distractions. It seems pretty unlikely that we'll have many scores that go over 999999.99.
column90: Based on the spec wireframe, I assumed this was meant to be a 100% wide table, in which case we don't have any control (in JSF) over the relative column widths. I've now changed the Overview page over to the narrowTable approach and added right-hand padding to the Avg and Points columns.

Question: Would it not be easier to right-justify the last two column headers (asked the clueless person)?
column103:
It would be helpful to attach a screenshot for these layout details. Otherwise it's hard to know whether we're seeing the same thing.

"Question: Would it not be easier to right-justify the last two column headers?"

Answer: It would indeed, except that JSF doesn't let us – it just lets us specify a CSS class for all headers. You or Ben might want to add a feature request for our JSF extensions to support that.
column107:
This problem is caused by the default skin's "tool.css", which includes the attribute "!important" in the following line:

td.rightpadded

{text-align:right; vertical-align:bottom; padding-right:4em !important;}

This makes it impossible for applications to define column-specific padding on listHier table cells. JSF makes it impossible for applications to define header-specific formatting. Between the two of them, we're completely stuck.

I've uploaded two screenshots to demonstrate. The first shows the application with the current default skin. In the second, the only change is that I removed "!important" from that line. As you can see, the columns align well.

I see two solutions, either of which requires changes to the default skin's CSS.

1) Take out the "!important" attribute.

2) Add explicit skin support for a "rightpadding" class and/or non-100%-wide tables. (If a new class is defined, the Gradebook might have to change to use it – no big deal, I think.)
column111: Reassigning since the fix depends on the default skin.
column115:
Finally getting around to this.

Not sure where this came from - cannot find it:

  • - - - - -
    td.rightpadded {text-align:right; vertical-align:bottom; padding-right:4em !important;}

  • - - - - -

Adding same padding-left as the "td" to the "th" of the "listHier" table seems to do fine. This way the "padding-right" of the "narrowTable" is not affected.

What issue was that padding-right addressing?

Because I do not understand Gradebook as well as I would like to I will wait to hear from you to see if this helps - at which point I eill include it in the tool_base.css

column1: [SAK-1210] Choice as to whether email attachments are included or not
column6:
The decision as to whether an email's attachments are included in a message sent by Sakai should be left up to the user, the site maintainer, and/or the type of attachment. Some types of attachements (e.g., digitally-signed emails) must be included in the message for security checks to work correctly. Some site maintainers or users may prefer that general attachments are sent as part of an email, rather than forcing users to retrieve the attachments from Sakai; this is particularly important for folks wokring off-line.

The rationale for not including attachments in email is to save on storage space and on email transmission. Having one copy stored on Sakai, as opposed to one copy in each recipients email account helps organizations keep storage costs down. It is also more efficient for mail servers to transmit an email with a link in it to multiple recipients than to send the whole attachment multiple times. For organizations that are truly concerned about these resource issues, they could make use of a sakai.properties setting to enable/disable the ability of individuals or site maintainers to modify attachement behavior.

It is also worth considering whether allowing individuals or site maintainers to change attachment behavior at their personal or site level of granularity will introduce more confusion. Folks might not understand why they get attachments from some sites but not others, or why they don't get attachments but their fellow collaborators in the same site do.
column10: Choice as to whether email attachments are included or not
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: [Bulk Comment] This issue was reported as affecting versions of Sakai that are no longer supported (1.0, 1.5.x or 2.0.x). It is likely that this issue has been taken care of by redesign or bug fixing since it was first reported, so the issue is being Closed; however, if you feel the issue is still relevant for more recent versions of Sakai (i.e., Sakai 2.3.1), then please re-open the issue and add the more recent version of Sakai to the list of Affects Versions. Thank you.
column90:
Original Description:

From Mike McPherson:
I would like to make two suggestions concerning the feature of Ctools
which strips attachments from email routed through a site.

First, digitally signed email in the S/MIME format (and others such as
PGP/MIME and OpenPGP, I believe) transmit the signed hash of the message
(the "signature") as a MIME attachment. When Ctools strips this
attachment and stores it in the email archive, the stripped message
forwarded to the site members is no longer signed. Since Ctools has no
ability to verify signatures itself (a feature it should eventually get,
by the way), the digital signature is effectively lost. I propose that
Ctools be modified to be selective about the attachments it strips.
Things like signatures and address cards should always be passed
unmolested, as stripping them may interfere with proper functioning of
clients on either end.

Second, more of a personal preference. I would love to be able to, as
site manager, be able to choose whether any messages have their
attachments stripped.
column95:
From SAK--9530 Trisha Gordon reports:

A member of our faculty has raised the following issue:

Collab [our pilot implementation of Sakai] email lists convert attachments into URLs rather than attaching to them.

This is very unexpected behavior for almost everyone I know. As a result people are constantly confused - they miss attachments, and they constantly resend the attachment and email to people manaully outside of the mailing list because of it.

I think it would be much preferable if the mailing lists had an option that allowed us to decide if we wanted the attachments converted. I think this is going to create a lot of problems when you go into broader use.

—
Have others reported concern about the handling of email attachments? Is there any chance this could be addressed in future releases of Sakai?
column99:
An additional use case that came up recently:

Actor: "Detached" users, i.e. users that have no or limited internet connectivity at the time they are reading email.
Goal: Read email and deal with attachments while offline.
Examples: Laptop users on airplanes. Dial-up users. Distant users where internet connectivity is spotty or expensive.

With classic attachments, they can still read email and deal with the attachments offline. With url-linked attachments, they will have to remember to go and download each attachment before going offline.
column103:
Use case from SAK-13632:

When users receive messages on heldhelds, such as Blackberrys sent from email archive, the attachments files are links instead of actual attachments. This makes opening the files difficult on handhelds, especially if the file is set to site only and the user has to login. I know there may not be a way around this, but any ideas?
column107: Apparently email appointments sent by Groupwise (and perhaps other email apps) have a small attachment called an "ics" file. This too is stripped by Sakai and prevents email clients from recognizing the email as an appointment that can be consumed by a calendar. Thus, calendaring is another reason to add an option that doesn't strip out attachments (or at least ics files) from emails.

column1: [SAK-1203] Assessment export does not work in Firefox
column6:
When you try to export an assessmnet in firefox, the download/save option has two problems:

1. The file's XML header is chopped
2. The XML tags are not saved

Export works fine in IE 6.0
column10: Assessment export does not work in Firefox
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
It appears that Firefox is removing the XML header, making the output a well formed XML fragment.
(I'm sending the header to the browser.)

That could be a potential problem in some non-Sakai tools that require an XML document.
In Sakai, however the file can be imported. (Note that in assessing relative priority.)

I am not sure what "XML tags are not saved" means. Sakai is able to parse the resultant document.
column90: Ok, when I add the xml extension it saves as an XML doc. That is not an option the download dialogue presents you with.
column95:
Oliver. I appreciate your thoroughness. This is simply not a major bug, however. Firefox gives you the option of saving as a text file.

So if you do a file save as in Firefox, just select save as text file and specify an xml extension. If you do not do this, Samigo will still be able to reimport the file.

I verified that I could do this. This is not a bug, as such.

I checked in a documentation file with this information.
$ cvs commit -m "documented how to save XML files in Firefox" README.import_export.txt
RCS file: /cvs/sakai2/sam/README.import_export.txt,v
done
Checking in README.import_export.txt;
/cvs/sakai2/sam/README.import_export.txt,v <-- README.import_export.txt
initial revision: 1.1
column99: Verify that explanation in README can be followed.
column103: Requested copy of readme.
column107:
This issue has supposedly still been resolved, but I cannot get this feature to work in Firefox. When I attempt to export an assessment, the page, which in IE would have the full XML code, says only:

XML Parsing Error: xml processing instruction not at start of external entity
Location: https://oncourse.iu.edu/samigo/jsf/qti/exportAssessment.faces
Line Number 2, Column 1:
<?xml version="1.0" ?>
^

Saving this file as a text file in .xml format does not work, as this is the full page. Is there any other workaround other using IE?

Vanessa Richards
vrichard@indiana.edu
UITS Knowledge Management
http://kb.iu.edu
column111:
Ok, this appears to be working in Sakai, but not in the implementation at Indiana University, Oncourse. I assume IU will update their version soon.

Sorry for any trouble!

Vanessa
column115:
Vanessa was using the install at IU. I tested this at MIT stable and the fix worked as reported above by Oliver. Guess it's something we will have to sort out here at IU.

Jonathan Bolte
bolte@indiana.edu
column139:
I see the same problem in our nightly build. Phooey. This issue was previously discussed and corrected in SAM-271; Firefox is putting a blank line at the top of the assessment so it doesn't parse correctly as xml, if I understand right.

I was able to use "view source" to see the xml, then save it and remove the blank line at the top. Then the file should import correctly.

Looking for more information as to why this bug has resurfaced now.
column187:
This is a known issue and documented in README.import_export.txt under ~/trunk/sakai/sam:

7. Fix for JSF corruption of XML export.
a. In some builds of the portal we are seeing the addition of one or more blank lines on export by JSF itself. The XML spcification does not allow this.

As of 2.01 have added a fix that any XML file with extra blank lines will have these trimmed on import so that exported files will always import.
b. If you wish to import Sakai exports into other systems, or validating XML editors, you may need to remove blank lines before the XML declaration.
( SAK-1499 Closed )
column191:
From Ed:

I made the following change to the readme, so that it is clearer.

-Users requiring an XML (.xml) extension in Firefox browsers should
+ a. In some cases, JSF prepends extra lines, see 7, below. When you export, you will see "XML Parsing Error: xml processing instruction is not at start of external entity." This can be safely ignored. If you want to see the XML, you can do so with "view source".

+ b.Users requiring an XML (.xml) extension in Firefox browsers should "Save as Type:" "Web Page, HTML only" and specify the ".xml" extension, explicitly typing the desired file name and extension. DO NOT save as "Text File", this will save only the text nodes of the XML document, and will cause errors on re-import.

-Note: Tests and Quizzes will accept files with any extension as long as they

+ c. Tests and Quizzes will accept files with any extension as long as they are in correct format for importation. ( SAK-1203 Closed )....

Still investigating it for 2.1.
column195: This was documented (see SAK-1203 Closed ) with workaround and user instructions for 2.0x, looking into this for 2.1.
column199: Work on this issue seems to have moved to SAK-1952 Closed , so I"m closing this as a duplicate.

column1: [SAK-1202] Have standalone Gradebook use Hypersonic DB by default
column6:
For unknown reasons, we have been directed to not mention MySQL as a dependency in the Gradebook Maven build, even though the driver is freely available from iBiblio and we're not bundling it in any of our packages. As a result, we're now commenting that section out of "tool/project.xml", which keeps the out-of-the-box " maven -Dstandalone=true" goals from working.

To fix this and to fit better with the rest of Sakai, we should change our default DB for standalone testing to Hypersonic.
column10: Have standalone Gradebook use Hypersonic DB by default

column1: [SAK-1199] Created By field is ambiguous and in contention with Creator
column6: When a user adds a folder or file to Resources, the field Created By is automatically filled in with the identity of that user. Created By is a somewhat semantically imprecise field. What about uploaded files that have been created by someone other than the user adding the file? The introduction of the DC Creator field under optional properties simultaneously highlights this ambiguity and frees the Created By field to serve a more specific purpose, namely to identify clearly who has added the file or folder. Change "Created By" to "Added By"?
column10: Created By field is ambiguous and in contention with Creator
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Some other possible names were discussed for this attribute. "Added By" might be a good choice, but for now the decision was made to stick with "Created By". That refers to the person who created this instance of this resource, as in uploading a file, composing an HTML page in the WYSIWYG editor, etc. The "Other Properties" section provides some Dublin Core tags. "Creator" is the standard label for a DC tag that is more akin to "author" or "publisher", rather than "uploader".
column90: We've run into this issue lately, where an admin either imported content from elsewhere, or otherwise copied the site. Certain professors were not pleased to find that their students would read that a support staff person was listed as the "Creator" for their course materials.
column95: This issue ( SAK-6153 Closed ) is a possible solution/workaround to SAK-1199 Closed .

column1: [SAK-35349] Samigo redirects to "access denied" when it should redirect to login
column6:
The Samigo Login servlet needs its logic re-examined.

Its sending the user to "access denied" when it should redirect them to login.

I'm not exactly sure what is correct here, but something is missing in the code.

At the end of the function, the code sets the redirect path to login, but then sets it to access denied.

The offending code is in LoginServlet.doPost(). Here is the important section:

          boolean isMember = false;
          boolean isAuthenticatedAsAnonymous = false;
          if (isAuthenticated) {
            isMember = checkMembership(pub, req, res);
          }
          else if (anonymousAllowed) {
            AgentFacade.createAnonymous();
            isAuthenticatedAsAnonymous = true;
            delivery.setAnonymousLogin(true);
          }
   
          if ((authenticatedAllowed && isAuthenticated)
              || (isMember && isAuthenticated) || isAuthenticatedAsAnonymous) {
            BeginDeliveryActionListener listener = new
                BeginDeliveryActionListener();
            listener.processAction(null);
            path = "/jsf/delivery/beginTakingAssessment_viaurl.faces";
          }
          else {
	      if (AgentFacade.isStandaloneEnvironment())
                path = "/jsf/delivery/login.faces";
              else{
                relativePath = false;
                path = "/authn/login?url=" + URLEncoder.encode(req.getRequestURL().toString()+"?id="+alias, "UTF-8");
	      }
          }

          // if none of the 3 situation is met => access denied
          if (!authenticatedAllowed && !anonymousAllowed && !isMember){
            path = "/jsf/delivery/accessDenied.faces";
	  }
column10: Samigo redirects to "access denied" when it should redirect to login
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

column90:
my comment is stopped assigning me more bugs. I have got 20 on my plates.

if ((authenticatedAllowed && isAuthenticated)

(isMember && isAuthenticated) isAuthenticatedAsAnonymous) { BeginDeliveryActionListener listener = new BeginDeliveryActionListener(); listener.processAction(null); path = "/jsf/delivery/beginTakingAssessment_viaurl.faces"; }

else if (!isAuthenticated && !isAuthenticatedAsAnonymous)

Unknown macro: { if (AgentFacade.isStandaloneEnvironment()) path = "/jsf/delivery/login.faces"; else{ relativePath = false; path = "/authn/login?url=" + URLEncoder.encode(req.getRequestURL().toString()+"?id="+alias, "\ UTF-8"); } }

else if (isAuthenticated && !isMember)

{ path = "/jsf/delivery/accessDenied.faces"; }
else if (isAuthenticated && !authenticatedAllowed){ path = "/jsf/delivery/accessDenied.faces"; }

}
}
}

Friday, 06-03-2005: Follow-up; here's what I do:

1. Logged on to site: http://sakai-stable.mit.edu:8030/portal
2. Clicked on "Schedule"
3. Clicked on "New Event"
4. It is now 4:24 pm. I created a new event for this evening at 8:00 pm
5. Changed event type to "Meeting" but left frequency as occurring one time.
6. Clicked "Save Event"
7. Tried to find the event on the calendar: it's not there.

Saturday 06-04-2005; tried again, same results, i.e., nothing.

column95:

column1: [SAK-1185] Precompile Gradebook JSPs
column6: Complex JSP pages (such as the Gradebook JSF layer) take a while for Tomcat to compile on the fly. column1: [SAK-1178] Export/Import of Resources does not get all files

Any ideas?

column1: [SAK-1176] Assigment with Grades:  VelocityServlet error
column6:
On machine1
1. Logged in as admin
2. Accessed the 'NB - Project 1' worksite
3. Created an assignment

On machine2
4. Logged in as flmover1
5. Took the assignment

On machine1
6. Tried to grade the assignment

NB: I have 2 'Assignment' tools, one with grade and the other without. Admin used the assignement with grade to create the assignment, but the created assignment shows up in both tools.

7. Unable to grade the assignement because there was no HTML link associated with the student's name. I could not even see what the student submitted.

8. Used the 'Assignment' (without grade) tool and at least was able to see the information that the student submitted.

I played with both these 'Assignment' tools for a long time, trying to figure out how the assignement with grades is supposed to work. I ran into a few unusual behaviours.

a. When only one student has submitted an assignment and, in the 'assgn with grades' version, you select "Download Spreadsheet" then you get a zip file whose content is a text file that contains the answer submitted by the student.

b. If you have two student submissions, then clicking "Download Spreadsheet" download an Excel spreadsheet the names of all the members of the site along with a grades column (which in my case all the grades are 0).

Anyway, that aside, eventually, after much playing around, the student names suddenly were links (in the assignment with grades tool). I selected a student and, WHOOOOHOOO, was able to see the information that was submitted by the student. HOWEVER, when I scolled to the bottom of the page, in the "Attachments to Return with Grade" section, below the input box for "Grade," there is a
VelocityServlet: Error processing the template
error, with all the associated code for servlet errors

ISSUE:
Oops!

QUESTION:
When a assignment is created using the 'Assignment' with grades tool, should an entry automatically be created in Gradebook? If so, there's a problem.
OR
Do I need to 'Add Assignment' to Gradebook before trying to grade an assignment?

What's the procedure?

          flmover1 - student (WinXP, IE)
column10: Assigment with Grades:  VelocityServlet error
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
Nadine,

It sounds like you've added both versions of the Assignments tool to a single worksite. That sounds like an edge-case that most users should never encounter; when someone installs Sakai, they should really choose just one Assignments tool to use, but that's not gaurenteed, just recommended.

Also, Assignments and Gradebook do not communicate with one another. If you need that combination of features, then you need to go with Test & Quizzes and Gradebook.

So, the velocity error should be addressed, but it won't be a high-priority for post-2.0 work.

column1: [SAK-1167] Update "Features" tool on Gateway page (i.e. /portal)
column6:
Could we get the Gateway Features "tool" spruced up for the public release? For someone evaluating Sakai for the first time, the contents of this page could be critical. Thanks!
L

Features

Sakai offers a variety of features for use in course and project sites, including:

Worksite Setup – for viewing your list of Sakai sites and creating new sites
Schedule – for posting and viewing deadlines, events, etc.
Announcements – for posting current, time-critical information
Resources – for posting documents and URLs
Discussion – for structured conversations in written form
Chat – for real-time conversations in written form
News – for viewing content from online sources
Assignments – for posting and submitting online assignments, and online grading
Drop Box – for private file-sharing between instructors and students
Email Archive – for viewing email sent to the site\'s group email address
Web Content – for accessing an external website from within this site

column1: [SAK-1165] Default Template and Assessment "Released to" settings should be changed.
column6:
Default Template and Assessment "Released to" settings should be changed.

Currently the Default template has "released to" editing switched off. It should be checked by default for both user types. In parallel, the assessment "released to" settings should not have "Authorized Users" checked by default because this publishes an assessment to users beyond the immediate course context, which is a very big problem. Ideally, the context in which a template is being created should dictate what is checked by default.

column1: [SAK-1164] Style Guide wireframe includes HTML which can't be generated from our JSF tags
column6:
Many pages have to display bundles of properties. The Style Guide shows these in rows, with the property name bolded in the first column and the property value (or input field) in the second column. The "item-summary.html" HiFi Wireframe manages this with a table where the first column has <th> tags and the second column has <td> tags. However, there is no way to make the current JSF components generate <th> tags anywhere after the first row. It's a missing feature of JSF 1.1. It might be possible to write a JSF extension to take care of it, but the easiest approach would be to specify two column CSS classes, one for the item description and one for the item value.

As a side-note, for properties tables that are editable, the current HiFi Wireframes don't use tables at all:

<div class="shorttext indnt1">
<label for="shorttext1">Label for short text *</label>
<input name="name" type="text" id="shorttext1" size="30" />
</div>
column10: Style Guide wireframe includes HTML which can't be generated from our JSF tags
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
I'd like to keep this in the style guide. There may be no way to do it with current JSF tags, but it ought to be possible to create new JSF tag that creates a table That has a 1 <th> and 1 <td> in each row, then feed metadata into those pairs.

Id say this is a tag that is yet to be developed, rather than a styleguide bug.

column1: [SAK-1162] JSF tag sakaix:pager producing non-Style-Guide-compliant HTML
column6:
The "sakaix:pager" tag is still generating a <span class="instruction"> and <br/> tag for the navigation context line.

<sakaix:pager id="pager" totalItems="#

{bean.dataRows}

" firstItem="#

{bean.firstRow}

" pageSize="#

{bean.maxDisplayedRows}

" textStatus="#

{msgs.paging_status_students}

" />

Turns into:

<span class="nav"><span class="instruction">Viewing 1 to 0 of 0 students</span><br />
<input type="submit" name="gbForm:pager_first" value="|<" disabled="disabled"/>
<input type="submit" name="gbForm:pager_prev" value="<" disabled="disabled"/>
<select name="gbForm:pager_pageSize" id="gbForm:pager_pageSize" onchange="javascript:this.form.submit(); return false;">
<option value="5">Show 5</option>
<option value="10">Show 10</option>
<option selected="selected" value="20">Show 20</option>
<option value="50">Show 50</option>
<option value="100">Show 100</option>
<option value="0">Show all</option>
</select>
<input type="submit" name="gbForm:pager_next" value=">" disabled="disabled"/>
<input type="submit" name="gbForm:pager_last" value=">|" disabled="disabled"/>
<input type="hidden" name="gbForm:pager_pastItem" value="0"/></span>

This makes it impossible to control the formatting of the informational (not instructional) message or to control the vertical space between the mesage and the select dropdown. As you can see from the attached screenshot, the spacing currently looks wildly off. (Compare Ben Brophy's graphic for the Gradebook specification, in CVS at "sakai2/gradebook/xdocs/specs/2.gif".)

In "scratch/styleguide/example/list-action.html", the relevant section looks like:

<div class="listNav">Viewing 1 - 10 of XXX items<br>
<input name="Submit" value="|<" type="submit">
<input name="Submit" value="<" type="submit">
<select name="select2"><option selected="selected">Show 10</option></select>
<input name="Submit" value=">" type="submit">
<input name="Submit" value=">|" type="submit">
</div>

This doesn't give the customer as much control as putting the context message in its own <div class="listViewing"> tag would, but it's still better than what's currently being produced.

column1: [SAK-1159] Adding Announcements/MOTD - blank announcements allowed
column6:
The Announcement title and the Body of the announcement are red-starred which means that they are required. If you include the Subject and Include a Body , but erase the Body entirely and post, a Blank announcement is posted. Note that you must type in the WYSIWYG editor (body) and then erase entirely to by-pass the Alert that warns that "you must fill in the body of the announcement!". This also affects the MOTD tool.

OS: Win XP
Browser: IE. 6.0.2900

OS: Mac OS X
Browser: Safari 1.3
column10: Adding Announcements/MOTD - blank announcements allowed
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: It will take some interesting logic to figure out that the HTML area is indeed "blank".
column90:
It is an interesting finding. This is what I found through debugging:

By erasing the ebody content, the tool is getting
"<br />\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t" from the user interface.

But if leaving the body area blank at the beginning, the tool is getting
"\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t".

An extra link break <br /> is added by WYSISYG editor through the erasing action, which causes the tool to fail.
column95: Code handling this special case has been added. The extra link breaks and control characters, which were added by the browsers, got cleaned out from the user input. The fix was check in, after being tested against multiple browers on OSX - Safari, NS, Firefox and IE.
column99:
Reopened issue - This issue was fixed only for the announcement tool. However, it affects all legacy tools that use the WYSIWYG. So it should really be fixed for all legacy tools.

Reopening it so I can fix it for all tools.
column103: Fixed for all legacy tools in HEAD as r442. Original fix (just for the announcement tool) was r421.
column107: I am still experiencing this problem - verified on Nightly2 and IU's latest build from head.
column111: Kristol, please provide the info of your OS and browser. Thanks.
column115: I won't comment on this one - see if you can figure it out (-;. Not a serious bug though in my opinion.
column139: Both of these issues have to do with spurious whitespace. The whitespace is caused by various things - JSF, Velocity, etc. The solution I'd recommend is to check (on server-side submit) whether the text is really just whitespace (including <br /> as whitespace), and if so, treat it as "". Zhen, look for the class FormattedText and the method processFormattedTextFromBrowser - that is the right place to do this whitespace-cleaning once-and-for-all.
column187: non-issue

column1: [SAK-1155] Safari 1.3 does not preserve line breaks when announcement is previewed/posted
column6:
Safari 1.3 does not preserve line breaks when announcement is previewed/posted

OS: Mac OS X
Browser: Safari 1.3
column10: Safari 1.3 does not preserve line breaks when announcement is previewed/posted
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
Safari is not supporting WYWIWIG editor, so the line breaks in Safari text area is handled in a different way other than other browsers. E.g., we got "/r/n" from Safari, but "<br />/n" from a few other browsers like Firefox and NS.
One solution is to add some extra code, just for Safari to translate the link breaks into the right format. This solution has weakness. If the user input contains "/r/n" string, that will be also replaced by link break tag. A fix to that is, we may give users a option to choose if replacing all the "/r/n" string or not. If not, it means Safari's no-line-break behavior has to be accepted.

Now we can't do anything to browser Safari. Jon thinks this might or might not be resolveable when multiple WYSIWIG editors were introduced into Sakai.

Currently nothing sounds like a perfect solution to me. I am open to any suggestions.

column103:
SVN 2656

the textarea is really a "editable" html>body inside of an iframe created by the js with no styling info. column1: [SAK-35257] Submitting assessment for grading screws up delivery
column6:
http://aam-dev.stanford.edu:22080/samigo/jsf/delivery/tableOfContents.faces

Lydia and Qingru found this one.

When you take an assessment that's all on one page as a student and submit it for grading, the next person who takes the assessment (any user) will see the problem that their answers aren't being saved. If they go to the TOC, or the assessment, their answers will be lost.

When you take an assessment as a student and don't submit it (if you choose Save and Exit instead), the next person to take the assessment has no problems.

Closing the browser session and starting a new one doesn't make any difference to the result.

So the bug is something about submit for grading in assessments that are all on one page. I tried it in an assessment that's one part per page, and didn't see the problem.

Qingru, Lydia asked for this to be assigned to you because you know the most about delivery. Aren't you lucky?

column1: [SAK-1136] Samigo doesn't warn the user when an assessment fails to be inserted to the gradebook
column6:
1. Create an assignment in the gradebook named "Foo"
2. Create an assessment in Tests & Quizzes named "Foo". Ensure that this assessment is built on a template set to export assessments to the gradebook.
3. Publish the assessment

In the logs, you will see the ConflictingAssignmentNameException that the gradebook service throws, but there is no indication in the UI that the assessment failed to be entered into the gradebook. Because there is no way to "re-publish" an assessment, this assessment, along with any of its scores, will never be added to the gradebook.

column1: [SAK-35311] Matching question choices not randomized
column6:
http://aam-dev.stanford.edu:22080/samigo/jsf/delivery/deliverAssessment.faces

They used to be, and now they're not!

Steps to reproduce:

1) Create a matching question with several pairs (I use 5).

2) Add that question to an assesssment.

3) Preview the assessment - notice the order of the choices and matches.

4) Publish the assessment and take it as a student. The choices and matches are in the same order they were for the preview.

5) Take the assessment as a different student. Still the same order.

6) Create a second assessment using the same question, and repeat steps 3-5. Still the same order every time.

The order should be randomized each time someone takes or previews an assessment.

Example assessment on aam-dev: 6.1 matching test

  • Previewed assessment and noted order
  • Took assessment student 1: order was different
  • Took assessment as student 2: order was different to both previous orders

Please close this issue.

column1: [SAK-1127] The 'Title' field is a required one, but you can add an item without a title
column6: You can add an item, either a 'file upload' or a 'URL' , and not specify a title. The Title field should be a 'required' field and get a warning when one is not entered. When doing a 'file upload' the title field should be populated automatically with the name of the file, it is not doing it. When you leave the Title field blank the title becomes the name of the file when doing a file upload, and the entire URL when adding a URL.
column10: The 'Title' field is a required one, but you can add an item without a title
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: I'd really like some text explaining the title field is an alternate to the document name (or Id). When the user goes to access the doc in webdav, it'll appear under a different name and that can be very confusing for users
column90: Daphne, can you specify how you would like the Title Field to be handled? Specifically, if it is a marked as a required field, then you should pop-up warning; however, since it is not required when you are doing a file-upload – it should be possible to leave it blank – then perhaps it should not have the required * next to it? (The rest of the comments would make good feature requests.)
column95:
Hi Jim,

See previous comments. The title field should be required and give the user an alert if it is blank. Additionally, the field should be autopopulated with the document or URL. It would be great from a usability stand point to have this happen real-time so the user knows it will get this title by default.

So, the only way they would end up with an alert is if they blank out the title field.

Thanks!
column99:
As I see it, here are the options:

1) Title field marked with asterisk. If user submits without filling in
title, the form comes back with error message and highlights title field.
See nightly2. This is how it works for HTML and Text documents.

2) Title is marked with asterisk. If user submites without title, form comes
back with error message and highlighting, but URL or short version of filename
is provided as default.

3) Title is marked with asterisk. Upon completion of file selection or URL fill-in,
if title is empty, the URL or long version of filename (including the complete
file path) is filled in as default. It would be hard to parse out just the
short filename in javascript.

What is the desired behavior?
column103: Fixed by r419
column107:
Currently, the 'Title' field does have an asterick, but with file upload and URL entries, the 'Title' field is NOT populated and no error message is generated. Automatically, the title of an uploaded file is the filename of the uploaded file, and the title of a URL is the URL.

This is not consistent with the above comments.
column111:
On nightly2, the title field is being seeded with the full pathname of the file when uploading a file - that is going to cause complaints. It is a change from how it works now, where just the filename itself is used and results in ungainly resource listings.

The original concern was that the field was marked as required, but it seemed like you didn't have to put anything in. Seemed like because something was put in automatically (the filename, not the pathname) if you left it blank. If you typed something in then that was used. So the fix would have been to just seed the field with the file name (not the path) so that something was in there when they went to the post button, and if the user wanted to override the 'default' they could type something else in.
column115: Rev 1137 provides a better seed value for filepaths using '/' as a delimiter. If we the file-input element returns filepaths with other delimiters, we could do the same for those, provided there's a good way to tell what the delimiter is in javascript. It would be helpful if someone could provide a list of the delimiters actually returned on different operating systems.
column139:
Seed the title field with the file title, not 'the/path/to the/file/title
The title field becomes required.
If the user wants some other title, they replace the seeded value.
column187: As explained in an earlier comment, rev 1137 parses out the filename for systems that use '/' as the filepath delimiter. This will probably fail if used on a system that uses a different filepath delimiter. If anyone knows of other delimiters that should be considered, please reopen this ticket with additional information
column191: I just added a comment to SAK-1521 Closed which is related to this issue. To us, the problem is that Sakai records and displays the full path on a user's filesystem regardless of what they place in the title field, causing security and url-length concerns.
column195: A solution to this problem has been checked in at head of sakai. It may not be the complete solution discussed here. But for systems that use '/' as the path separator, it uses the filename instead of the full path as the seed value for the title. If a title is already filled in when the file is chosen, it makes no change. If a system uses a path separator other than '/', it probably still uses the full path. If anyone has information about other possible path separators, we can work out a refinement to deal with them.
column199: This has been fixed, but that change has not been used in CTools.
column203: verified on Sakai 2.1.0.006 MySQL, though Megan's request for a title has not been added.
column207: This issue was not verified in the formal QA process but is included in a production version of Sakai (2.1). If you find this is still a problem, please re-open.

column95:
This is very browser-specific. I just tested against it in Safari, IE, Netscape and Firefox on OSX. Safari and IE showed extra whitespaces, while Netscape and Firefox didn't. The good thing is the whitespaces would get trimmed when the body is saved.
I will come up with a solution, if there is one.
column99:
Joanne found that this had to do with the wysiwyg.
The problem happens when the textarea is used instead of the RichText editor when the browers are not supporting the Richtext editor.
column103: Both of these issues have to do with spurious whitespace. The whitespace is caused by various things - JSF, Velocity, etc. The solution I'd recommend is to check (on server-side submit) whether the text is really just whitespace (including <br /> as whitespace), and if so, treat it as "". Zhen, look for the class FormattedText and the method processFormattedTextFromBrowser - that is the right place to do this whitespace-cleaning once-and-for-all.

column139:
Lance,

This bug was 'unconvered' by the transactions-handling change in Samigo. In some sense, the transactions-handling change caused the bug. Of course, autoCommit=true may have been 'hiding' this bug.

When I revert back to autoCommit=true, the bug disappears. So the triage option is to revert back to autoCommit=true. The other is to figure out what is going on in more detail.

I don't know if I can debug this quickly beyond that; the exception is deep in Hibernate code, and I don't know what the 'right' thing to do is. It looks like maybe an object is being cloned, changed, and re-saved without changing the primary key to a new value or something - but that is a guess, I'm really not confident on what is really going wrong.
column187: Fix has been committed to CVS and unit tested locally. We need QA to verify this against the next stable release. Thanks, L
column191:
This might be useful for a less hackish fix.
http://forum.springframework.org/viewtopic.php?p=6746&sid=1fe7a312d4ff1103e140bd115f2f0953

You already have an object with the same id, but different instance, associated in current session. It might be an association of your Stock object or association of association, ...

Debug your Stock and all its mapped associations, and so on ...
column195:
This sounds like the same sort of bug as SAK-1114 Closed - Having to do with Hibernate and saving assessments.

Lance, maybe you could check whether your fix fixed this too, or maybe a similar fix will do it.

column1: [SAK-1110] Printable Version of schedule is insecure
column6:
For a site, I went into schedule and created a printable version of the calendar, which opened a new window displaying the PDF file and the following URL:

http://sakai-stable.mit.edu:2003/access/PrintFileGeneration?scheduleType=3&calendar0=/calendar/calendar/7a80e6e3-9dbf-4282-00ba-bcba1839ff7b/main&timeRange=20050501040000000-20050605030000000&user=Michael%20Beasley&dailyStartTime=20050531120000000-20050531220000000

I was then able to open a different browser and paste in this URL, and was able to generate the PDF. I then changed the URL to display a different month, and then entered that URL. I was able to pull up a calendar of a different month from my site. I then tried to replace the site id with the site id from another site, and was able to pull up a schedule from that site as well.
column10: Printable Version of schedule is insecure
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Is major the appropriate priority for this?
column90: Interested in Tool Teem thoughts on Privacy for Sakai,
column95: If a user is able to open a schedule via the URL for which they do not have permission, then yes I would say this is a major issue.
column99: keywords: security issue
column103: Test appropriately, not an admin and two browsers.
column107: Kristoll just tested this for me and there does not seem to be a critical security issue. While there is a PDF displayed, it does NOT include any schedule items (content) from the requested schedule. Chuck might still feel like we should be displaying an error instead of an empty PDF. Chuck? Thanks, L
column111: Chuck, please see my previous comments. Change the priority as appropriate and assign for a fix. Thanks, L
column115: Good news... yeah, it looks like if you go into a site and create a printable version of the schedule, you can then just open up another browser and reconstruct the URL and retrieve that schedule again. If a user hasn't already clicked the "Create Printable Schedule" link, then it does just create a blank schedule.
column139:
I've flagged this as a security issue.

column115: The Dublin Core properties were relabeled "Optional Properties". The meaning of my earlier comment was that optional properties got dropped from the rush-job refactoring done for 2.0.0. It was added back in by r285 and r288, in time for 2.0.1. I think the default setting in 2.0.1 is that "optional properties" are not shown in the resources tool. It is possible to go into the site editor and change that so the optional properties are shown. In that case, the optional properties twiggle appears in both contexts, "create" and "edit". Yes, this can be closed.
column139:

column1: [SAK-1081] Removing the 'admin' user's account
column6: The 'admin' user account should not be one that can be deleted.
column10: Removing the 'admin' user's account
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: why not?
column90:
Because 'admin' is the only user who can manage the users of the system, the permissions granted to each user of each tool, and manage all worksites. If you want the admin user account to be one that can be deleted, at least ensure that some other user in the system had admin priviledges before allowing the deletion. The admin user is the only one that can create another user with something other than REGISTERED type.

If there is no admin account and no user with admin priviledge, there'd be no way to add new roles to a worksite or change the permissions granted for users' access to a tool.

Right now on the 2003 site, using the "New Account" tool, I deleted the OOTB admin user and I've created a new admin user account. However, this user has a 'registered' user type, even though it has access to admin's MyWorkspace. If this user did not exist, the site would still work, but control would be limited.
column95:
If there is no way to recover from deleting the admin user, such as manually creating a new admin or equivilant account, then its deletion should not be allowed for now. We do not want people crippling their deployments irrepairably.

Eventually, it should be be possible to delete the admin account (or change its username) and use another one in its place. This is a common security practice, so that hackers cannot necessarily start with a known username and just guess the password; for instance, many locations remove the default Windows administrator account and create their own.
column99: Prevent deletion of admin account for now.
column103: It is possible to assign other users with admin capabilities, and if deleted, the admin user account can be manually (back end db) re-created. We will not be doing anything on this feature request for 2.0. We may in the future revisit this.
column107: There has been no further interest expressed in this issue and it has not been raised as an issue in recent releases of Sakai, so closing it as incomplete. Please feel free to re-open if you are interested in working on the issue.

column1:
[SAK-35213] Export question from qpool can't handle
in question text
column6:
http://aam-dev.stanford.edu:22080/samigo/jsf/questionpool/editPool.faces

Users will want to put line breaks in question text for at least FIB and short answer questions, so export question and export assessment should be able to handle them.

Here's the question text I used for a FIB question:

When the dark is rising, six shall turn it

{back}

, <br>
Three from the

{circle}

, three from the

{track}

.

And here's the error I got when I tried to export the question:

XML Parsing Error: mismatched tag. Expected: </br>.
Location: http://aam-dev.stanford.edu:17080/portal/tool/674b3350-e434-43d4-00e0-8ba22ad86bb7/jsf/questionpool/editPool
Line Number 55, Column 17:

Three from the</mattext>
----------------^
column10:
Export question from qpool can't handle
in question text
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Can you take a look at this ?
column90:
"<br>" is not well-formed XHTML. Only well-formed XHTML is allowed.

In previous versions of wysiwyg, it seemed to convert junk HTML to XHTML.

I think that we need to have toggle source disabled.

Is that an acceptable solution?
column95:
Ooops.

I reread the bug.

A FIB question DOES NOT use wysiwyg.

We may have to add an HTML tidy library to Sakai.
column99: Still a problem, as you pointed out Users need some way to put in line breaks when not using the wysiwyg.
column103:
I am adding a simple JavaScript to tidy simple HTML code, so in most cases you will not break export.
If you really work at it (unquoted attributes grabled tags etc.) you can still break it.

However this will normalize hr and br tags, convert to lower case, fix img tags, and remove extra spaces, and empty tag endtag pairs like <i></i>.
column107: The file in correction.txt shows the original and auto-corrected question text. The file TellALittleFib.xml is the corresponding export.
column111:
I also tested that I could paste in Lydia's question and it automatically corrected just by pressing the submit button, and that it would export properly.

I tested using assessment export, but the problem of exporting FIB questions with bad XHTML was a general one that works the same way in QP export question.
column115:
OK, don't get too creative with making horrible HTML just to see if it breaks it.

The intention of the modifications to FIB is not to create a full text HTML editor but to throw in a couple of simple tags. It now translates the naive HTML "<br>" to the well-formed XHTML "<br />" as required.
column139:
Fixed! No more errors when I export a FIB question with line breaks, and the editor changes the <br> tags to <br /> as I create the question.

There's still a problem with exporting/importing fib questions, but it belongs in the other import/export bug.

column1: [SAK-35610] Submission Status page doesn't match spec
column6:
http://aam-dev.stanford.edu:22080/samigo/jsf/evaluation/submissionStatus.faces

See the attached image for a screenshot of how the submission status page looks now. How does it not match the mockup? Let me count the ways:

1) The browser title bar says "Total Scores" - should say "Submission Status".

2) The page header says "Total Scores" - should say "Submission Status".

3) The mockup does not have a "Last Submission/All Submissions" menu picker. Should it? (This will get its own bug, as it's a Marc question.)

4) The columns in the list of submissions need to be more widely spaced.

5) The Date column should also include the time of submission.

6) The "Name UserID Role Date" header row needs a color bar like the one in the spec.

7) The pager needs to be implemented (separate issue, presumably)

It also fails to work. I would suggest that the field be validated and the user get an error when they try to commit the changes, rather than accepting bad characters.

column95:
Adding in my e-mail message about a possible fix for posterity

-----------------------------

From: Seth Theriault <slt@columbia.edu>
To: sakai-dev <sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org>
Subject: Possible fix for mangled subject lines
Date: Thu, 21 Jul 2005 18:19:12 -0400 (EDT)

Hi everyone,

On the subject of JIRA issue:

[Removed - you are here already]

I came across some recent James patches submitted at:

http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/JAMES-356

To my untrained Java eyes, it fixes getSubject by gluing lines broken
into 77-character blocks back together. SakaiMailet is using
getSubject at:

189 Date sent = msg.getSentDate();
190
191 String subject = StringUtil.trimToNull(msg.getSubject());
192 if (subject == null) subject = "<no subject>";

[...]

697 String innerSubject = innerMsg.getSubject().trim();
698 if (innerSubject.equals(""))
699

{ 700 innerSubject = "<no subject>"; 701 }

Now the James JIRA item wants you to patch MimeMessageWrapper, but
couldn't we just take the new function and use in the SakaiMailet?

Seth

column1: [SAK-1062] No way to differentiate semesters in tab customization
column6: When customizing tabs in the Preferences tool, there is no way to tell which semester a course site belongs to. If an instructor teaches the same course in multiple years, he or she might end up with a number of sites with identical names, and wouldn't be able to tell which is which in the tool.
column10: No way to differentiate semesters in tab customization
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: Yes, this was talked about as the next 'phase' (post 2.0) for this feature - organize the left list by semester (for course sites), with projects in their own grouping.
column90: [Bulk Comment] This issue is reported as affecting Sakai 1.0, 1.5, 2.0, 2.1, and/or 2.2; however, it is not reported as affecting a currently supported version of Sakai (2.3 or 2.4). If this issue is indeed still a concern for a supported version of Sakai, please do re-open the issue and add the appropriate 2.3 and/or 2.4 version to the Affects Version field. (Please do not remove existing Affects Versions when adding the new Affects Versions.)

column1: [SAK-1059] Need to change JSP/CSS for new embedded iframe look
column6:
Changes have been made to the look of the embedded iframes in the portal. The Gradebook JSPs and embedded CSS should change to deal with it after we get assurance that it's settled down.

My current guess at the most straightforward approach is to make the embedded CSS "body" margins 0px, and to surround all page content below the application navigation bar by a 2em-margined "div".

column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

column90: No, it's not a blocker. Also, I've made the changes to fix it – sorry for not checking it off!

column1: [SAK-1058] Need properties setting for Resources metadata
column6: Users need to be able to configure the display of (optional) metadata by adding entries to a properties file. For now, it will be enough to be able to turn it on or off, system-wide.
column10: Need properties setting for Resources metadata
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: This is fixed. The "optional_properties" value is set to "true" by default. The sys admin for a particular instance of Sakai could set the default to "false". Each time the Resources tool is added to a site, the "optional_properties" value can be set to "true" or "false", at the discretion of the site maintainer.
column90: Fixed by Jim Eng
column95: I didn't see that changing the optional_properties value to false hid the optional properties in the edit page when editing a resource file.
column99:
When I change the value of optional_properties to false, log out and log in, the optional properties twiggle no longer appears. Whether to display the optional properties is determined in the initState method based on the value of that properties setting at the time the initState method is executed. The initState method may be called only once in a user's session, when the user first uses the Resources tool in a site. If the property's value is changed while the user is already using the Resources tool, it's likely the optional properties setting will remain the same throughout that session.

Could you give more info about the circumstances under which you observed this problem?
column103: Ok - after logging in and out it seems to work ok.

column1: [SAK-1057] NA: New Account Runtime Error
column6:

Error: Expected ')'"

I haven't been able to find the error in catalina.out using a variety of search strings.

See attached from Sreya Rakshit. The following was also provided by Sreya after she demonstrated the error to me. She was able to reproduce it repeatedly. However, it does not occur for me using IE 6.0.2900.2180.xpsp_sp2_gdr.050301-1519. (Full version shown as it may be related to IE sp version.)

Regards,
Sreya.

column1: [SAK-1055] Inconsistent use of HTML tags
column6:
When creating a new topic, I entered the title of the topic and enclosed it in emphasis tags. When I added attachments, the attachments widget displayed the title of the topic using the tags. However, when I posted the topic, it displayed in the discussion tool without parsing the tags.

When displaying the topic in the main discussion view, in one place it does parse the tags, and in another it does not. I have attached a screenshot showing this.
column10: Inconsistent use of HTML tags
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
This is still an issue for Sakai 2.0rc3 on stable:8030 (MySQL)

Reopening item.
column90: The tags work on the "Recent Discussion Items" tool but they don't work in the actual "Discussion" tool.
column95:
Process: created a new discussion category and topic; added emphasis tag to the title as well as two words in the message body
Result: Emphasis tag in title showed as bold in the unexpanded row and column view as well as the printer friendly view. However, the actual tag was visible. Emphasis in title was not visible in the expanded (where you have the option to reply) view; actual tagging was visible. In the message body, the emphasis tag was interpreted as italics rather than the bold (as seen in the title), but the actual tagging was not visible. Message body emphasis showed in italics in a reply in the expanded view.

Emphasis was NOT present in the recent discussion items window of the site's home page.
column99: Sounds like something still now quite right.
column103: This issue was not verified in the formal QA process but is included in a production version of Sakai (2.1). If you find this is still a problem, please re-open.

column1: [SAK-1054] Limit size of user-chosen icons on project sites
column6: When creating a project site, users can enter a URL of an image they would like displayed in the menu on the left side of their site. If this image is too wide, it can break the layout of the page. Perhaps Sakai could impose a hard limit on how much of an image it will display or scale an image to the correct size.

column10: Title bar not showing up
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
There are two aspects to this.

First, when the "title.jsf" does load correctly. The title bar is actually there. It's just that all the user sees of it is whitespace. The title bar iframe cuts the rest off. I've sent email to Glenn to find out what changed there. In the meantime, I've hacked a workaround for our CSS and let Daisy know, since Samigo is having the same problem.

Second, when the "title.jsf" does not load correctly. There seems to be some not-always-reproducible problem with the dispatcher. Maybe timing related? I'll enter a bug on the framework to get that investigated.
column90: I'm closing this down since we have a temporary workaround and it's subsumed by the larger task SAK-1059 Closed .

column1: [SAK-1047] No warning that delete.own will not work for nested posts
column6:
I gave the access role permission to delete.own within the discussion tool on a particular site. For the access user, the delete option appeared next to all of the appropriate posts, and I was able to delete a post that had no children. However, when I tried to delete one of my posts with replies created by other participants, the following happened:

I selected the delete icon for the first of a series of nested posts; I was only allowed to delete the first post (all of the replies had been created by another user).
I was asked if I would like to go ahead and delete not only the top-level message, but also all of the replies. The warning message did not mention that these replies were created by other users, nor did it tell me that I would be unable to delete this messages.
I clicked on the delete button, and was returned to the discussion view. However, none of the posts had been deleted. There was never a warning message telling me that the action simply wouldn't work.
column10: No warning that delete.own will not work for nested posts
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

column95:
The "Authorizer's Name" is still missing the *. This is a required field as well.

QUESTION:
I have a user, controller (with 'maintain' type) who logged in and tried to create a course worksite. I was thinking since controller already has a user Id in the system, that if I use the controller to create a worksite, I should not need to input the 'Authorizer's Name' since I can input 'controller' in that field and hit continue and it goes through to the next page. Question is, what is the criteria for determining if the 'Authorizer's Name' field needs to be filled in? It now seems that it always does, regardless.
column99:
In IE, no * required field indicator next to Authorizer's name.

Nadine - the Authorizer's name should be required anytime the user manually enters course info (as opposed to only selecting a course from the list). If there is a list (the builds now have one class in the list), and the user selects only from the list, then no authorizer is needed since we know the user is a bona fide instructor for the course. In a real installation, the list is created from classes the user is known to be teaching.
column103:
SIDE QUESTION:

column1: [SAK-1038] Dates are not saved correctly within Dublin Core Metadata
column6:
The code that handles properties of types xsd:date, xsd:time and xsd:datetime are supposed to capture user input and save it in a sakai Time object. The value of the Time object should then be saved as a string in ResourceProperties. That translation is not happening correctly.

The observable behavior from the user perspective is that dates appear as today's date (the default value) when an item's Dublin Core Metadata is displayed after the properties have been updated and re-edited (even if some other date has been specified). Note: the correct date is displayed until the "update" button is clicked.
column10: Dates are not saved correctly within Dublin Core Metadata

column55: This is fixed.

column1: [SAK-1037] Refactor SAMigo's DDL/DML SQL scripts to be in /sam/src/sql directory
column6:
Glenn says that SAMigo's *.sql scripts need to be in /sam/src/sql like the equivalent scripts in legacy. This should be straightforward and will likely require a simple change to project.xml like:

<build>

<!-- java source -->
<sourceDirectory>src/java</sourceDirectory>

<resources>

<resource>
<directory>$

{basedir}

/src/sql</directory>
<includes>
<include>*/.sql</include>
</includes>
</resource>

</resources>

</build>

column1: [SAK-1031] mySql problems
column6:
Hi,

In sakai2/kernel/db/src/webapp/WEB-INF/components.xml database connections are validated using a select statement

select 1 from SYSTEM_USERS

this fails when using mySql.

I can get by this error by changing it to for example 'select 1 from dual'.

But then I get the errors , for example when I try to add a user.

Sql.dbRead: sql: select limit 0 2 SAKAI_USER.USER_ID,SAKAI_USER.EMAIL,SAKAI_USER.FIRST_NAME,SAKAI_USER.LAST_NAME,SAKAI_USER.TYPE,SAKAI_USER.PW,SAKAI_USER.CREATEDBY,SAKAI_USER.MODIFIEDBY,SAKAI_USER.CREATEDON,SAKAI_USER.MODIFIEDON from SAKAI_USER order by SAKAI_USER.LAST_NAME,SAKAI_USER.FIRST_NAMEjava.sql.SQLException: Syntax error or access violation message from server: "You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near 'limit 0 2 SAKAI_USER.USER_ID,SAKAI_USER.EMAIL,SAKAI_USER.FIRST_NAME,SAKAI_USER.L' at line 1"

My mySql doesn't understand the 'limit' part of the query.
I get similar errors at other places.

In my tomcat log , I can also se the following error.

WARN 2005-05-25 11:46:07,111 main_net.sf.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter
SQL Error: 1146, SQLState: 42S02
ERROR 2005-05-25 11:46:07,111 main_net.sf.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter
Base table or view not found message from server: "Table 'sakai.CMN_TYPE_T' doesn't exist"

kind regards

Torben Bruun
column7: Debian linux - Sakai 2.0 from cvs HEAD
column10: mySql problems
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
Hi,

I've added

vendor@org.sakaiproject.service.framework.sql.SqlService=mysql

to my sakai.properties, this helps a lot

On startup to creations of tables from code fails. I've created my sakai mysql db with UTF8, this seems to be a problem
when trying to create these to tables. I've then created them by hand , adding 'DEFAULT CHARACTER SET latin1' - after this
sakai seems to work - I can create new users and new sites.

So I get none of the above errors anymore.

kind regards

Torben Bruun
column90:
Hi,

I've added

vendor@org.sakaiproject.service.framework.sql.SqlService=mysql

to my sakai.properties, this helps a lot

On startup to creations of tables from code fails. I've created my sakai mysql db with UTF8, this seems to be a problem
when trying to create these to tables. I've then created them by hand , adding 'DEFAULT CHARACTER SET latin1' - after this
sakai seems to work - I can create new users and new sites.

So I get none of the above errors anymore.

kind regards

Torben Bruun
column95:
You must set the override the default validation query in sakai.properties. This validation query works both for MySQL and Oracle:

validationQuery@javax.sql.DataSource=select 1 from DUAL

L

column1: [SAK-1030] WS: Within same session, the URL entries stick for News & Web Content items
column6:
When creating a few new sites within the same session, the URLS previously entered for Web Content and News tools are preserved.

To replicate
1. Create a new site with web content and news items. Change the URL's to something other than the default.
2. Create a second site. The URLS that were previously entered display as the default. (The titles of these items do go back to the original/intended default).

If a user were to log out and then log back it, they would not see this behavior.

I discovered this doing some OSPI testing in the 1.5.1 m2 environment and then replicated this on nightly 2 on 5-24-05. Please let me know if you have any questions or need further information.

column1: [SAK-1024] "Creation Time" and "Last Modified" are Dates - no Timestamp at all
column6:
While Editting a resource, the "Creation Time" and "Last Modified" are Dates in month dd,yyyy format. The Spec notes that the correct format for these two fields should be:

mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm:ss PM

Further, the Spec omits the File type and File SIze fields

Another naming issue is that the Term 'Metadata' should read 'Properties':

Should be Dublin Core Properties rather than Dublin Core Metadata

column1: [SAK-1007] View event page is different from spec
column6:
The View Event page has the following differences from the spec:

There is no Description field - the spec has one
There is a Message area at the bottom of the page - the spec does not have a Message area
Instead of "Back to List" (spec) there is just a "Back" button
"Go to Today" is in-line with "Last", "Back" and "Next activity" it should be above and right justified (directly above "Next Activity")
"Go to Today apears on the bottom - inline with "Revise" and "Delete" - according to the spec there should be no "Go to Today" button on this line.
Import is missing from the menu-bar.

column1: [SAK-982] ldap authentification over SSL: bad_record_mac
column6:
When using the edu.amc.sakai.user.JLDAPDirectoryProvider to connect to an Novell NLDAP server over SSL one gets an error:

bad_record_mac

This is aparently due to an SSL inititalisation error and resolvable by adding:

java.security.Security;

to the imports and the line:

Security.addProvider(new com.sun.net.ssl.internal.ssl.Provider());

to the begining of the block where the SSL session is inititalised

column55:

com.sun.net.ssl.internal.ssl.Provider

the first security provider

column1: [SAK-972] Users have 'copy' priviledges in situations where they cannot paste anywhere
column6:
Copy and paste permissions kept track of seperately and on a per item basis so a user may have permission to copy one or more items in the resources yet have no permissions for pasting. They only find out they don't have paste permission after they have copied the item and then recieve an error anywhere they try to paste. This is extremely frustrating for users to get partially through a task to be denied. We should front load this kind of think whenever possible.

In the refactored resources tool coming out for 2.0, they only indication that they can't paste is the the paste action link does not appear under any folders. This will likely add user confusion to the frustration since there isn't a real indication that the links aren't there becuase they don't have permission versus being a system bug.

We need to come up with an elegent way for these permissions to be tied together in some way...or at least for copy to know if there are any paste permissions in tool for that user.
column10: Users have 'copy' priviledges in situations where they cannot paste anywhere
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55: This behavior is analogous to how file systems work in general, however, usually a user can write to at least one directory on their computer.
column90: I committed changes to fix this problem.
column95: fix verified

column1: [SAK-971] When adding an attachment, it's not clear you can go into a folder
column6:
Currently when a user adds attachements from resources (from any the tools that allow it....announcements, discussion, assignments, etc.), it's not clear that they can open folders to get to files within them. They have to click on the folder to open as opposed to using a twiggle (like in resources) to open the folder up. Since we do this in resources there is furhter confusion because of the user's mental model created in resources tool. This should be corrected in the advanced resources tool but I thought it was worth capturing to make sure.

column90: Can we have an update? If this is fixed please note the SVN revisions implementing the fix.
column95:
I don't know if this has been resolved or not.

If a Sakai installation doesn't follow the proper installation procedures, they can get this broken international character behavor. For example, with MySQL it is necessary that the DB be created with UTF-8 as the default character set. For all DBs, its necessary that "URIEncoding=UTF-8" be specified in server.xml. Both of these conditions are documented in the install documentation.
column99: Fix Verified

column1: [SAK-968] wysiwyg toolbar has insert image icon in some tools but not others
column6:
Some tools have the insert image icon in the wysiwyg toolbar (syllabus, quiz/test) and some do not (legacy tools). It was decided to put it in for all tools.

The reason for keeping it out originally was that someone could add an image that resided on some system that might not be available, so the image wouldn't be displayed. However, even with that issue, users are wanting images and it was decided to put it back in. We will add an 'auto upload' feature later, so that an image would be loaded into the site's resources area, and the image URL would point to the image in resources.
column10: wysiwyg toolbar has insert image icon in some tools but not others
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
The new wysiwyg supports multiple "built in" toolbars that the UI developer can select from.
Review the current toolbars and let me know.
column90:
Ed,
can you put the image tag and link icons back into the wysiwyg then? SAK-1512 Closed is related - they were removed from Syllabus wysiwyg to make it consistent with wysiwyg in other tools, but what was actually wanted was to add the image and link capability to other tools. There was an issue with the link showing up in the tool frame rather than a new window which caused problems (which is why it was removed from Syllabus for the time being I guess).
column95:
This is another tricky issue - because the insert image functionality in the WYSIWYG requires additional server-side cooperation.

You could create a Sakai-wide image-uploading-servlet that would get the results of uploading an image and put it into the ContentHostingService. I would recommend checking if this is really a priority though before doing that.

column1: [SAK-967] Title of tools showing up in wrong place + hanging server
column6: Sometimes the nightly CPU hangs at 100% and eventually Sakai becomes unresponsive. Also, on occasion/intermittently the title bar shows up where the content of the tool should be. It is an intermittent problem and no sure-fire reproduction is available.
column7: Observed in developer builds and nightly.
column10: Title of tools showing up in wrong place + hanging server
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column55:
Fix checked into head.

The root of the problem appears to be a Tomcat issue. The Tomcat RequestDispatcher object is not thread-safe. So occasionally when two requests were processed at the same time, the same RequestDispatcher would be used to serve both requests at the same time, causing a hang.

The solution is to create a new RequestDispatcher object for every request, and never to reuse the RequestDispatcher. This will likely fix the server hanging and title bar mixups, however, it will only be clear as time goes by if this really is the issue.
column90: Jon, can you confirm this is fixed, and resolve it? Thanks.
column95: Confirmed fixed on nightly-a4.
column99: Fix checked in as described.
